title: Peaceful Pilgrimage Centre
review: Dargah Sharif is venerated by both Hindus and Muslims and is the tomb of Khwaja Muin-ud-din Chishti. The tomb of the saint is enveloped by a silver railing and a marble screen.The tomb has 11 arches and a Persian inscription.

title: Weekend trip.
review: Arguably the most famous pilgrimage center in Rajasthan.

title: Nice and Calm in the early morning
review: The VIP entry offered was informative and explained us the history of the dargah. Even today dargah staff don't take cash offered to them. Instead they ask you to make the donation for which you get a proper receipt. Within the complex there are many underprivileged people which keep following you for money.

title: Memorizing atmosphere
review: Just visited Ajmer Sharif n 11th March, in total it is a great experience walking u to the Dargah, the urbanity created in the surrounding areas is full of tremendous energy. The Dargah is open to all people from different religious background, which can be felt while walking on the street leading upto the Dargah.

title: Peaceful
review: Hotel organised the visit. We were received and offering the floral chaddar  and prayers were facilitated. Environment is serene and we stayed in the compound of the mazhar  for some time. Quawalli was good but one at Nizzamuddin ki  dargah was more vibrant.

title: Ultimate place and feelings
review: Dargah Sharif is very holy and ultimate place.

title: Powerful, emotional, frenetic experience.
review: This was one of the wildest happenings of my India visit, of my lifetime! Starting a kilometre from the sight, from the closest parking area, we began the walk. A typical India walking experience, sharing the narrow street with every imagineable motorized vehicle, plus cows, beggars, pick pockets (I was warned), but now, this time with an incredible throng of people, a virtual mob, moving toward the Dargah Shariff. Scarves on heads, no shoes, no cameras, no bags allowed. We were completely unfamiliar with the activities and, upon entering the gates, we were joined by a Sufi member who instructed us to purchase a tray of roses and other objects to leave as offerings. Without this humorous fellows presence we would have missed the most exciting part of being here, to enter the Sufi saints tomb. And without his assistance it would have been impossible to enter, as a line of thousands of frantic worshippers pushed, and forcefully mobbed the entranceway. This guide litterally beat and hollered his way, and ours through the entrance. I had never in my life been that jamb packed together with so many people! It was impossible to move, like one solid mass! This, and everything we experienced made for a very powerful and emotional day, even though I really didn't fully understand the history. We made a 500 rupee donation.

title: Nice dargah
review: Ajmer dargah is visited by thousands everyday making it a very very crowded place. Luckily we had help and went in sans any bags , mobiles etc. The majhar was crowded but managed to pray and get out safely.

title: The place of calm
review: Dargah is situated between the hills ,it seems all India visit here with no boundaries of religions. Walk distance from railway station, lots of hotels in all classes ,restaurants according to budget near it, the qwwali bhar de jholi main attraction, two bugs deg(pots presented by Akbar and jahangeer mugal emperor for lunger) are also attract, and we found the calm here

title: Extremely commercialized
review: The Dargah is a historical and lovely place to visit. However, it has become very commercialized. As you enter, you have a whole bunch of touts trying to act as guides, which is really not needed at all. Once you enter the main dargah, two men wave large peacock feathers over your head and back and kept calling to "donate something to God, he will be happy". It is very crowded and we were warned by our driver to be very wary of pickpockets. The sanctum is very very crowded and you have to push your way through. Men inside the railed area beckon to you and then knot a sacred thread round your neck. Of course you are expected to give an "offering" of cash. The sum may be really small, but the atmosphere is really not calm and peaceful. This is really a pity as I was told this was considered a very powerful dargah.

title: Peaceful feeling
review: Visited during business trip with very short time span, Hotel helped us in organising the visit. Need at least an hour to visit in non-peak hours.

title: Nostalgic!
review: The dargah is undoubtedly an experience, however, the authorities must do something about 'money-seeking' attitude of the priests. Need far more cleanliness.

title: Hustle Bustle
review: Commotion, hustling bustling market, tonnes of sohan halwa, smell of red roses, hundreds of non veg varieties, colorful lights, magical azaan, autos, police, beggers and much more is waiting for you just 1 km ahead of the Ajmer railway station (walking). Though its crowded, the whole dargah premise has a kind of magic that makes you aghast.

title: Dargah Shariff
review: visited the shariff on 23 Feb,2017 around 9 to 10 A.m and could get Darshan of Khawaja saheb,Chadar chadaya and mannat mana

title: Not to be missed at Ajmer
review: Dargah Shariff is the main reason for most people who visit Ajmer. The entrance is very crowded. Mostly auto/rickshaws will leave you at a distance from the main gate and you need to walk. One needs to cover their head with handcerchief or special topi (cap) availabel for sale there. Ladies need to put their ordni (scarf) over their head. Shoes are not allowed inside. Hence it is best to visit in small groups. one group guarding the shoes and belonging while the other pay a visit. Ladies and men have separate entrance.

title: A top religious place for Muslims visited by people across all religions
review: The ancient dargah of Saint Moinuddin Chisti is the most revered place in Ajmer.  People from all walks of life visit this place from around the world.  The yearly URS festival attracts huge gathering of people.

title: Must visit
review: This is awesome place to be. You really feel so amazing. The places is very crowded. But then also the place gives you so warmth because of the blessing you get. The manat ka dhaga Aur the way the maulwi puts the blessing in the environment. Also, you can see many people carrying roses bucket on their head along with it chadar. The place really gives somewhat an amazing feeling that you can't actually describe in words.

title: Ajmer Darga sharif
review: Everyone is asking for money. Its crowded and a place buzzing with people.Not at all a peaceful place . I won't go back or suggest someone to go.Fatehpur TheMainuddin Chisti s tomb is much better place

title: Ajmer Sharif Dargah Visit
review: Stayed on dargha bazaar street at hotel royal palace and went walking to dargah which was like two minutes away. Kept the footwear at the right side of main gate for Rs5. I had bought the chaddar and flowers away from dargah after bargaining and went in avoiding all the touts and khadims offering you free help. I was told once you talk to the khadims they will make you buy stuff from their shop at high prices and then demand money for their services too.

title: A must visit place
review: I visited this place with my family. Many reviews will tell you many negative things, don't pay any heed to it. Here are few things which may help. Go from Delhi Gate side (Parking is available for Rs. 100/-, its safe). Take a Guide (09829819768 - Saiyed Chisti - we took him as our guide charges is as per your wish, he is a very soft spoken and nice person). Keep your wallet, bags, watch, and any valuables in your car/hotel. While going inside please keep your attitude and proud and "jaanta hai main kaun hoon" ("you know who I am") type dialogues outside along with your shoes...

title: Holly experience
review: You feel very calm and connected with the god.. As in all places in India.. watch your pockets and mobile phone...

title: A totally spiritual atmosphere.. that makes you feel blessed
review: Great spiritual place, but the crowds could be managed better.. also needs more facilities for women, children and elderly.. gets crowded on special & chatti days, so avoid those days if you can. Overall, a must visit place in Ajmer.

title: must visit place
review: dargah shariff is a must visit place for every tourist coming to ajmer, holy place but be careful from pickpocket.

title: Quiet and Peaceful
review: It was a nice experience. The place was clean and not crowded.

title: Dargha shariff... The holy dargha..
review: Dargha shariff is located in Ajmer, Rajasthan around 2km from the railway station. We can get a cab and reach almost one kilometer upto the dargha. After that many riskshaws are around who may charge you upto 100 to reach the gate. The dargha is open 24 hours a day and beware of niy keeping any of your valuables with you and even if you are keeping some of them, secure it tightly. Pick pocketing and beggars are so much around the dargha. Don't start giving money to anyone who meet you on the way which will make you land in trouble till you return.

title: Divine Experience
review: Well words can fall short when you have to describe about this place, the best place in the city where people from all religions come with faith.

title: An awful horrible experience!
review: We were warned of all the commercialism of this supposedly religious place; the chaos and crowds don't help.  We got accosted by a very persistent and aggressive man who totally harassed us from the start.  We told him very nicely that we just wanted to have a peaceful look around and take in the auspicious atmosphere in and to please leave us alone.  He kept following us with a devious intent.  When we got inside and about to enter the main part, he raced across the person at the entrance and told him not to let us in as we were not abiding with the system.  So we were told to leave.

title: Not the easiest to visit
review: Dropped off by driver near entrance,  leaving us a few hundred metres to walk through the muslin market street. Not the easiest walk as their were quite a few amputees, deformed bodies on the ground.

title: Holy shrine, people trying to dupe you at every step
review: Good place to visit. It is a holy place frequented by locals and tourists. Just be careful of people trying to dupe you. There will so called Khadims, some other locals will try to help you, show you around. But finally they are trying to dupe you. Even inside of shrine, people openly ask you to put money. If you do not put, they shout.

title: Emotional visit
review: I am very emotional when ever I am here at the Dargah of Khawaja Garib Nawaz. It is very touching moment when the cloth from the Mazar which is called Chadar  is put on the head and the pray is performed.

title: Visit
review: Dargah Sarif is better place in Ajmer for darshan and historical visiting and also is good place for hondu Muslim brotherhood

title: Legacy ruined by people
review: Its commendable to see the place as a phenomenal piece of architecture with some great designs and patterns but sadly the commercialisation has taken over this place too as it has over other pilgrimages. There are too many people despite whatever the time it is which makes it absolutely unsafe for your valuable belongings. Too many people come in your way and brush up against you. There are people trying to con you into buying everything in the name of God. Despite that, the vibe of the place is excellent. I think its the positive faith of the people which drives them to this place from too far across. Its their faith which creates a positive aura around. Just be careful and take care of your belongings. Also, please avoid donating money to everyone who asks you to. Remember, God doesnt want or need your money so dont give it in his name.

title: Holy place...
review: It's a very very crowded place. Even the approach road is taken over by localites and force you to park the car there for Rd.150/-. Unheiginic conditions around. But being a holy place people don't mind. Big big vessels donated by Mughal emperor are worshipped here.

title: Ajmer is all out Dargah shariff !!
review: Ajmer is all out Dargah shariff !! Dargah holds significance due to Islamic scholar - Moinuddin Chishti...

title: Revered Place
review: A very revered shrine. Visited by anyone who visits Ajmer. Crowded. Approach through the market. Have to walk through the market to reach.

title: Tourists avoid this place, not safe.
review: This place is very unsafe for family. Local people harassing the tourists. In other places even if people come to you, no one will touch you. Here that also will happen. Local people argue with you and if you do not but from their shop, they start scolding you. Avoid this place unless you want to take a risk.

title: First visit to the shrine
review: The shrine is a 'must do' for anyone visiting Ajmer. Located in a part where time seems to have stood still, it's clean and the entire process of darshan well organised and hassle free. The feel is one of peace and tranquility. There is no need of employing the services of anyone for darshan and be pressured to spend money on offerings or prayers.

title: Visit Dargah shariff with family
review: Very famous place for every body, but the atmosphere is not good.

title: Mesmerising
review: One of its kind of experience. Its quite serene and the whole atmosphere inside the dargah is so mesmerising.

title: Ajmer Sharif Dargah
review: The dargah of Moinuddin Chishti is known as Ajmer Sharif Dargah or Ajmer Sharif.  It is an international waqf. Managed by Dargah Khwaja Saheb Act, 1955 of the government of India.It is about 2 to 3 Kms from Ajmer Railway Station.

title: Dargah of Great Sufi Saint
review: Dargah Shariff is the tomb of the great sufi saint - Khawaja Moinuddin Chisti. It is located very close to the Ajmer Railway station. The dargah is always very crowded. People belonging to all faiths and religions visit the dargah to get the blessings of the sufi saint.  Try to visit during the early hours of the day. Make sure to locate the shoe stand (it's little far off) and baggage counter and deposit your foot wear and camera.  You need to cover your head with a cloth while entering the innner santum of the dargah.
one of the most peaceful pilgrimage, the ambiance is perfect, better to visit early morning to get peace of mind!!

title: Peaceful pilgrimage
review: Feel good when reach there. Best time to visit in dargah is early morning. Dargah is one of the biggest religious place in india.

title: Experience Faith
review: Ajmer-e-shareef is crowded, there are all the chances that you'll be pick-pocketed, people try to sell chadar or flowers (sometimes a bit too forcefully) but none of it really matters. People visit this place because of their faith in the Supreme. As you wander and listen to the religious Islamic music played live, you experience emotions. Doesn't matter whether you are a Muslim or a Christian, I think people should visit dargah to marvel at the power faith has.

title: Nice place but be careful of the crazy traffic and local thiefs !!
review: It is ideally supposed to be a holly place but be careful of people asking for donations OR luring you into giving you a free tour of the Dargah but you end up paying a donation "with a receipt". There is no need for any of this. You can just deny upfront and get inside of the dargah. They collect money for various reasons and dont feel obliged to give if you dont want to.

title: Good place for some intellectual place to get close to the almighty
review: Its is good place to visit but it is a little dirty. You need not purchase anything from outside vendors. Flowers and everything are available inside the premises of dargah and also beware of the pickpocketers

title: Must visit when in Ajmer
review: A must visit place when in Ajmer. Plan your visit so that you don't encounter a lot of chaos and public. Has a mediating effect.

title: Faith on display in abundence
review: This Dargah is the resting place for one of the renowned Sufi fakir Chisti saheb.

title: Most popular location to visit in Ajmer
review: It is known for it religious significance as dargah of the Islamic scholar, Moinuddin Chishti. Its also the most popular tourist attraction. The entrance is through a huge gate called Buland Darwaza, beyond which foot wear is not allowed. Photography is allowed inside. It is open from 6 AM to 9 PM. Offering rose petals and decorated sheet (chaddar) is a common practice.

title: This Dargah is a must-see place in Ajmer!
review: It was quite a different experience - our first visit to a Sufi shrine.  We walked through the crowded, narrow alleys.  It was extremely crowded.  We picked up a basket of flowers and offered it at the shrine - and received blessings from the priest there with the holy cloth placed over our heads.  It was a completely new experience for us.

title: Divine experiance
review: We visited on 8 jan 2017 it was a divine experience , a great internal peace and very nice people everywhere. Timely cleaning everywhere and no heavy rush and everything was well managed

title: Peaceful and calm if you pick your visiting hours wisely
review: A word of advise to fellow travellers. Try to visit in the early hours of the morning, if you manage to get back before 9 am you are going to have an amazing experience. Beware of beggers and pick pocketers. We parked our car at the railway station and walked from there, it took only 15 mins to reach while the autowala was asking 400 bucks to drop us there. Alsi deposit your donations for the Dargah to the authorized Khadims and get the recipet for it.

title: Holy place to visit
review: We went to the Dargah in the evening walking from Delhi gate. It is a very crowded place with lots of shops on both sides of the pathway. Lots of street food options and shopping avenues are available on the way to dargah. Many agents will try to convince you to go for their paid service. Plz do not do so. At the entrace Dargah Khadims will be available to guide you to reach the main dargah. Just follow the path and you will easily reach inside. Its a holy place with its own charm. Felt very peaceful. Must visit place.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Dargah Shariff of Ajmer is very famous place in India.This Dargah Shariff is attractive for all tourist.Everyone who came ajmer must go Dargah Shariff.This is holy place .must go everyone.

title: DEVINE
review: Nice place but management requires some changes

title: Holy place but not clean and good to visit.
review: Only one time visit for an atheist. Many ritual activities which you don't like or avoid visiting this place in future.

title: Do visit to experience a religion
review: This is a very beautiful place. Like any other religious place it's crowded and needs more arrangements to handle the crowd.

title: Main attraction of Ajmer
review: Whether you are visiting the place for religious purpose or for general toursim, this is the main attraction of the city of Ajmer

title: Divine Holy Place
review: Visiting Rajasthan, this is surely magical and divine place, if you visit once u will love to visit this place everytime u go rajasthan. Peace of mind, experiencing magical power, listening sufi kawali's live is magical and different experience.

title: Holy place
review: Moinuddin chisti dargah holy place attraction of ajmer.you walk in samall bazar after you reach dargah ..

title: Dargah Shariff Visit
review: Visit to Dargah Shariff - best time to visit early morning for people avoid crowd but for shopping purpose at near by markets best time is the evening hors

title: an early morning prayer is always pleasant
review: it was a short and sweet trip to Ajmer and at holy dargah didn't we felt like divine. it was a short walk from city railway station

title: Dargah Sharif a must visit in ajmer
review: A shrine that calms, soothes and offers a peaceful religious setting. Mostly devotees offer 'chaddar's & gulags.  Also must listen to their famed qawwalis. Dargah Sharif blessings indeed provided a positive feeling.

title: Dargah Shariff......"Ajmer"
review: Truly Holy place. Dargah is beautiful place to visit. The moment you entered Dargah fragrance of roses is all over. Pin drop silent inside Dargah.

title: Worth a visit.
review: As a sacred place it's a must visit. Clean and well maintained. Several hotels are situated around which can make the visit an ease.

title: Pilgrimage--may be, Travelling--don't think so
review: A sacred place, you should come for pilgrimage. But difficult to find peace as the place is very crowded and not organized. Full of vendors and beggars outside. Vendors push for buying religious places and in time they throw insulting comments if you don't buy as it happened to us.

title: A spiritual feast
review: I had thought about visiting this place long time back and it was a wish fulfilled. Dargah of a muslim saint and philanthropist who taught love, universal brotherhood and religious tolerance and is being followed by people of all religions. It was indeed a spiritual feast.

title: Sacred Place
review: It is a pilgrimage centre for the shrine of the Sufi Saint Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti. It was done during Prithviraj Chauhan (1149–1192 CE), of the Chauhan dynasty, ruled Ajmer.

title: The Mecca for the faithfuls
review: If you wish to see the confluence of the various faiths cutting accross the barriers of the religion - you should come here to see the complete faith of the people who are Hindus , Muslims , Sikhs , Jains . All come here to seek the blessings of the ever so kind Muslim Saint called Garib Navaz meaning  'friend of the poor ' . As you ener the holy place after crossing the main gate - the feeling of being close to ' him' is over powering . There are milling crowds at any given time of the year /. Day . But , once inside the shrine you are aware of his presence and his grace - tears of joy will well up in the eyes . There is no entry fee . But , avoid bring bullied by the workers who act as priests - ready yo fleece you . You can offer your humble offerings at the main entrance to the shrine and seek a receipt . A word of caution - several pick pockets look for easy prey . If you have car - better to park at the city railway station and take an auto whowill take and bring you back for couple of hundred rupees . Pay after you have returned from the holy Dargah . . Must visit . His call has to come first .  .

title: Must Visit
review: This was my secobd visit and I felt great. The only problem is beggers outside in the street. Quite irritating. They must do something to control them.

title: divine experience
review: We were taken to the Darga Shariff by one Khadimji (servant or sevak of the Sufi Saint) on early morning in December during our stay there.  He was polite, well spoken (All the khadims come from the same lineage of the Sufi Saint) and well mannered.  He took us inside the Dargah, prayed for us and helped us soak in the spirit of this divine place and its  ambience.  there were Kawalli singers who were singing fervently in front of the gate of the Saint's resting place or the mazahar and it was absolutely beautiful. And all of these, for no exchange of money, only for serving the Sufi Saint. If you feel like, you can offer some money to the Khadimji but there is absolutely no demand.

title: Unity
review: Walking through a crowded way ended to a huge gate and I was so confused then  a familiar face come to me and asked do you want to come inside? I found myself in a tour inside the area with a sweet conversation and I was thinking what a great idea that inspit of  what people believes ,they are all welcome ...it was eternity bar with sky roof but a short wall....

title: A most cherished place and a must visit while in Ajmer
review: Had a chance to visit this place and was very much excited as I had heard a lot about this place. However like all such shrines in India this place is populated with over zealous keepers of shrine. They exhort people to donate and one can feel the coercion in the air. There are multiple beggars along the route who tag and touch you and feel sought of creepy. The whole episode turns you to be more concerned about your personal security and safety rather than enjoying the relevance of the shrine. As you approach people will offer you to be your guide but no such guide is needed. People will try to sell you Chaadar but better to buy from a Government owned shop near the shrine itself.

title: Holy place
review: Holy place which unite the religion. Saw people from all religion coming there. Went there in the afternoon so main Dargah was closed at that time. Waited for few hours before it open. But it is definitely a go place.

title: Attraction of Ajmer
review: Ajmer is well known for Dargah Shariff, a well place for all religion ,surrounded by small and every type of shops no doubt very crowded.I think every one should visit in life and have blessings.

title: Devotees are never less
review: So many devotees visit this place, to much chadars and flowers and money devotees donate here. No one allowed without cap or hanki on head.

title: Pious and excellent religious place.
review: Well, whatever one can say will be less about this place. Located 1.5 kms away from Ajmer Railway Station. Autos and Ola services are available. Way to the dargah is filled with shops, beggars and pickpockets. Be aware and be safe from all of them. After a certain point inside the campus videography or photography is not allowed inside the dargah campus. One can donate chaadar, money etc at the main dargah. Once you reach this place you will feel an energy rushing through your veins. It is a must visit place for people from all the religion.

title: At KGN
review: A must visit place for everyone. There is never a quiet moment but there is definitely a tranquility even at most populous moments of the say. The sight of the majestic white washed dome and the golden crown is one which definitely must be beheld. Followers of all religions can be seen at the Dargha. It is a harmonious place with peace and is suitable for people of all ages. There are also several stalls in the Dargha to purchase trinkets and flowers.

title: Place of beliefs..
review: Good place to watch.beutiful atmosphere.

title: Ajmer Dargah Shareef
review: Best Place to visit as it is a holy place which give the pure feeling to the heart and mind .You will find the peace full atmosphere .

title: A decent dargah
review: Its a religious place, pretty clean but if you do not have experience visiting religious places, then just know that paying here for anything is strictly optional. If anyone says otherwise, move away.

title: Jo Mango Ohi Pao @ Dargah Sariff Ajmer
review: If you go and stay at Ajmer you must go at see the Grand and Famous  Moin-ud-din Chisti Dargah Sariff. You please take the "Chaddar" and cover.

title: sacred place of rajasthan
review: this place is famous all over word & so many devotees comes from all over india . to offer chader at this place is most common & most of devotees comes on foot too.this is place celebrate URSH every year too in which so many devotees participate. baba gives blessing to all & more importantly hindu & muslim all comes to dargah evry day. v must pray brotherhood maintain in all castes in india .

title: With ease could offer our prayers
review: Our first visit. Every step we could get the help and guidance to offer the prayers. Everyone is welcome.

title: A Sacred Place for people from all Religion.
review: Ajmer Dargha Shariff..Situated in the Heart of the City Ajmer..A beautiful place with lot of devotees from across the globe. The best part of the place is that people from different religion come to seek blessings with same sentiments as that of a Muslim. Please be extremely careful if you're caring cellphones, camera, purse or any valuable belongings (as we were advised) since the place is too crowded. There are many shops outside and inside dargha selling flowers and chaddars for offering. I must mention the place is a visual treat. However there are many who purely try to extort money from the visitors including inside dargha who give blessings only if you offer money which I found very insensitivity.

title: Divine and Blessed
review: Went recently and did not find much crowd. Darshan was easy and smooth.since my hotel arranged a priest for us to visit Dargah, it was easy. However, you should not get carried by road side guides and vendors and shall plan through known sources. It's an ancient Dargah of Sufi saint Khwaza Moinuddin Chishty where Akbar used to visit every year. It has two big cooking vessels which is believed to be donated by Akbar and Shahjahan.

title: Ajmer Sharif
review: Very  peace full place but too crowded. The approach road is very small and dirty. This place needs to go in "proper" hands for care and maintenance.

title: have faith and you will get it
review: Must go with a clear mind and the Garib Nawaz would listen to you.   Need to be careful with your valuables while visiting inside .

title: The tomb of Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti
review: First review here. :)

title: A holy place not to be missed!!
review: The place is located in the heart of Ajmer city, somewhat crowded but organised. The beggars outside are a botheration though. One needs to walk a bit to reach the Dargah proper, the approach road is lined with shops selling offering materials. The whole visit along with offerings can be complete within an hour on a not so crowded day. A must place for visit when visiting Ajmer.

title: Peaceful
review: It is a very nice and peaceful place, better to visit during early hours when there is less crowd. We visited around 6AM.

title: we visit this sufi mosque
review: we visited this sufi mosque, all though its was very crowed, very narrow roads to reach. but as soon as we reached we felt something good.

title: was almost empty because of the currency issues, never had such wondeful time at the Dargah before
review: this is all about faith & belief..you go there once and you are a regular.it will help you get rid of negativity.

title: Holy place
review: This is the dargah of the sufi saint Khawaja Moinuddin Chisti. It is located about a kilometer away from the Ajmer railway station.  This is a crowded place visited by people of all religions.  Few things to keep in mind is to visit it early to avoid long wait in queues and Shoe stands are located a little far away. Hence, make sure to find them and keep your shoes there. Camera is not allowed within the dargah premises.  Seek the blessings of the great Sufi Saint and enjoy peaceful atmosphere there.

title: Dargah: a very sacred place
review: Though the Dargah is immensely crowded and people from all religions can go there to pray, it attracts people again and again from all over the world. Car doesn't go till the gate and you have to walk uphill to visit the Dargah. Auto can take you a bit higher up from where you have to walk through the inside lawns of the houses nearby to reach via the shortest route. So people who have problems walking should give a second thought to go up there.

title: Beautiful Dargah filled with greedy people
review: The Dargah is located between the packed, very tiny streets of Ajmer. The Dargah is truly beautiful.

title: Holy place after Mecca
review: This is a must to see place. Situated in the middle of a busy market which can only be accessed by a rickshaw at  a nominal fee. Once inside the area, all have to take their shoes off, wash hands to enter the holy place. We bought the offerings which were nominal in price, made our donations and entered the shrine. A busy place where all can receive blessings and can stay in the shrine for as long as one wanted too. Lots of chuniya were used to cover the shrine and  as the layers off them increase they are taken off and resold to next set of devotees. A place worth a visit but beware of pickpockets as they are busy in these crowded area.

title: Only thif people in dargha
review: Me and my family visit dargha . Worst experiance in my life.. people are so rude they dnt help u . They only need money . Local shop they dnt sell there good is mrp price they always charges extra money for goods. The market is so dutty. Im sorry but there is such a sham to vist this place.

title: Soul searching at Dargah Sharif
review: My sister and I went to this place in the evening. This was the last stop of our trip. It was crowded, but we had amazing experience. We got a chance to enjoy the Kawali session at Dargah Sharif. The experience was out of this world. Since it was also the full moon day (when the moon was closest to earth), the evening was something to remember by.

title: Heavenly!!
review: Located in between the packed small streets of Ajmer, the Dargah is truly heavenly. We walked through the streets which are packed with food,  flowers and sweet sellers.

title: Worth visit
review: Beautiful n peaceful place . But People here are looting the pilgrims they have made the Dargah a business hub.

title: A divine place
review: As soon as you enter the dargah you start getting goosebumps. This place is magical. I am a Hindu and I felt the holiness of this place.

title: Calm and serene place
review: Visited the dargah with my parents, wife and 3 yr old. My first visit to a dargah and had a nice visit.

title: A Holy place to visit...!!!
review: Dargah at Ajmer is very precious and there are many Dargah in India but this is exceptional and there are number of people visiting everyday.

title: Over crowded
review: The Dargah Shariff was over crowded . But I think that's how it's supposed to be with people from round the world coming to visit.

title: peaceful place
review: We want to pay our  respects to Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti,. The Charisma of this place makes visiting this holy shrine a must .We experienced the calm and serenity that is characteristic of such a place. This is what I told my friend - The essence of this place is still steeped with an extreme high sense of spirituality.  It’s as if he is still there and alive in the hearts of the many thousands of dedicated people who were there. I too felt extremely uplifted. Unlike the chaos outside inside is calm and serene with everyone there dedicated to His love .A special moment for us

title: Great Experience and spirituality !
review: We visited Ajmer sharif Sarah during our visit to Jaipur and Ajmer. Any trip to Ajmer is incomplete if you do not go to This famous dargah. A confluence of all religions and strata of society, rich and poor all come to this place for prayers. This dargah has been a symbol of harmony and spirituality for last many hundred years and you can feel that once you are inside the dargah. Must see if you are in Ajmer.

title: The Badshah of Wali Allahs in Hindustan (old card)
review: You really feel the spirit of Hazrat Syed Khwadja Gareeb Naweez. He surely helps everyone who comes to his Dargah. Doesn´t matter what your religion is.Just believe in his power given to him by Allah swt and respect him. Nowadays u see pigs etc. walking free in Ajmeer. Astagfirullah!

title: Good Visit
review: Mine visit was complimentry by my hotel and thus i got a khadim and VIP entry so it was all good but as mentioned by fellow traveller, every one would want to make money from you. Beware and do not be an emotional fool. Let god alone decide our intentions and not humans.

title: Pilgrimage
review: Dargah Sharif provides English speaking guides. You may acquire a guide through the local hotels. The best time to visit is in the morning around 6 am when it is not so congested.

title: The Best Place in all Hindustan to pray.
review: The Dargah Sharif in Ajmer is of Hazrat Khwaja Moinuddin Chishty R.A. who is the biggest Aulia in all Hindustan. The Dargah Sharif Situated at 1 km. from Railway Station and 3 Kms. from Bus Stand. The Dargah has the biggest prayer area and with all the service i.e. water, stay, food (langar).

title: Greedy people all around a place so heavenly

Please note that I am not against any religion or faith and this review is solely against people like these who make it a place not worthy a visit. It is hard time that authorities take stricter actions on maintaining the decorum of such a place.

title: Seek the blessings of the great sufi saint
review: Located in close proximity to the Ajmer Railway station, the Ajmer Sharif dargah is visited by people of all faiths from far and wide.  We visited during the early morning hours and found the dargah very crowded. We were in the queue for 1.5 hours before reaching the inner sanctum which houses the tomb of the sufi saint.  It was a bliss to be in the dargah of the great sufi saint - Khawaja Moinuddin Chisti.

title: religious place
review: Must Visit Dargah Shariff AjmerAfter sepnding one night in Pushkar Adventure Desert Camp we visit the another must visit place of ajmer..very holy place. The road leading to dargah is scarily crowded. not only muslim people but people from other caste also used to visit this holy dargah. Bath before you go it will make you feel better. whenever you visit ajmer sharif , do take blessings of moulana's who sat at mazar.

title: Spiritual
review: This place, the resting place of a Sufi Saint, is one of the holiest destinations for people of different faiths. It is said that even the Mughal emperor Akbar came here to offer prayers and ask for the blessing of a son to be born to his wife. It is historic and coming here gives one a feeling of peace.

title: Inka kya kehna

title: Dargah darshan.
review: I went Ajmer for dargah darshan. My visit was good. I recommend not to take luggage or too many belonging to dargah as this place is very crowded and have to walk a lot. Try to buy things in limited way there. Do not contact beggars there, they will not let you walk properly.

title: Dargah Shariff
review: Dargah Sharif, venerated by both Hindus and Muslims is the tomb of Khwaja Muin-ud-din Chishti. He was a Sufi saint who came from Persia and devoted his life to the service and welfare of the poor and downtrodden. Constructed in several stages, the gate with silver doors forms the entrance of the site. The actual tomb of the saint is enveloped by a silver railing and a marble screen. This has been made of marble and a gold plated dome.

title: A must visit place...
review: Dargah Shariff - one of the most important Sufi Dargah of the world. If one visits Ajmer, one must go and pay respect to the Dargah. It is said that Akbar the Great got the blessings of Gharib Nawaaj and was blessed with a son.Big vessels donated by Akbar and Jahangir are used even now for cooking. Thousands of devotees across religion visit to seek His blessings.

title: Good but very crowded

Then we walked towards the famous Dargah & were followed by many auto-walas asking us for drop & return. But we didn't took any.

title: It's all about the money
review: People come here to pray in believe and faith of Allah, but the locals working in the Darga are only trying to force you to pay money for anything and everything. You can easily pray yourself, but they insist they will pray for you instead and in return bluntly ask you to pay up. Give whatever money u wish to give. Well I didn't wish to give any kind of money in return of prayers! I prayed for myself, I don't need somebody else to pray for me. Even if someone else prays for me I would want it to be heartfelt and I don't need to pay anybody for their blessings apron me. I believe in Allah and have faith in him but I don't think I'd ever like to return to the Darga unless God wills. People are trying to make money using the name of God. I'm extremely disappointed

I have alao seen them snatching money from the hands oa a woman who was putting it in the offerings box. sad. They give such a bad name to the place. The trustees need to regulate this but i know this has been going on for decades. Not sure if this will change by some good trustee standing up and regulating this.

title: A religious destination for people of all faiths, specially Muslims
review: The Dargah of Saint Moinuddin Chisti is a revered place for people of all religions, specially Muslims who visit the shrine in large numbers throughout the year.  The place is very crowded and congested and people coming to this place for the first time should be careful about touts. The area leading to the Dargah is infested with pick pocketers and people seeking alms. They can embarrass you by following you for more than half a kilometer. If you give alms a big crowd will envelop you and you will have a tough time.  The Dargah is closed in the afternoon for sometime and the best time visit is early morning or late evening when the crowds are manageable.  Avoid namaz hours.

title: Suffocated
review: Visited on the morning of 12th July 16, was so crowded , less than 2km stretch from railway station to the dargah is so narrow that there r frequent jams,autos are wide and only autos r cycle rickshaws play on this road, they ask rs100 for under 2kms, once u align,have to walk about 500mts to reach the gate of dargah, once inside the dargah there r multiple entrances to the main tomb of Hazarath Garib Nawaz,there r ques where both ladies and gents stand , the doors of the tomb r very small and we literally got crushed, suffocated,the management of the holy Dargah r doing nothing to streamline, there r no marked entrances and exits the police were seen found nothing to tame this.High time the dargah management and district administration wake up and streamline the rectifiable important issues before there is any untoward incident.

title: Tomb of Khawaja Moinuddin Chisti's - A saint revered  by people of all faiths
review: Ajmer Sharif Dargah is a magnificent tomb of Sufi Saint Khawaja Moinuddin Chisti. People from all faiths visit this place to seek blessings of the great Saint. The Dargah is about 1.5 kms from the Ajmer Railway Station.  We visited during the morning hours around 10 am. It was crowded then.  Camera is not allowed inside the dargah. Men and Women have to enter the dargah with their head covered.  Hence, it will be useful to keep a handkerchief to cover the head. Despite the crowd and a little noise, I found tranquility and peace in the dargah. He were able to reach the main sanctum and complete our prayers within one hour.

title: Ajmer Shariff,Dargah Shariff
review: Ajmer Sharif Dargah, Ajmer Dargah, Ajmer Sharif or Dargah Sharif is a sufi shrine of sufi saint, Moinuddin Chishti located at Ajmer, Rajasthan, India. The shrine has the grave of the revered saint, Moinuddin Chisti.

title: Must visit in Ajmer
review: I went to this dargah last week only which was on my radar for quite some time. I went there in the evening around 8 pm and stayed there for almost an hour. For the visit to this dargah, people come from different places. It was nice.

title: Please Visit Once your life time: Dargah Shariff Ajmeer India."Khajjwa Mainuddin Chisty Rasul a Karim".
review: its was great & I was extremely impressive to see the kinds of gathering at Dargah Shariff . Ajmeer. Most peaceful place in earth with its nature spiritual touch.

title: Great history, miserable present
review: This should be a great place to visit. I had wanted to go for years, and finally when I was with friends from Ajmer. At first it was interesting, but even in India I have never seen such high-pressure begging. The "pir" who ran the place demanded some money. I gave him a little and he threw it back at me, replete with assorted curses, demanding more. when I refused, I was surrounded by henchmen. It was, frankly, intimidating. My exit was blocked by these goons, but eventually got out of the place. I felt terrible for my friends who had brought me, as they were thoroughly embarrasses by such boorish behavior.

title: Powerful,peaceful and calming

The management was very active as they were putting all there efforts to control the crowd. Must visit place in Ajmer.

title: Horrible experience
review: An absolutely disgusting experience. If you want to go and see how horrible humans can be, go and visit this place. Innocent lambs are dragged by their ears to be slaughtered, their screams heard in the dirty filthy streets outside the mausoleum. If you can turn a blind eye to their suffering and actually make it inside you will see avarice and greed everywhere as religious zealots pray on innocent folks insecurities in the name of religion and faith and it is difficult not to come out and feel that you have been robbed in the name of god!

title: amazing

Usual problem of people pushing you to donate money is common everywhere. If you sit in a corner and not interact with anyone, you will find the peace you are looking for.

title: Chaos
review: Not for the faint hearted. Last time I felt like this was when I was in a cage with 7 lions.

title: Short visit to Dargah Sharif
review: You should take out little time if you are anywhere near Ajmer or in Ajmer and visit this holy place. It's situated in between a hustling market and once you enter inside the premises it'd calm and beautiful!

title: Less Crowded due to Ramzan
review: This was the second time we visited the dargah. This time around we finished with our thanks and prayers in less than an hour.

title: Spiritually uplifting
review: Visited in January 2016. It is really an experience to witness the spirituality of the Dargah Shariff and you stand and wonder how the diversity of Indians of different religions pay homage to this saint-to-all-and-for-all. It appears as if there is activity night and day. We were offered the free complimentary tour guide from our hotel but would much have preferred to go by ourselves, as we later realized. The guides are offering a service whereby they take you to their selected traders to purchase the chaddar, flowers, incence and niaz etc. - they obviously get a kickback. It's all up to you if you want to be guided or DIY and purchase the before- mentioned cheaper from the many traders outside the Dargah  If you are travelling without a pre booked accommodation, it could be worthwhile to get nearby the Dargah area and inspect one of the many small hotels situated nearby. You could probably go and first inspect the many hotels' suitability and convenience first and then negotiate for a price in person. Also, note that you cannot take cameras or video cameras inside the Dargah precinct, but you are allowed to take your smartphone inside to capture your memories.

title: Heavenly feeling

You can make an offering of a chadar and rose flowers in a basket. Once inside the helpers open and spread the chadar on the dargah and you pray silently. Since it was empty we could stay inside for as long as we chose. We consider this as real lucky to have visited at this time of the year.

review: “It is an ancient, beautiful city full of interest, both historical and architectural; its gay busy bazars and its old houses with carved fronts, some of which are among the finest in India, giving added attractions to its superb situation. The Dargah  in Ajmer Sharif, is followed and equally popular amongst not only muslims but hindus and other religions also .

title: ""Mere kwaja""
review: i vested there with my friend . ajmer sarrif dargah is situated in main city of ajmer. so many rush there in raod and also dargah. i am a hindu but i regularly go there bez . ajmer sarrif is symbol unity of muslim and hindus. ..nice place to see. many people across world go there..very famous ....i humble request no miss to go there....

title: Religious place of pilgrimage.
review: This is a place of faith, belief and holiness. People of all religions come here praying for miracles. Big crowds and very difficult to walk.   God bless us all.

title: 13 June 2016 visit
review: I visited Dargah on 13 June 2016. This time it was ramzan month.  So it was not too much congested.  Blissful feeling when I was here.

title: Foreigner myself walked around comfortably
review: Crowded with worshipers and devotees.

title: Very nice
review: The place too crowded but still one feels peaceful after sitting there.The  journey by Auto rickshaw was very adventurous but we liked it.

title: A Holy place must visit
review: One of the holiest places to visit but the charm is soon worn out due to the poor management, touts which are right into the shrine.

title: Must Avoid if visiting as a tourist
review: Dargah Shariff is the shrine of a Sufi Saint from the time of Indian Rajput King 'Prithiviraj Chauhan'. The Shrine lies at the top of a small hill which is now covered with human colonies built on it and one needs to walk a couple of kilometres to reach the shrine as vehicles are not allowed on the main Shrine road.

title: Divine Experience
review: We had a hassle free experience much better than.our precious visit eight years back.  The touts are less aggressive and even the beggars less demanding.  Despite the continuous crowds the entry the dargah went.smoothly. At every point we were reminded to take care of our personal belongings.  Plenty of shopping can be done outside the premises.

title: A Holy place to see
review: if you are travelling to the city, you must ensure visiting dargah sarif, such a great monument, a holy place to visit, its better to travel in the morning and evening hours.

title: Calling of Dargah Sharif
review: Its said that you get to visit Dargah Sharif only when you are called upon. And the rating here is purely based on the holiness of the place. People from all walks of life come and offer prayers at this shrine of the beloved Sufi saint. Needless to say its a very busy, crowded place that needs to be maintained better.

title: Dargah Shariff
review: Good place to visit. Cleanliness ,facilities and management despite of huge crowd was comendable. I recomend this place to everybody.

title: Not a place to be visited by Westerns.
review: We tried to visit the Dargah Shariff mosque and we were highly unwelcomed at the parking lot by men staring and shouting at us although I was dressing conservative western clothes (a black long skirt covering half of my calves, no the ankles though, and a light shawl also partially covering my hair). After couple minutes out of the car these men kept shouting at our driver and although we did not understand their words, clearly they were offensive so we decided get back in the car and leave. As our Indian driver said to me:  "the problem is not how dress, but the eyes of those looking at you". Very disappointing and sad experience....

title: Excellent pilgrim
review: Excellent pilgrim, but beware of people around you, they will loot you. Everything is linked to money, even water also. So, keep your wallet at home and go.

title: Emperor of Emperor - Hind e Wali
review: it is said, one who go to Darbar of Khawja Moinuddin Chisti, Ajmeri ( Sufi Saint) is actually by his permission and wish. Emperor like Akbar also bowed before Him .. He actually governs India. Sounds amazing? isn't it? Yes it is true. People believe that His prayer to Almighty changes the destiny of many. In Urs, even President and Prime minister of India offers Chadar to the Shrine. film Stars, Sportsman and even foreign dignitaries offer prayers and seek blessing from Him. Its a much visit place in India.Its is holy place where people of different religion and faith.  All are welcome for the blessing.

title: AT THE DOOR STEP OF KHAWAJA
review: visited the dargah on 28.12.2015 evening. The place though located in very interior of the city but spacious inside. feeling blessed at dargah.AS CAMERA WAS NOT ALLOWED INSIDE SO NO PHOTO COULD BE TAKEN

title: Once in a lifetime
review: This is one of the holy shrines in India, where devotees from all casts and religions go with their faith.

title: Must visit place
review: Wat to say about surrounding of dargah Sharif. Everything is very nice. Management is very good in managing heavy trafficking. Must visit place

title: Dargah Shareef khwajah gharib Nawaz
review: Tips to save money:

title: The main purpose behind visiting Ajmer!
review: I visited Ajmer Sharif Dargah last October with two of my friends. It was a magical experience as we could feel the positivity and hope all around us. Must visit place in Ajmer...Pray to the Khwaja and have faith, your wish will definately come true.

title: Holy visit
review: 1 Very crowded place..... Wide range of people visit this holy place coming grom different part of tbe world..... Extremely crowded.

title: Good place with false management
review: We visited the dargah and Hope during our next visit the police staff cares to make their checking as entering the gate, they probably stopped my wife for checking and i had to go and make a announcement that i am not able to find her with my two year daughter,Good Place but very bad management.

title: Best holy place
review: Ajmer sharif khawaja garib nawaz is Best holy place.its good for both religiously and tourism.its heart and hope for the people

title: Dargah Sharif
review: Had geard so much about the place therefore even for my short visit to ajmer i made sure that i visit the dargah... Felt good spending the time at dargah but surroundings needs to be upgraded and management needs to inprove...

title: A great place, seek administrative attention !!
review: A mystical place, the Dargah Sharif, one must visit to know the holiness of the Khwaja Garib Nawaz & the related story.

title: Best of Best
review: Ajmer Shareef Dargah is Hazrat Kwaja Gareeb Nawaz The king of India.Hazrat Kwaja Gareeb Nawaz is Came From Sanjar And Teaching the truth of Islam in Indian people.Alhumdolillah All Indian Muslim Proud to be a Indian because Hazrat Kwaja Gareeb Nawaz is aver Mursheed.

title: For the curious and the believers alike!
review: It's a place worth watching the believers and the faithful. So much of faith on display at a place of worship makes you  believe in the miracles that the faithful talk about. Interesting place, if you happen to be in Ajmer.

title: Cleanse your soul
review: It says, if you're called by the saint, you reach Ajmer. It's true to the core. Visit the blessed courtyard to cleanse your soul.

title: Mazar-e-khwaja Sahab.
review: Very revered place, famous tourist attraction in Ajmer. There is a strong belief  that your wishes are fulfilled here.  People return to thank Khwaja Sahab when they succeed in life.

title: Dargah Sharif...Serene place
review: Always wanted to visit and finally made it :) Its very crowded yet so calm...People from all walks of life and all classes traverse the same path....

title: Visit Dargah Sharif
review: Awesome experience at Dargah, you really feel calm over here. Its located at center of Ajmer city, we can call it heart of city

title: Peace!!
review: A place where you find peace. A place where you feel relaxed of your worries. Visited the dargah couple of days before the URS. As expected the dargah was very crowded. Even with so many people around you still find peace and calmness around. Its magical.

title: Holy place plz visit
review: This is my 4th time to visit to Dargah Shariff. It always vibrant with people, music, and prayers. I found it very peaceful when I sat to listen to the sufi music they play. Whatever wish you ask for in Dargah Shariff, it does come true.

title: Completely commercialised!
review: The Dargah is at very nice place, surrounded by beautiful shops. You will feel at peace while praying in there. However one needs to be very careful from pick pocketer. Also people will ask you to donate money in the name of God, not once but multiple times, so be careful and donate as per your will and faith.

title: Ajmer Dargah
review: Last Week Visited Ajmer Dargah Sharif, Stayed in hotel shalimar for 3 dys. The food was really nice and the big kachori is really tasty really found a clean city and silent city better than Mumbai....

title: Great Holy Place...
review: Ajmer Sharif is a great place and we feel blessed after coming here...

title: urs fair
review: Nice place to visit. The market arean surrounding dargah is quite crowded these days but due to good law and order of city no problem was faced by our family and everthing was comfortable...

title: Feeling blessed
review: Went on d way to indore from delhi by road. Feeling blessed after visiting here. Nice people peaceful atmosphere. Just beware of few fraudulent people around. Rest is fine. Tie the rope if u have anything to demand. Will visit again when khwaja gareeb nawaaz will call me.

title: Holy place- go with your beliefs only
review: on the way to dargah many shops will come across to offer chadar in dargah or many kwajas will come along. Prefer to go inside and get that through govt. shop at fix price as you don't need to negotiate it there. as per your wish you decide rather shopkeepers force.

title: Good visit
review: Good atmosphere. Bit of a push and pull within the main Dargah and you hardly get a couple of seconds at the main shrine but well worth a visit.

title: Spiritual
review: Spiritual place to visit by everyone to get some peace. But don't get fooled by Dargah's Khadim ( so called caretaker ).

title: Masha Allah
review: Darga Shariff is the place where you visit & forget all your worries so no comments of this, only prayers

title: "Devine feeling"
review: Dargah was clean and we visited in early march 2016 with friends. People with different caste and creed also visit this Dargah. There is a market around dargah where you can buy stuff. Nobody inside demands for money. There is a Dargah trust where you can give donations if you are willing to give.but its very crowed place.

title: Tranquility
review: I visited the dargah on friday and so had to experience a lot of crowd. This is very beautiful and  powerful dargah. A must visit

title: Very dirty
review: Shockingly dirty approach --scary and very crowded. Beggars, pigs flies  and people demanding money all the time. Takes away completely from what should have been a spiritual experience

title: Divine Destination.
review: A must visit place for religious people. I would recommend not to take any valuables along while visiting the dargah and don't even wear gold chains. As in the crowd there are many antisocial elements too.

title: visit to darga
review: Once you are in Ajmer, pay a visit to Darga....should wear a cap or handkerchief on the head...ensure that you clean your face, feet, hands in the water (tub is available inside the durga)....Out side , beggars menace is irritating....

title: Qawwali
review: Everytime i go to this place, I sit down for some time and listen to the qawwali they sing in the premises. The qawwali is one of its kind and one of the most interesting things about this place.

title: Divine Rendezvous
review: If you like to visit holy places then this revered Dargah should be on top of the list. The atmosphere itself makes you want more and gives you the supreme sense of satisfaction. But you must also keep in mind that its a very crowded place and do not visit on Friday as prayers are offered on fridays and their is manifold increase in the rush and crowd. Beware of pick pocketers. The dargah can be reached through walking/ricksaw/auto only. Cars and buses dont ply till the door of the dargah. Their are designated private parking which charge around 200INR for 2-3 hours, however they are safe. From the parking hire an auto-ricksaw to reach the dargah, however you will have to walk around 100-200 metres till the dargah.

title: Ajmer wahi aata hai Jisse Khwaja bulata hai
review: Devotion, faith and legacy are what you would witness when you visit the Dargah Shariff. The faith moves you to believe in the power which resides in that place.

title: Historical place
review: As any historical religious place this is also like them.  People from all the communities visit this place and maintain harmony.  Situated at the heart of Ajmer you have to pass from a few lanes and by lanes to reach there.  There is a giant pan kadhai donated by the moghul emperor akbar. It is used for making sweets to distribute.  This giant utensil is never hot when you touch it but it is very hot from bottom.  People from all walks of life come here and pray the saint to bless them what they want in life.  It is believed that people get what they wish for by praying here.  Some people are frequent visitors. When there is chari mubarak festival then it becomes totally packed.  Even people do not find hotels to stay.

title: Dream come true.......
review: Dargah is very beautiful & decorative. The surrounding still like 18th century. Very pleasant atmosphere inside the Dargah. I hope next time I will manage to go there.

title: Wanted to be in Dargah Shariff for some time.
review: Like All Other visitors we also had the first objective to visit the Dargah - the Pious  Place. Inside the approach was fine. There are flying people who would attempt to glue without whom also you can manage well.

title: very known and blessed place
review: Dargah sharif in ajmer is a very famous place. Visitors from all over india comes here to seek blessings. Must visit place if u r near ajmer.

title: Peace of mind
review: One in a year or two I visit here for ziarat of hazrat khwaja moinuddin chisti R.A

title: Very Holy Place of Rajasthan
review: this is the holy place for all who believes in miracle of dua. its is the world famous place.

title: This place is not for tourist
review: I don't agree with negative comments relating this place to tourism...its a place of the great saint khwaja moinudeen chisti...ordinary human can never get this...if you wish to visit...come without any expectations...it's my believe that there will be a test for first timers...if you pass that his blessings will be with you...even in my first trip I was stuck in a huge crowd injured my hand and face slightly...but the second trip in March 2016...I was given a VIP treatment...you are being tested here by almighty...let's see how lucky you are :)

title: Gives inner peace
review: It's a well known religious place, visited by all religions people.

title: Bliss
review: Though it;s pretty crowded  roads near by, one can feel peace inside the premises. You can seat and relax gaining tremendous peace ad letting your worries flow out of you.

title: Masha Allah
review: If you are in ajmer you should take your time to visit this must visit place.

title: Terrible
review: After reading of all the reviews, me and my wife decided to make a day trip from Jaipur where we were staying to enjoy the bliss and the inner peace enjoyed by all those people whose reviews we have read.  But unfortunately for us, it was a terrible experience.  Right from the entrance to the Dargah we were pestered by the vendors to buy offerings. One vendor' representative followed us for some distance and when he realized we are not going to buy anything from him said. OK then wait in the Que for 4 fours  Thankfully we did not have to wait so long, however the crowd management was so bad. Finally when we entered the inner sanctum, the crush was so intense that you almost suffocate. This is definitely not a good experience for woman to be crushed from all sides. All we wanted to do was stand peacefully and pray which we could not do. We were literally pushed out by the following crowd.. We could only breath properly after exiting the inner sanctum. All of this could have been avoided if the management rather than trying to fleece the pilgrims of their money, provided proper crowd management and allowed limited persons at a time to enter the inner sanctum.

title: Landmark of Ajmer
review: Ajmer is more famous for this Dargah. It's most happening place and best visited by an Auto through the narrow lanes which was an experience of life with Usman bhai. If you believe then lay the chadar and donate for the bhandara

title: Highly religious palce
review: This Dargah of Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti, the Guru of Mughal Emperor Akbar is now a place visited by persons belonging to all religions. You are dropped about a Km away and have to cover the distance either by foot or via Auto, who takes you through lanes to a nearby place, near the Dargah. Still a 300 meters walk is inevitable. The charges are also a little high for the distance covered, but then, do we have a choice?

title: That's why Ajmer is famous for !
review: It was possible for me to come to Dargah because one of my Muslim friend ,who was in Bangalore ,came to Delhi on short term deputation. So here we were with a group of seven firends in Ajmer. It's a very peaceful place , I thank my friend due to which it was possible for me to get a whole new side of giving prayings to God.

title: Breaking all religion boundries
review: I went there two times , and first thing is you will notice  that  Hindu, Muslims, Sikhs and other religions people visit this dargah. There is saying that nobody returns empty hands from there. Every wish will be fulfilled there. Very nice place to visit and also you can do so much local shopping of Rajisthani items there esp. Bangles. There is very big market for bangles. And the thing is they will make bangles instantaneously . They say that kwaja baba is the power house of power and same power you will feel there once you visit the place. Its not inside the place but outside also you will feel positive vibration coming from all sides. Visit this place in winter as summers are very hot there.

title: Decent experience
review: We visited the dargah in late jan.. I expected a lot of crowd since it was republic day weekend but was pleasantly surprised to not get much. There was no queue or waiting period. Inside the dargah of moinuddin chisti one gets a divine feeling and it's heartening to see people of all religions pray under the same roof.The moulvis do keep asking you money at every corner inside the premises and actually make you feel bad if you don't end up paying large amounts, so beware of it.

title: Peaceful place
review: Dargah was clean and i visited in early march 2016 with friends. People with different caste and creed also visit this Dargah. There is a market around dargah where you can buy stuff. Nobody inside demands for money. There is a Dargah trust where you can give donations if you are willing to give.

title: must visit place
review: if you are in ajmer you should take your time to visit this must visit place.

title: WORTH TO SEE
review: I with my family was afraid to enter to this,but a very nice guy helped me a lot in seeing the Dargah,where the people are full filling there demands,that place/gate was directly shown by that guy and told the history of this.

title: Excellent place
review: Certainly can be listed as one of the oldest dargah in India.Its just a few minutes drive from railway station, undoubtedly one to the best place to visit in Ajmer

title: General manager..In a multinational Co.
review: Full of visitor through the year.All sort of people visted Dargah Shariff irrespective of their religious believe.Very well connected from all parts of the country.

title: Excellent Place to Get Blessed
review: I have visited the dargah with my family members and other relatives. You would feel truly blessed. You should not let the opportunity go in your life.

title: A wonderful experience
review: To visit one of the holiest muslim shrines in India is an experience I will never forget. 30 - 40,000 pilgrims visit every day, with many more on special days, so you need to be OK in crowds. You will see the qawwali musicians and lovely sacred shrines.

title: Its another place to visit for a lot of positive vibes !!!
review: its one of the places to visit for a spiritual connect. Its right in the center of the city ajmer. The premise is very large but the main point of interest is at the center of the temple, People of all religions could be seen offering prayers,,

title: Peaceful Dargah
review: Ajmer's Dargah Shariff is a must see. Not only for a Dargah visit but also for a peaceful,  pleasant and a positive vibe.

title: Approach to Dargah Sharif, Ajmer
review: The thought of a visit to a holy place at once fills you with a sense of peace and joy. That is till the time you approach it. Though the authorities have made the narrow approach road to the Dargah a no-vehicle zone, yet the policemen standing there make no effort to restict all two wheelers and some cars. As the road is lined by shops on either side, and touts trying to lure you in with goats and pigs strutting around, not to mention people moving in all directions. Result is a nightmare.

title: MESMERISING EFFECT // DARGAH SHARIFF
review: a very apt and right place to visit when you are in search of inner peace. However a little crowded but it is more than worthy to pay a visit to Dargah.

title: A very heartening experience
review: Extremely pleasant experience. Cool and pleasant place. Would recommend it to everyone visiting Ajmer.

title: Divine touch at dargarh
review: Perfect place to feel divine touch. Kawalli is thing you should not miss in dargarh. Its amazing to see people from all religion come here and pray at dargah sharif.

title: A place where all go with their wishes
review: No such reviews can fulfill the experience anyone can have here. An excellent calm place with the peace. You can find peace of mind and heart here.

title: Enchanting Experience
review: The visit to the Dargah left a very contented feeling in my mind.. A visit is mandated to experience the feeling of divinity.. To top our experience, it started raining immediately after our visit making it a superb one!

title: Be careful
review: Be careful of the crowds over there. Bring only the basic minimum. Do not bring excessive money. Keep your camera and cellphone at the hotel if you will not be taking any pictures over there.

title: Spiritual visit
review: Very crowded area no use to go if not coming ajmer for this only.

title: Very soothing always to be there
review: Its always a very soothing experience to be at the Ajmer Sharif Dargah. Almost 15mins walking from the Ajmer Railway Station. Also this place has many hotels, guest houses next to it.

title: Calm and Blessed
review: The dargah is located in the crowded locality, but once inside the dargah one feels totally divine and feesl blessed. The environment makes you clam and feel the serenity

title: Blessed!
review: Loved the Dargah sharif.. We went on a Tuesday so it wasn't really crowded. Just beware of the people trying to con you to give more money and beware of your wallet and phone.. Was amazing to see the Dargah made by shahjahan and Akbar..

title: “Place for peace of mind and soul”
review: The dargah of Sufi Hazrat Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti  (RA).  The place provides peace for mind and soul.

title: Pilgrimage Centre
review: If u visit during urs then its best. U will be able to visit peacefully else it is too hotchpotch. The entry road is really narrow and not so clean. Females to be covered with clothes.

title: loved it
review: most religious place to see in Ajmer is one of this.go during week days so it will b less crowded.very nice feeling after reaching on dargah

title: The center of Ajmer
review: The place is blessed for fulfilling wishes. Being the major attraction in Ajmer, it is mostly overcrowded, so it is always better if you someone who can help your way out in here.

title: Just a Dargah
review: ITs just a dargah, nothing special. Lots of thugs around, so keep your things under supervision all the time.  The moment you enterinto the dargah, there are many sitting and asking for money and register your name,  All fake.   just ignore them and go straightaway inside to have Darshan.

title: the world famous
review: as it's said ... in Muslims ~ mecca, madina or ajmer... you must visit one of these in a lifetime, or your life is not fulfilled!!

title: The most famous dargah in India
review: The Dargah Shariff in Ajmer is the most famous Dragah in India and is definetly the top destination in Ajmer. A very convenient way to reach the dargah is to park your vehicle in the Ajmer Railway Station and go by walk through the narrow lanes leading to the dargah. The walk is about 10 minutes and the shops lining the lane are are vibrant and add a nice touch to the local colour. Whilst a lot of people approached us claiming to be Kadims, we did not engage anyone and could do the Darshan in peace. Lots of shops outside sell the 'Chadar' to be put at the Dargah. It is recommended to buy the Chadar from the shop that is located inside the Dargah premises. The place does have a soothing atmosphere and we enjoyed just sitting in the premises for sometime before taking our leave.

title: Spiritual place..but extremely crowded
review: Visited Ajmer Dargah Sharif in February 2016 during a family trip to Ajmer visiting Pushkar temple. All in all, Dargah Sharif is a nice place to visit when in Ajmer, with lots of associated history. Spiritual quotient is high. Only downside to the place is that it gets very crowded during morning hours and on weekends. (Beware of pick pockets!) Lots of people calling u in to buy flowers and chadar in the marketplace when walking upto the dargah, but prefer buying from shops near the entrance since they provide the same at nominal prices. Try to avoid people claiming to be Khadims, as they will unnecessarily coax you to give money at various points inside the dargah. Overall, a good visit!

title: mr vikas jain
review: very good vip  dargah darshan arranged by hotel k c inn which is complimentary and very near to hotel again planning to come in march

title: The raison d'etre of visiting Ajmer
review: They say your wishes come true here. Hope its true for me.

title: Avoid hawkers
review: It is highly acclaimed shrine so would recommend to visit it but avoid hawkers who will tempt you for different things. Avoid walking up to Delhi Gate as the road to Delhi Gate has open drains and work is going on there.

title: Holi Place where your soul will find peace
review: Must visit , irrespective to your caste and religion. You will find the presence of some kind of eternal powers of Garab Nawaj.

title: God bless all
review: Visited in February 16 with family for the second time in my life

title: Must Visit in Ajmer
review: Reaching this place is an experience in itself, a walk through the narrow lanes of the bazaar jam packed with hoards of people. People come with great faith from all over the country for this place, as it is known to grant you what you wish for. Situation can get little chaotic and crowd and get little unmanageable at times. Highlight of the dargah are two deghs(humongous cooking pots) where people put their offerings towards khwaja. Should be visited if you drop by in ajmer.

title: A very very crowded place....
review: My bad luck that I reached here on friday..>The place was a mad house...Please do not go on friday...Apart from that people were helpful and the place was nice....

title: Blissful time
review: Ultimately_awesome......................visit once in your life..............Holy spirit.......... Positive vibes........Ajmer.......Close to heart.......love this place........

title: Spiritual and must visit in Ajmer
review: Approach road to Dargarh is narrow and very crowded, we didn't bother to go for any guide but the place is spiritual, inside its very clean and nice fragrance. The sad part is that everyone inside ask for offering in name of god. Don't miss out the Qawwali. A must visit place in Ajmer

title: Great and Great
review: Dargah Ajmer is a great place.. And being here gives us a great feeling and I believe I am blessed that's why I got a chance to give my presence at the holy place...

title: Must visit, but overly crowded!
review: Reached there via narrow roads. People were forcing us to escort us in. It was overly crowded. We were asked to be ware of thieves and keep the belongings safe.

title: Powerful !
review: The narrow alleys leading to the Dargah Shariff actually add to the spiritual experience.Like all religious places in India,its a given that u have to pass through a street which will have all that you wish to offer inside and more! The dazzling lights and the display of the wares actually adds to the charm of the place !

title: Once a visit enough, good market to shop than jaipur/udaipur
review: Shopping things were comparartively cheaper here than Jaipuir/Udaipur. Must shop destination. Need to walk 10 mins on narrow lane to reach dargah. Provision for keeping shoes for Rs 10. Don keep shoes near garland/thali offer. Do purchase a chadar for chadhava. Once inside folks will keep asking donation. Give only if you feel.

title: Must visit, very crowded
review: The dargah sharif is one pious place to be. We visited this holy shrine during our visit to Udaipur. As per our itenerary we visited ajmer while driving to Udaipur from Jaipur.  You need to take an auto or walk down to the dargah from the parking area. The place is very crowded with narrow lanes. It's a great struggle to keep your footwear and get it back though. Spoilers ahead do not hire anyone who would want to escort you at the main gate. The visit can be done all alone you don't need any guide here. The place is very poorly managed, no trust or authority I guess. Be aware of anybody trying to help you or guide as that is not required. The only thing they would do is take to someone even before you could pray  and ask you to donate money which was something we didn't appreciate . Overall not so good experience of the place n people.  The local bodies could do a better job and organise things a bit here. A must visit though because of khwaja, despite all these things you could feel the power and serenity at the holy shrine.  Must visit at least once in lifetime.

title: Amazing divine place!
review: This is one of the amazing divine place I have visited in my life, somehow whenever i entered the Dargaah sharrif, my eyes gets moist, amazing divine feeling i always get here. However it is very crowded place and you need to be very careful about your belongings. you need to be careful about while buying chaddar, buy from outside only, preferrably some shop which is far from Dargah. If you buy from inside, they will sell you and after half an hour that chaddar will be again in sell in the same shop!

title: Renowned Holy Place Must Visit In Ajmer
review: A place must visit in Ajmer it a holy place of Muslim but visited by all the religion and is very crowdy all the season.

title: ajmeer shereef
review: a very religious place.very crowded as we went for friday Juma.Glad I visited this Darga as I have heard a lot about it especially the big cooking pot and have actually seen it now. Could be cleaner and lots of beggars follow you so beware.Overall a good experience however better to visit when least packed.

title: awesome visit
review: a holy place, when I visited this place mind and soul become very plesant. it was my second visit of this place, always I want to vistis this place again again as posible.

title: My visit to Dargah Shariif was smooth .
review: I had book car for local transport and the taxi person made ny visit to Sargah smooth. He was quite helpfull

title: A must Visit when in Ajmer
review: A must Visit when in Ajmer,peace peace peace all around,the shrine of sufi saint Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti R.A.

title: Holy place to visit irrespective of whatever religion you belong to.
