review: A very holy place to visit. It's a well know Dargah where people from far away places in India as well as from outside the country come to pray.

title: Lots of history
review: We visited the dargah in the evening. it was crowded and we were warned to be careful of our belongings. The only annoying part was people wanting to escort us in.

title: Spiritual
review: You will see lot of genuine devotees and would feel spiritual. Khadim explained many things nicely, so had a good visit. Last 1km is a walk

title: Missing the quiet and peace
review: The place was overly crowded. People ask for money on every step in the name of donation. Missed the peace and quiet we went in search of in the place

title: Too crowded & poor upkeep
review: Too crowded, poor upkeep and too many touts trying to buy blessings for you. Otherwise a must visit when in Ajmer.

title: Marvellous! A place to visit again and again For blessings
review: Spectacular historic religious place to visit again and again

title: Religious Place to Pray
review: Historic place to worship and pray. Good to see people from other religion than Islam visit and offer pray. Must check the timings to avoid disappointment.

title: Spiritual visit
review: spiritual Saint Khawaja Baba jee. Most popular Sufi Saint in India . Open to All religious people. Two times yearly festival.main festival 6th Rajeb , another one during Muharram ( Islamic calendar)

title: Place for peace of mind and soul
review: The dargah of Sufi saint Hazrat Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti (RA). The place provides peace for mind and soul.

title: So much crowdy
review: However, being a religious deity it is fine, but cleanliness in nearby areas more than required. Historical place. Must visit while being in Ajmer. On way to Dargah, be careful of thugs in the way. Whatever, you want to purchase, it is all available in Dargah campus inside.

title: A very holly place which is over commercialised
review: When we visited it was very crowded and it felt it was over commercialised, noisy and rather dirty in places. We were hoping for a religious place where one can contemplate and reflect and also learn more about the history, etc.

title: Must Visit
review: Visited Dargah on december 2015 and its a great experience. I feel a great deference among other pilgrimage places.

title: Mixed feeling
review: This place gave the perfect feeling of religiousness.. What it is really known for... Felt extremely blessed and at peace the minute we entered inside.

title: Crowded and Popular
review: Ajmer Dargah Shariff is a very popular and crowded place. People believe that there wishes and prayers are answered and fulfilled. I did not find anything fascinating about the place. Its popularity and accreditation actually attracts the tourists.

title: Place of Worship...
review: Must Visit for everybody coming to Ajmer Rajasthan.

title: Poorly kept & managed
review: The surrounding of this place is no doubt one of the dirtiest in India.No safety norms, the dirtiest & the narrowest alleys take you to this place. Everyone is doing business here & I didnt find any sense of spirituality here. Govt & Trustees can make the place better by making proper routes, proper channels of darshan but no.Everyone is busy grabbing their share. This is a familiar sight in almost all major dargahs in India.Its over crowded and they would ask you to take care of your belongings.Thieves are around you.

title: Place of people's faith
review: Holy religious place.....if you reached by own car then there is sufficient parking space in Thailand market on main road. From where u can walk for 10 min to reach the Dargah. No need to take a rickshaw as there is very narrow road.

title: Ajmer Dargah Shariff
review: Though over crowded , it is the faith that attracts people to this place. When I went to Dargah Shariff, it was very very crowded. We already knew a Khadim (Custodian) who guided us through the place. Had we gone alone, it would have been very difficult to enter the main shrine as it was very very crowded that day. It was a weekend.

title: Bhar do Jholi meri Ya Muhammad, laut ke ab na jayunga khaali...
review: A place where you can connect yourself to God... you don't need to follow Muslim religion to visit this place, it is open to all... it is open to everyone who believes in God in whatever form... Just go in with offerings of Rose Petals or Shawl... stand in His shadow... take His blessings... and sit there for some time with your eyes closed... you will feel so light, you will feel that you are in God's arms... you will feel out of this world...

title: Kwaja Gharib Nawaz!
review: Three things,

title: A very holy place
review: We visited this place in early December 2015.

title: Dargah Shariff
review: Its a religious place and allows all religions. its crowded though very peaceful.

title: Soul cleansing experience
review: Visiting the blessed courtyard is an experience by itself. Go with an open heart, pray with your folded hands, shed tears to cleanse your soul, listen to the divine qawwalis. Khwaja Gharib Nawaz welcomes all in his open arms, irrespective of caste, creed, religion. A must do in everyone's life...

title: Dargah Shariff for all
review: Its a religious place and good thing is that its open to all. This is very old and must be around 400 to 500 years old as told.

title: A must visit
review: Ajmer is famous for Dargah Shariff. Take an auto  if you don't want to walk through the narrow and dirty lanes. However the Dargah is pretty well maintained. Do carry a scarf/handkerchief to cover your head while you are inside.

title: A Devine place
review: It was the best time to visit the Dargah. Khadim helped us at the dargah and offering the chadar was a majestic experience. Dargah was clean and quiet.

title: holy place
review: we visited this place on our way from Jaipur to Jodhpur.This dargah of holy saint Khawaja mohideen chisti is most sacred , he was sufi saint.this place gives a nice vibration and you feel good that you have visited nice place.

title: Gratifying Experience
review: The visit to the Dargah is a surreal experience.

title: Peaceful Place
review: Must visit Dargah Shariff when you in Ajmer. You eill feel peaceful and blessed.

title: Peaceful and intimidating at once.
review: Dargah Sharief - tomb of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishty is visited by people from all religions. It is said that there is huge power in his blessings. It is a must visit if you are going to Ajmer. Dont miss the qawwalis which are being sung in the courtyard right outside the tomb. Goosebumps are a definite Yes

title: Peaceful
review: Peaceful place. The road is very narrow and dirty. Very commercialized. The people are ready to take even the last penny from your pocket in the name of religion. It is advised not to respond the person who approach you and say that they will take you directly inside. They charges very high. And even paying them you have to pay inside also.

title: Top of the world
review: It's a place where one love to come again and again. Very spiritual and peaceful place. It's beyond everything...

title: Amazing place.
review: This was my second visit to Dargah Shariff and it was much more cleaner this time. This place has some powers. Very crowded place but when we entered, we could actually offer chadar, flowers everything to baba. Friends who went with us had a small baby and place was too crowded to be with a small baby. Please plan accordingly.

title: peaceful place
review: i have visited this place once & its a really peaceful place & gives positive vibes.there are many hotels close to stay

title: Group of cheater
review: Sorry state of affairs .one goes there with some beliefs but returns with cheats .from entry till inside group of  cheats works hand in glove to exrract money from visitors . I got a chader  & flowers offerings for Rs 200 .surprisingly he took me to another money extracter inside .really depressing .  And u r out .

title: Much awaited visit
review: This place is surreal...never mind the crowds or the beggars who chase you till you are out of sight..the calm interior is in striking contrast to the chaos at its entrance. It's better to visit this place before 9 am but after that its not a place for the claustrophobic. The place has several shops where you can buy flowers for the offering and leave your shoes ..we met a very helpful Shahrukh Chishti who took us all the way inside and helped us pray without charging a single penny and we will never forget that. Must go to place whenever the chance presents itself.

title: nice but too much rush and crooks every steps
review: We are blessed to see this place. But there was too much of rush, not well managed. Crooks at every steps to misguide and snatch money from you.

title: Very peaceful
review: This is my second visit to the dargah. Always such an amazing experience. Visit during the morning... to avoid crowds.

title: Amazing experience
review: One should for sure visit the Ajmer Sharif Dargah. It really feels energised once you reach there. Just a problem is that there is a lot of crowd over there. Rest everything is amazing.

title: Must visit
review: U must visit to place when visiting ajmer. No traveller can miss this holy place. Beautiful place. I also had put chadar on place with the help of priest

title: Different experience
review: Its an experience that one should get if in Ajmer. The narrow bylanes leading up to the Dargah and its colorful denizens, shops and hustle bustle are really enthralling. So is the Dargah. It is a huge melting pot of cultures, the kind that's getting rarer by the day.

title: Heavenly peace
review: Had been there 2 nd time it's a peace for soul and mind u can true spirit of all religions come under one roof  u will see all coming to pray

title: Divine!
review: I was initially skeptical about visiting the dargah as I am not a muslim.  However, I went in Dec 2015 and my experience was divine.

title: Chiched place, overly commercialized.
review: The Dargah is dirty and overly commercialized. There is nothing islamic about the place. Everything is designed to extract every rupee possible off you in the name of religious services. There is really nice islamic food around the dargah but the place itself isn't worth the visit.

title: Holy Ajmer Sharif
review: Holy shrine of Khawaja Mohinuddin Chisti - Ajmer Dargah Sharif is in heart of city. Approach Street is always crowded with pilgrims from around the world throughout the year

title: peaceful bliss !!!!
review: what to say about this place !!

title: Horrible experience
review: After quite a harrowing rickshaw ride (we had my grandparents with us and they couldn't do the long walk) which ended with us having to walk about half a mile anyway, we were led in by someone who was supposed to show us around.

title: A place of faith......
review: We visited quite early in morning on Friday and it was very crowded then also.The rickshaw guy introduced us to attendent of dargah and honestly it was blessing.....we took a small basket of rose petals from shop suggested by attendent,left our shoes in that shop and walked to dargah.As we were with this attendent we were able to enter dargah ,otherwise we could never made it inside.we offered prayers and offerings at place suggested by him and came out......sat for some time listening to qwaali which starts in morning itself and were relived to be back to our hotel without any negative incidents as suggested by many posters but then we never carried any thing previous with us.....

title: Tomb of Moinuddin Chisti
review: The great saint lies in the tomb. Hailed as garb nawaz or saviour of the poor.Very clean and efficient surroundings. Both Hindu and Muslims have a great faith on the Baba.

title: Hope, Devotion, Peace!
review: Dargah Shariff or Ajmer Shariff is a holy place and the dargah of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti. There is hope and lot of faith associated with this place. Its a place where you get peace of mind!

title: Lovely sense of divinity
review: Barring the excess crowd, the famous Khwaja Salim Chishti Dargah in Ajmer is a place that will give you an extreme feeling of divinity. The qawalis (holy songs) being sung by singers in the premises itself gives a fantastic feeling.

title: Religious visit
review: This is one of most sacred place for Muslims though all religion follow it with same faith. People say there is only one god, there are various ways to reach to him. This place truly demonstrate it. One must visit here atleast once in life time or even more.

title: A historical place with positive energy
review: The place is packed with devotees. Has a huge utensil shaped container which is nearly 2 storey high. The place has a great historical significance and has a positive aura.

title: Ajmer Dargah - Shrine of Sufi Saint, Kwaja Moinuddin Chishti
review: The shrine is located in the heart of Ajmer. Vehicles are not allowed upto the shrine, and a good walk is necessary. The street to the shrine by itself, is very busy location with plenty of stalls/stores.

title: In Search Of Peace...
review: 12/12/15... This is the second time I'd been to Khwaja Moinuddin Chisty Dargah in Ajmer. The climate was cold and relaxing. This is the place where you can rest and offer prayers to Khwaja Gareeb Nawaz. Make sure that you don't keep giving money to poor people as you'll find hundreds of beggars who will not leave you without taking money from you. Have a nice stay...

title: I feel sorry for the tourist
review: Its a valueable place as the faith for the dargah is concerned, I am not against the dargah but the behaviour of the people is like, we are not tourist but a way to get money at point to point & if you don't have money, they would push you out of the point. Starting from the Offerings shop to the sait's tomb, everywhere are ask for money like asking for extortion money. My Mother was pushed out of the Dargah, as she didn't carry her purse inside & didn't have money, however my brother paid 100 rupees at each point inside the dargah. If you are terified in such a way, there would be no faith left in people to visit the dargah. The Offering I took inside the dargah were not offered to the saint but thrown aside, I think the cloth chaddars are not opend at all & goes for resell to the stores outside. I hated the beaviour of people at the dargah. I wanted to spend my whole day at the dargah but went out in minutes.

title: The Greatest Sufi Saint of the world
review: Ajmer is  great place to visit with family visit the Dargah and get the blessings.

title: Peaceful
review: It was a 30 minute walk from our hotel. There are a lot of shops and you can keep your footwear where you buy the "chaadar" . My friend did see our "chadar" make it's way back to the shop after we had offered it. Very nice to visit though. Just stay clear of the beggars though. Ignore and walk. Also since it's so crowded be aware of your wallets etc.

title: Darshan
review: Great place to visit, I visited once in a year...

title: Visit with a guide for quick Darshan
review: Highly recommended to visit with a guide who can arrange a quick darshan for you and save you the trouble of traversing through the narrow and crowded streets.

title: Must Visit Place if you are in Ajmer
review: As I live in Ajmer, I have visited this place many times. Located in the center of Ajmer city. Dargah sharif is about 2 kms from railway station. You can get rickshaws from railway station going to Dargah sharif.

title: Religious place with blessings to all
review: This is a very pious and pure place. It is in the middle of the market and easily accessible. If you are in Ajmer then you should definitely visit this place.

title: Excellant place
review: It is a must visit place if you are in Ajmer and if you believe in positive waves.You can feel it when you just enters the Dargah bazar.You will feel the cool breeze of positive spiritual waves.The way to Dargah is overcrowded as the people everyday every month come here from India and abroad so prepare for the atmosphere.Get prepared for all the good and bad things that can be happen in a overcrowded area.But besides all these things when its a must visit place if its a must visit place if you are in Ajmer. The way to dargah is overcrowded as the people everyday every month come here from india and abroad so prepare for the atmosphere.Get prepared for all the good and bad things that can be happened in a overcrowded area.But besides all these things when its a must visit place if you are in Ajmer and if you believe in positive waves,you can feel it when you just enters the Dargah bazar.Its a place of Astha, vishwas,spirituality, positive energy and you can took from here for your future.No need to donate money.There are groups of people making songs and some sufi music ,sit and enjoy. Avoid to stay and food there. Beware, there is a well coordinated Gang Operating within the shrine targeting Common Indians who visited the shrine for their respect to ALL religions and faiths.

title: Amazing place
review: The sombre atmosphere and beautiful architecture mesmerises you.  Also got an opportunity to witness a beautiful Qawwali. A great experience indeed.

title: Avoidable
review: We went there early in the morning, around 7. The place was crowded like hell. The moment one steps into the dargah, there are people asking for money with some excuse or the other. The Dargah itself is clean and well maintained. worth a visit atleast once.

title: place of worship
review: One of the renowned dargahs in India, this place is a primary place of worship for muslims but also welcomes hindus. You can go and offer your prayers there but beware of the people selling offerings over there, some people are good but some may not treat you well.

title: Divine...... Soulful..... sacred.
review: Dargah Sharif........

title: Good but plan well
review: Its a chaotic place to navigate...swarms of beggars and hawkers make it difficult and it is extremely crowded. Firstly, its a km long walk from where the vehicle can drop you. You may opt for an auto to get you to as far as possible. Then you fight your way through the crowds. Our auto guy took us to a place where we met a guy who called himself a khadim and escorted on the visit. Turned out to be a good bet. He took us inside the complex,explained and also helped seek blessings in a comfortable manner. There is a bit of hustle in that he takes you to his shop and also asks for donations to the trust but nothing aggressive and we could say no easily. Also no reward asked and you can pay what you like. Worth a visit but be prepared to push your way through!

title: crowded but very powerful
review: I don't know what it is but there is a strong spiritual power here. It is mostly very crowded however so be careful of your purse, etc. I was robbed of my purse once without the slightest movement.

title: An experience to remember
review: Although an overcrowded, full of beggars and located on an odd place, one will always remember the dargah shariff for the purity and sacredness you feel inside. It is true that the management should work better on managing the crowd. It can be much better and well organized place.

title: Must Visit Shrine in Ajmer
review: I heard much about Ajmer Sharif Dargah (Shrine) of the Sufi Saint Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti. So finally was happy to visit and offer a prayer here. Ajmer is mainly popular for this famous Shrine. All religious minded peoples are allowed to come to fulfill their wish to be granted by the Almighty...

title: Dargah at Ajmer
review: One cannot escape the visit of Dargah while is Ajmer. It is known as Khawja Moinudeen chisthi's Dargah.

title: Most visited place of ajmer
review: This dargah is always in news due to the regular visit of VIP'S,and bollywood Celebrities.The dargah shariff is a place to relax and find peace.

title: Nice holy place
review: I was staying very close to dargah so visited multiple times, everytime I visit feel very nice. not much crowded only irritating things are the beggars and the people inside dargah ask for money to donate. but I think best thing to donate money only in donation box which is put my comitte. overall nice holy place, I love to visit again and again.

title: Heavy Crowded Area
review: Must Visit if you are in Rajasthan , bit crowded and has 2 km walk from drop points . 15 - 20 km drive from Pushkar try to get in early since it can be crowded in quick time lot of devotees come so plan y0ou activity well in advance . Beware of Pick Pocketing and People who come behind you for blessings.

title: Top of the world
review: Its a great place ... Feeling very nice here.. Its a place to get peace and relaxed.

title: Narrow,Congested and dirty lane to blessing..
review: This is the sole attraction, people visit Ajmer and they maintain it so badly.If you go through main gate you have to cover crowded and congested road and if you go through back gate it is narrow and dirty.We went through back side and came by side of dargah through main entrance.Beggers will fetch you in numbers from before entering dargah to after existing dargah and they will follow you until you haven’t satisfy them.It is better if you accompany a khadim, the dargah people who accompany you to perform your ritual.One of them is Karim bhai (9828291006), whom my frien suggested.He is a through gentleman and not demanded any money.We can give him as per your wish.He will guide you to buy chadar(starting from Rs.500 to Rs.10000), rose petals etc and made entry without standing in queue. Phone, camera etc are not allowed inside.With Karim bhai with us it took near aboaut 15-20 mins in Dargah.

title: Ajmer sharif dargah
review: Hi frds, I visited with my frds to ajmer sharif dargah on 26/11/2015, 2:30 am left from hubli, karanataka to ajmer, Rajasthan, total up an down 3100 km, help of Google maps navigation, sharing my experience,

title: A very holy place
review: We visited the shrine recently & were able to do it only because we were in a large group with a local guide. For individuals this may be a very daunting task as it is mostly overcrowded with beggars galore. The approach to this shrine is extremely congested & can even lead to stampedes for which the city administration needs to take concrete measures to decongest the area.

title: You feel the aura!
review: Its all an individuals' state of mind! "Bhakti" cannot be measured in words or by any rule - its always within yourself!

title: Very respected place for worship
review: Very respected place for worship for all religious faiths... always very crowed with hundreds of people....

title: Place to get what you need
review: Very beautiful shrine and the place of thousands of worshippers.

title: Nice and peacefull place to be
review: Nice and peacefull place to be

title: Holy Shrine
review: Considered to be second to the Haj at Mecca, this place is worth a visit. It is very crowded at all times, hence patience and time are required. Be careful of pick-pockets. If you use the services of a khadim, be firm about the donation you would like to give. Spend time inside as it is a very calming space. Make a wish and it's sure to come true.

title: "Amazing place"
review: Amazing place this is,lot of devotees comes there ,crowded place...rose fragrance is everywhere in dargah.

title: Words cannot describe the Spirituality
review: Indeed words cannot describe the Spirituality of this place,

title: Chaotic: No proper crowd management
review: Dargah is fine. Clean. But too chaotic. Didn't find peace and solace. Too many rule breakings. Else its a must visit.

title: Peace for soul
review: Every community comes here to get peace of soul. The first Sufi saint who came in India for spreading the message of peace and humanity.

title: Feel blessed inside
review: The hotel melange beacon in ajmer organised a VIP visit for family...don't carry cash or any valuables....no compulsion can contribute towards chadar based on your own instincts. Felt extremely blessed once inside. Khwaja saheb and his aides were quite hospitable and helpful

title: Spiritual Place
review: Its the place visited by both Hindu and Muslims. You will feel the divine power inside the building.

title: Nice
review: We went to daragah shariff on Moharram day, this was just a coincidence, the place was very crowded. There were people warning us to take care of our belongings. Overall we had a nice visit, but seriously feel that this placed could be maintained a bit more with stress on crowd management.

title: Religious place
review: It is located close to the Ajmer railway station. One can walk or hire auto to reach the Dargah. Morning and evening are the preferred hours as It gets hot in the afternoon and difficult to walk on the marble floor. There are khadims to help you inside the Dargah premises, however, they will ask you to pay at every majar inside the dargah. You can go directly to the Khawaja saheb majar without any help. It is in the middle near the mosque.Flowers and Chadars are available inside the premises. It is peaceful to spend some time at the dargah.

title: Good place to visit
review: Good place to visit but beware of touts and there plans to steal from you

title: Nice experience...
review: Darga Sharif is situated at a very crowded and congested place. So you have to be very careful about money bag, mobile phn etc. Its better to keep these things in car if u have. Don't fall into the trap of anyone. Just go and visit the place. Keep some money with you if u want to offer something to god. They all the time ask money from you as like any other religious places. Also keep in mind that you have to put ur shoes outside. Although its a Darga a large number of Hindu people visit here.

title: Extremely crowded, pushy, but nice to see
review: This mosque is to be avoided on crowded days, to pushy, touching, and unpleasant interactions.

title: Well, you will feel quite good after visiting Dargah
review: Well, try to go in the Morning Hours , as there will be no rush and all other things you can do there with the help of Khadim's.

title: Nice experience
review: The dargah is in a very busy street, and you have to pass through some narrow lanes. Best that you carry very minimum stuff and no valuables. The dargah is very calming.. you may be persuaded to participate in some ritual or make some donations (and the main sanctum)- be watchful and judicious in the choices you make. Everyone, male or female, has to cover their head with a cloth or a scarf- hence better if you can carry it alongwith you else you may have to buy the cloth outside the dargah in one of the shops.

title: Blissful
review: It will be an awesome memory. ...went through a known Khadim who made a VIP entry for us. Very bright and vibrant inside.

title: A Devotees dream
review: We visited Ajmer on the way to jaipur.The Dargah was located in a busy area .We parked our car in the main road and took a auto from there to the Dargha .The auto driver took us through narrow lanes and we had to walk to the Dargah .We entered through gate no 4 .Inside we got flowers and chaddar .It was crowded but we had a good Darshan.The auto driver got us back to the main road.We felt nice after visiting the Dargah.

title: Calming
review: The Dargah (Grave) of Sufi Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti is a calming effect IF you are not jostled by the so called khadims (like hindu priest/panda). t predates most permanent muslim settlements in India. It is a must visit especially to experience the muslim culture.

title: Pickpockets, Chaos, Mess and Unhelpful Cops
review: The Dargah Shariff has gained a reputation of being the hub of pickpockets and thieves. I lost my wallet while trying to gain access and lost all my ID, cash and cards. There are a bunch of unhelpful men of Rajasthan Police who are sitting in wedges in the wall playing games on their phones or sipping tea. They will write your report for you as an intimation of loss and give you a receipt for your lost belongings. Not a single finger lifted to help anyone. I was expecting the cop to at least try to pretend to investigate but their attitude is simply, you won't get your things back. The staff of the shrine say that they sometimes find documents abandoned by pickpockets and all they can do is send these documents by ordinary post to people's homes. This is all the responsibility the state and the shrine has for the pilgrims.

title: Dargah of Ajmer
review: One of the best dargah in india people of all religions come this place. You can't go near this place by car you have to park bit then take a hand pull rickshaw are auto Rick to reach this place .

title: Not worth for a foreigner
review: As a foreigner i did not find it interesting to visit, while it was quite an effort to make it there in the city. My tuktuk driver even told me that I needed to leave my shoes much before the place so i walked barefoot in the super filthy street. When I was back, while I just left my shoes myself, there was a very insisting man charging money that he guarded my shoes and followed until not getting money. Tip: leave your shoes only in entrance.. Otherwise the place was very too much crowded and felt the existance of picpockets around. Donations were quite insisted also inside. Thankfully no stealing as such happened. Photos added from entrance.

title: Chaotic
review: We visited with children. In retrospect thisnwas unwise. Access is difficult and we left our shoes quite a distance from the dargah. A man tried to "guide" us through. It was a very uncomfortable experience. I would not  choose to visit again - with or without children. There was a pickpocket attempt amidst the chaos.

title: Heart broken observation
review: I paid my second visit to this shrine after 18 years as far as i remember. This time the situation that i observed has just broken my heart. Bunch of sinners, batty and touts who are all over this Dargah use this religious place as their earning source and directly controls this Dargah. Each and every person who comes here for prayer is forced directly or indirectly to deposit a healthy amount of money in their respective desk by the name of religion. Every moment of my stay i felt just unsecured. May allah show them the right path. Ameen.

title: "must vist place ..full of positive waves..best in india"
review: this was my third visit to this worldfamous dargah of khwaja moinuddin chishti.its a must visit place if u r in ajmer and if u believe in positive waves..u can feel it when u just enters the dargah bazar..u will feel the cool breeze of positive spiritual waves.the way to dargah is overcrowded as the people everyday every month come here from india and abroad so prepare for the atmosphere...get prepared for all the good and bad things that can be happen in a overcrowded area..but besides all these things when u enter this place u feel why u r there...its a place of aastha, vishwas,spirituality, positive energy and all the wellbeings u can took from here for your future.no need to donate money ,there are guides like mushahid Bhai and many who will make your way to respect simple and sober.there are groups of ppl making songs and some sufi music ..sit and enjoy. dargah bazar is gud for children toys and economical shopping.avoid to stay and food there.

title: Good
review: It's good place for religion.  But have much people for asking money. I think the dorga commiti need to change this system. It's really bad if someone ask you money for every step. Inside is clean and feeling great.

title: Allha ho akbar
review: I visited kwaja baba darbar.

title: Spiritually high rather than Sightseeing
review: its located right in the center of Ajmer market. Also, its very near to the Railway station. Hardly 15min walk or 1km distance. One has to pass through heavily crowded streets to reach the shrine. Beware of your belongings and visit the place with minimum valuables. Only take what you need and enjoy the place at its fullest. The best part of Ajmer is multiple communities reside in the same area where all of them live in harmony.

title: Can get crowded
review: The dargah sees a constant inflow of devotees so the ideal time to go there is early in the morning. Keep as little as you can on your person for you aren't allowed inside with bags. It can get quite rushed up so try and steal a moment of quiet

title: Great Place.
review: Loved the place, and the whole feel to it, even sat there for about 15 -20 mins to soak every thing in, a must visit.

title: Good place but too crowded
review: If you have faith in god...do visit this place! But remember that this place has got lots of money hungry people trying to push you to get involved in paid activities like chaadar/prayer etc..very very crowded during th day...suggest to visit on the wee hours like 6 AM

title: Transcending the trivial to the sublime
review: A visit here is food for the soul. I have come here and shed tears that I did not know I held, till they fell. Hearing the lovely qawwalis at 5.30 in the morning is an experience I shall cherish till my memory fades. I have visited here countless times, and each time brings deep peace and such amazing love, that it fills you with gratitude.

title: Cool Place
review: Cool place to be inside the Dargah Shariff. It is very crowded on normal days even, but it was really a worth visit.

title: Mera Kwhaja Hai Badshah, Mujeh Kohi Gam Nahi
review: One of the most holiest and spiritual places on earth. This is the holy resting place of the Great Sufi Saint of the Chisti Order, a Wali / Firend of Allah (God) - Hazrat Khwaja Dada, Moinuddeen Al Chisti al Ajmeri Al-Sanjari R.A. Every time I have visited India I have come to see his holiness to pay my respect and dues.  Without going into the Sufi aspect of spiritual Islam this place will leave you with a sense of belonging and a connection that you at first will struggle to fathom.  All types of people from different religions come here and if you happen to come during the Urs then be prepared to be amazed.  The Dargah is in the busy and narrow streets of ajmer shareef, lined with food shops, beggars and memorabillia shops.  Each have their own place here and be sure to share your money not just in giving to the poor but to eat in a restaurant, shop to buy a souvenir etc because you will reap more rewards than you can ever buy.

title: A holy visit
review: Very nice. Very crowded as it was a Saturday. There were people inside who helped us get in and we offered a chaadar & flowers. The path to the dargah is long as we have to walk though we could take our car. Too many beggars who keep following you.

title: A must visit when in Ajmer.
review: If you believe in places with positive vibes then for me the Ajmer Dargah is a must visit. This was my third time here and it was very fulfilling. There is always a huge crowd outside the lane to the Dargah and inside. But all our visits we have got good opportunity to pay our respects.

title: holy place but crowded,beware!!!
review: this holy place visited during oct2015,too much crowd,roadside shops ,unhygienic foods, and much more ,but one must visit for this type of experience .

title: Very crowded, very difficult to reach and scary!
review: This review is more reg the locality of the attraction rather than the tomb itself. Cars are not allowed near the spot. The roads (rather alleys) leading to the place are very very narrow and typically autos ply on these routes. And those drivers drive like crazy! It is a wonder that our auto did not hit anyone!

title: Wonderful and devotional environment
review: They say God made the second biggest "dargah" at Ajmer, in the dargah of Ajmer Shariff. So this is a very significant and important place for all.

title: Its okay for historical Value but can be given a miss.
review: We unfortunately landed at this place on Bakri Eid. And it was nothing short of a nightmare. Loads of people, rushing and crushing each other. Religion fanatics all around asking you to do this or that like you cannot enter inside with a bag, no slippers, you have to cover your head.

title: Ajmer_Bad expereince
review: It's a day tour from delhi to ajmer. We took volvo from jaipur house around 11pm and we reached at 6am. Beware of auto vala's they hire more charges. Hotels are comparably expensive.

title: Fulfilment of your wishes
review: Resting place of the great Saint Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti RA - well known as Khwaja Garib Nawaz ( Bestower on the Poor) A place to go, pray heartily and get peace of mind and body.

title: Holy Shrine.
review: One of the most auspicious shrine in India.Spiritual peace and holiness.The main reason to visit Ajmer is dargah Shariff.

title: An experience of a lifetime
review: India's most important pilgrimage for people from all faiths.

title: Divine experience
review: Visit the Dargah during our Jaipur tour, a 3 hours drive by a rented car. It was worth everybit of the journey. The atmosphere was serene and mystic. Surely best sufi shrine in India.

title: More of Spiritual value than Sightseeing
review: The shrine is generally crowded. One needs to be prepared for a bit of a crowd there. Khwaza Moinuddin Chisti Saheb was one of the greatest Sufi saints in the Sufi tradition.  Look out for the great utensils in which food is cooked enmasse. One needs to have focus on the spiritual vibrations. Will take not more than 45 minutes between entry and exit.

title: Absolutely Divine experience
review: 372 Kms, 4.5 hours drive from Gurgaon to Ajmer Sharif, 7 Tolls, absolutely smooth drive with no hassles. Not only the drive but even the visit to Darbar Sharif was so divine that I have never ever experienced a religious place with people of almost every faith visiting and offering prayers. The place is a must visit once in a lifetime. Offer a chadar as per your choice and a offer prayers inside. Must taste sweet rice as Prasad.

title: Nothing there...
review: When you go there,  people follow you.  They cheat you by name of blessing.  It is totaly converted in a business place. Your pocket and chain are not safe in dargah. I lost my chain in dargah and i caught the half which is cut by someone. If you heard name go once in a life , otherwise there is nothing like pure heart.

title: Divine and Heavenly
review: We were very lucky to be there on Friday to experience and witness the faith, of our Muslim brothers, in the Almighty God who offered their prayer (The Namaj) on the street and everywhere they could manage the space to sit and perform their rituals. It was over crowded but we manage to do the darshan of the divine Dargah. It was very en-lighting.

title: Amazing Soulful Experience
review: Amazing experience and you feel out of the world... Keep in mind that the Dargah is mostly very crowded so be prepared and dont carry too many things

title: Holy Place
review: A visit to this place is possibly the main reason for people to visit Ajmer. People from all religions flock to this place and it can be extremely crowded. Do remember to cover your head when you enter the premises and beware of pick pockets

title: Holy place & Hope
review: We offered 'chadar' in Dargah Sherif and also humbly donated. But there was a second thought in my friends mind that if we might have used few on flowers and donated to needy one's. We humbly replied its a matter of one's will and Aastha.  We had wonderful Bismillah  from Ajmer for tour Rajasthan.

title: Pilgrimage
review: Divine experience ..a must visit place for people of all religions ..stay overnight in ajmer and experience the early morning mystical atmosphere here ..

title: Place was good but not the experience
review: I went there with my parents to offer the blessings of Gharib Nawaz. The place was beautiful no doubt and had its own grandeur. But unfortunately not knowing what to do and what is the proper procedure to offer 'çhadar' we were compelled to donate money at several places even to people having no relation with our offering. And one thing which I did not like was that they demanded around 100 to 200 bucks and you almost had to bargain at every step. Sorry to say the 'bhakti' with which I entered the holy Dargah was not the same with which I came out. Still I would recommend that if you are in or near Ajmer you should pay a visit here.....but beware of the people asking for money.....it is best if you are accompanied by someone who has already visited it and can honestly guide you inside the shrine. By the way you need to cover your heads when you are visiting the shrine and remember to take necessary items like scarf/ dupatta/ chadar/topis(for men) etc.

title: A religious place
review: The faith of people coming to this place 'says it all'. You get here whatever you want in life. Akbar and Salim's degh which can coock 40 man & 20 man respectively are worth seen.

title: Overrated and commercialized!
review: The place has lost its true sense as it is highly commercialized and thrives mostly on careless tourists. Since this is the case with most religious places in present times... u cant expect more. The Dargah definitely has its charm considering the beliefs attached to it. Nonetheless, make sure that you are extremely careful with your personal belongings and keep away from anti-social elements. A one-time visit for its attached sentiment!

title: Khawaja Garib Nawaj- KHAWAJA MAHARAJA
review: Truly, A Sufi King of Kings , who will never let you come back empty . Your Heart will feel the JOY of Sufism , Your Dreams Got here wings of confidence and reality. If you want to feel the place and blessings of Garib Nawaj , devote yourself with a silence mouth and empty heart.

title: Different experience..
review: Our first visit to dargah..the road leading to dargah is scarily crowded..that too it was a Friday..cleanliness can be improved..make sure you don't carry expensive gadgets with you, there are people looking around for it..

title: Historic and holy place and the best Dargah!
review: One of the best Dargah i have been to. Ajmer place itself is known for the Dargah sheriff!! The best thing that i found there is the big Vessel in which they used to make th e biriyani during eid. Its so huge that u need to keep a ladder to go inside.

title: Awesome so divine
review: Must place so divine, so amazing.. Please just don't listen to anyone , there are cheats everyone they pretend like messenger of GOD but they just want to get money from you....

title: religious place..
review: truly this is  best and nice place in india where you can visit.. along this crowded market.. lots of gathering in mosque.. clean not said upto mark but visiting this Dargah sheriff peace ur mind out of  this    you find all religious people without any problem.. take caring of all rules and regulation follow in visiting dargah in spit of any religion people they are...

title: The beauty of Ajmer Dargah
review: The greatest of the Sufi Saints to have visited India. Kwajah ji had come to India to spread the word of ISLAM and he choose Ajmer as his chosen land. Today Ajmer has a huge following not only among the followers of Islam but among HINDUS , Christans , Sikhs who come in huge numbers out of there love affection and belief in his teachings and his love for fellow beings

title: Must visit place in Ajmer
review: the shrine is very close to Railway station, hardly 10 minutes walk away. visited this holy shrine twice with my family. a must visit place if you happen to be in Ajmer. once you enter the Dargah Shariff, you forget all the hustle bustle outside. A very tranquil and a different experience altogether. once you enter the sanctum sanctorum you will feel the difference inside yourself.

title: BEGGING YOU TO SEE THIS... Dargah visitors
review: The dargah in ajmer is world renowned... As usual I will not type anything except the scams and how to avoid them.

title: Ajmer –Dargah Sharif- Worst Place
review: I was very excited to visit spiritual Dargah Sarif – but the crowd there made my experience terrible.

title: Place for visit at least once in life time.
review: A place where one should visit once in his life time. Quite calm and peaceful. Most of the people say that what ever you demand genuine you will get it.

title: Holy place to visit
review: You get very positive vibes here in this dargah. Its a 15mins walk from the station so do not take an auto or rickshaw is you can walk down there on your own.

title: Dargah that gives you peace
review: As everyone knows nabout Dargah Shariff, it is a great place for Muslim visitors. Many people from around the world travel here for 'mannat'. Even celebrities come often to offer 'chaddar' to the great Dargah Sharrif. It is approx 20 - 25 mins from railway station of ajmer.

title: One can experience the strong vibrations here
review: It is an out of the world experience; it feels like the energy there just absorbs you making you sit there all day and wanting to go back. It is vibrant, crowded yet peaceful.

title: Just divine ... will come again and again
review: I can come again and again....

title: A visit to Dargah Sharif
review: Dargah Sharif is a must visit if you are visiting Ajmer. The dargah is full of devotees round the day. Felt good after offering prayers at the dargah. Will come back soon.

title: Wonderful Experience...Must Visit for all irrespective any faith
review: People of all religion visit the Shrine of Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti, the Sufi saint, who spread the message of love, peace n true faith to humanity. this place is very peaceful n soul touching. its a must visit place for all.

title: A glimpse of Indian Sufism
review: I visited Ajmer in August 2015 and Dargah Shariff was a destination which I had to visit. I had checked this sufi place in my bucket list even before landing at Delhi airport..

title: Reviving the sprituality.
review: If you believe in spirituality go here. best to visit early morning as it gets really crowded by 9.00 - 10.00 am.  The place really makes you calm.. there is an amazing positive vibrancy that surrounds you when you are here. Qawwals adds to the experience as you feel really relaxed, and positive after visitng the dargah.. must go if you are looking for a spiritual experience.

title: Maula moula, maula mere maula......
review: No any Comments for out side of Dargah, but in side its a peaceful place, your wises will fill up, pray with your heart, maula will full fill it :)

title: Good place to visit for the spiritually inclined
review: This is the most well known dargah in India and although I am not one to visit dargahs I came here all the same as my family wanted to see it.

title: Sultan e Hindustan
review: Khaja Baba is a great sufi sent in India. Lots of people and follower mured came her and pray. Every one can come here. And take some things Tabarrukat.

title: Foundation of the Chisti Sufi Order
review: Up the bazaar road and through the narrow alleyways lined with shops you arrive at the securitied entrance to the complex. You are not allowed cameras except for your mobile phone which will be the only means whereby you will get a view pics. Be very for scamsters and pickpockets. We were lucky to get a tour of the place by a Moulana who claimed to be an offspring of Garib Nawaaz ( Muinnudin Chisti). The first impressive site that we were shown were the two degs ( two massive pots - the biggest I have ever seen) and which at certain times was stoked to cook food for almsgiving.  Do visit Akbar,s Mosque inside as well as the mosque of Shah Jahan. The highlight is the holy Mazaar (grave) of the saint. The small venue housing the grave is like a beehive - buzzing with prayer chants, rose petal showers on the grave and the adornments of hundreds of chadars ( Clourful cloth coverings heaped upon the grave. If you have some time you may be lucky to enjoy the rhythmic chanting and singing of qawallis ( songs of praise and homage to the saint. I believe that nobody visits Ajmer but to visit the dargah besides tourist points of interest.

title: Ajmera Shariff a holy  place for all religions.
review: Ajmera Shariff is the Darga of Chisti a  Sufi Saint where one offers a Chadder (Blanket). Belief is you can ask  for your  wish and the wish gets fulfilled in this place. Pilgrims of all faiths visit this  Darga.

title: Felt Blessed
review: Irrespective of Caste and religion people visit this place in thousands every day. I have always been wanted to visit this place and I am happy that we managed to do so. You can drive from Jaipur (Nearest Airport) in 2 hours or from Delhi in 5-6 hours. Its a divine place and highly regarded by visitors of all religion. If you are travelling to Pushkar, its just next door. Though highly commercialized now, you will still love this place.

title: Divineq
review: Visited in March 2015. Luckily it was a saturday and got a chance to hear the Qawalli in the Dargah premises. It was a Divine feeling. Must visit on your trip to Ajmer/Pushkar.

title: Akbar was blessed here
review: This is a place that has great historic significance with Akbar and the Sufi Saint.  It is believed that what you pray here will be granted.  You will certainly require help to get around this place and we were very lucky to be guided by one of our well wishers at the mosque.  Travelers need to understand fully before planning a visit to the place.  The streets leading to the mosque are narrow and untidy and you will have to take a auto to get there safely.  They will charge you around 200 INR for a two way ride from a nearby parking place.  The whole place is full of beggars who do not allow you to get in or out easily unless accompanied by someone who knows the place well. Irrespective we had trouble.  The offerings at the Darga are either of flowers or of shawls which is used to cover the tomb.  The flowers (rose petals) cost you around 100 INR whereas the shawls range from 1000 to 10,000 INR.  Irrespective of all the troubles and hurdles you may encounter this is a place to be visited and is open to people of all faith.  Please read the customs and practices in detail before visiting the place.

title: World renowned place
review: Holy place for all religions. your prayers will come true , definitely you will come here again for thanksgiving. just ignore the  and peddlers Beggars nuisance.

title: Not so good.But visit Tarahgarh which is awesome
review: Travelled in 2013,it's just a one time watch nothing so great...Yes Morning tea at Delhi gate in Ajmer and then heading towards Tarahgarh Fort is really a picturesque destination....3 starts is for the people near Dargah who are just trying to fill there pockets...

title: The Sacred Shrine of  'Garib Nawaj' - friends of the poorv
review: This is the most sacred shrine of the saint - people of different religion from all over the world come here to feel the blessing of this kind saint . The easy access from the train or the bus makes it easy to reach .At anytime of the day - The faithfuls come here with prayers on lips  .From railway station - autorickshaw will charge you Rs,  250/- for the return entire trip besides taking you closest to the entrance of the shrine .( vehicles not allowed at the entrance ) The crowds are milling - a word of caution - be careful about pick pockets with nimble fingers . Footware not allowed inside ,dress code - no short dress - men / women  , heads to be covered before entering  . Inside shrine do not encourage anyone to take you inside by charging you extra . Feel the mercy of the saint once you are inside - pray with your full heart - non Muslims are seen here paying.

title: Religious place
review: Its a place like no other place in India , a shrine which is a symbol of Indian unity visited by Muslims , Hindus and people of all religion and group, as soon as you enter the shrine premises you can feel the immense energy around the place you can feel the burden lifted from your shoulder...There is something for everyone here ... no matter you are atheist or a religious you will find your answer here if your Intention and will to find the answer is true. If you don't believe me then do pay a visit.

title: A sacred place
review: Visited this dargah in December'14. Though this is a very sacred place for all the muslims, people from all the religion visit this dargah. This is a very crowded place. And the road leading to this dargah is very dirty. There are a lot of beggars in this street. So beware of them. A must visit for all the visitors to Pushkar and Ajmer.

title: HOLY Place
review: Management can do better job in cleaning this holy place.

title: Good place
review: We went there during Ramazans, there was hardly any crowd then and we had a nice peaceful visit inside the dargah. Nice place. Thanks

title: blessed to have visited Him..!!
review: all reasonable wishes will be granted in Lord's altar...!! i remain Blessed.....its your turn folks.

title: nice peaceful place
review: Its a nice place, was not crowded when we went during Ramadans, so could go inside and pray peacefully. There are big historical vessels used for cooking also kept inside the complex.

title: Dargah shareef
review: It is one of the holiest place for Muslim. But if you have faith then your religion doesn't matter. All people are welcome there. We went on Friday 1 pm and all the streets were full for namaz. So please avoid that time unless you want to join. We went to pushkar and returned at night. Very touching qawwalis were sang. We offered a chaddar and we were greeted very gently. It felt good. Many celebrities come here and good to see such devotion.

title: Very poorly maintained
review: I understand the significance of this place but the way it is maintained is very poor, although I visited at the time where there were not many people but there is no order everywhere pushing is going on. Lot of people here are trying to make quick buck, I will suggest just go on your own inside donot pay anyone. Also beaware of your shoes if you donot pay anyone outside to keep it will be stolen. Moreover make sure your wallet is safe somewhere as inside the premise lot of pick pocketing going on. I visited 2 times both times in my group someone lost his wallet. Although place is crowded there is no cctv or cameras to stop pick pocket.

title: holy place
review: ajmer is the center of attraction of people because of khwaja garib nawaz dargah.i am blessed to go there.

title: A quiet, serene place
review: I went to Dargah Sharif early in the morning. I was there at 730 and the place was not crowded. I had been advised to leave my phone and wallet behind as many people lose their stuff in the crowd. I had left the camera behind because it wasn't allowed inside. I made my was inside the main enclosure of the dargah and there were only around 10 - 15 people there. This is on a Jumma during Ramazan. An hour or so later the place was fully packed.

title: Awesome
review: What can you say about a place which is host to almost every big personality on earth? Its a place you can go anytime and even if there is crowd, it wont be much trouble.

title: Pray and Peace
review: A great place to visit. It is just feeling of Peace to visit there.

title: Dargah Experience
review: Enriching and vibrant experience. A blessed and life changing place of visit. Important that you have someone guide you in the complex to allow appreciate the significance of all that you do at the Dargah. Powerful experience!.

title: Bargah of Huzoor Sarkar Gharib Nawaz
review: Holy Shrine of Great Sufi Saint on Planet,Come visit n fulfill ur wishes.Definitely by grace of Allah Subhanawathallah our wishes will be fulfilled. Yaa Gharib Nawaz Al Madad.

title: Great example of communal harmony : Holy Sufi Shrine
review: "Such Holy places are truly a Great example of communal harmony"

title: Not A fruitful Visit...Once  in a lifetime will be OK
review: Too much crowded...You will find lot of people with money making stuff like fake astrology, Also many people will follow you and trying to insist you to purchase photos, handkerchief etc. Be-aware of pick pocket specially during the visit to Dargah. Near dargah, they will not allow you to stand for a moment. if they will find a 100 or 600 currency note in your hand, they will treat you in a different manner. Really, its no more a divine place and it has become totally commercialized.

title: Relief Place
review: If you are in Ajmer then i am sure you will surely visit this place. Because of this Holly Place Ajmer is famous. You will get a relief there. Please go from Delhi Gate side if you wanna see market also.

title: Amazing!!!
review: I went to Dargah Shariff in April 2015 when I was going to drop my son to Mayo. Undoubtedly, the best time to visit is in the evenings. The place is open till late evening so don't hurry up unless it is winter season. The brightly lit shops all across the lane to Dargaah is a nice experience in itself. Lot's of things to shop for. You will find nice Kurtaas, Rajasthani - chanderi, cotton, silk, sarees and dress material, stone jewellery and of course sweets to savour.

title: dont hand out charity
review: visiting the dargah was high on our list.....went in and found it to beas expected....proper receipt for any any donation being given inside.too crowded on a normal day...many gates so friends and family got confused and all lost...has to collect everyone which took a good part of an hour....do not hand out charity to ladies and girls asking for it in and arounf the dargah...if yoy do you are totally gone.a new face will apppear every minute.no end to it.

title: Abode of god
review: Best place to visit in life. Just beware of the people inside and outside the mosque as all of them are just thieves in one or another way. They very well know how to extract money off your pocket.they target outsiders..

title: Very unorganised
review: This holy place is very peaceful. but the management people do not bother the control the crowd. this place is very busy and many pick pocketers are moving around to fix your pocket. so you make sure you look after your pocket and other belongings. the pray area is very nice but the dargah itself is in a very small room and there is no management to control the visitors. people pushin each other like there is no tomorrow. most shop keepers push you to buy flowers and other stuffs from their shop.

title: Holy Sufi Shrine.... a must visit
review: A truly divine place... This Sufi Shrine is world famous and with full of holy spirit, devotion & peace of Mind.... A must must visit..... Need to organize the way to Shrine

title: A must visit
review: Dargah Shariff is always vibrant with people, music, and prayers. Although a bit crowded, I found it very peaceful when I sat to listen to the sufi music they play. Whatever wish you ask for in Dargah Shariff, it does come true.

title: Pure bliss
review: Words are not enough to write about this place. The whole environment is so peaceful. Must visit place for all

title: Dargah Shariff......mesmerising...
review: A crowded small street filled with vendors, traders and travellers.... Animals, rickshaws, bikes...all chaos.... but at the end of this street lies a place no less than Mecca for many travellers... Yes this is Dargah Shariff...

title: The mecca of India
review: Simply put,It's the mecca of India.A sense of holiness surrounds you once you enter the dargah.People of all religion are welcome here without any bias.Truly a great example of communal harmony

title: nice one, can visit
review: in the city of ajmer very famous and people come here from different parts of the counrty. its gets very busy on friday, avoid visiting on friday. The place is not so crowded and you can easily cover the attraction in an hour. Not very far from railway station, you get autos and rikshwas easily to travel to and from the station.

title: Must visit
review: When you visit such holy places you fall short of words, you can't describe what and how you feel, just wonderful, mesmerizing experience

title: "Wonderful place"
review: It is wonderful place but crowded,we feel so peaceful here,nice dargah,very nice smell of roses here.

title: Khwajah Saab always bless Us.🙏
review: Its wonderful to be here, positive energy all the way. Never want to miss visit to such wonderful place on earth for the people of this world.

title: Powerpack place
review: I have always seen Dargah Shariff in movies.. Wanted to visit..Have been here once ..Good power pack place...

title: "Khwajah Ji Saab Pe Meher Karein.."
review: As it says jab ruhaani Takton ko bulana hota hai to bula hi leti hai...Blessed that Khwajah Sahib got me chance to visit the place and get his blessings. I am no one and have no words to Rate the attraction at all.. Its a world known place where every one get blessed with his wishes and every one must come specially or get chance to cross Ajmer...You ahve to come prepared to be long ques to go inside the Dargah...It's worth taking blessings from God Almighty...

title: Nice place
review: Nice place to visit at least once in your life. Just beware of the people inside and outside the mosque as all of them are just thieves in one or another way. They very well know how to extract money off your pocket. My advise will be to take just the right amount in your pocket that you seriously need other than just keeping hefty amount.

title: An oasis of peace
review: Ajmer is the City where the Dargah of Garib Nawaz. Whatever be the historical value of this city, for me it was a place of solace and peace. The Dargah of Garib Nawaz is located in a very congested part of the city and you have to go through all the hustle and bustle to get in. Once inside you do have to work you way through throngs of peopleof all religions and walks of life, coming there to seek the blessings of the Garib Nawaz. But I found a strange sense of peace within me when I was inside. Surprisingly I did not feel the urge to ask for any of my wishes to be fulfilled. It was as if I had just been blessed with all I wanted without asking for anything.

title: Ok Visit
review: It was just a ok feeling as I want to go to Dargah shariff once reach at place feeling was I am at wrong place.

title: Exciting and authentical
review: One of the best visits in our whole India trip.  We parked 500 mts away and walked the way up to Dargah.  Just the walk up the street is an experience on itself.  The place was packed with prayers, bit crowded, pushing but real passion could be felt everywhere.

title: Serenity within a melting pot
review: The Dargah Shariff temple is an oasis of serenity within the enourmosly overcrowded town that is Ajmer. Everyone is welcome in here and you can really experience the untainted ceremonies of the Sufi religion. We washed our hands and feet and were invited to do offerings alongside the local muslims.

title: EXCELLENT!!
review: This my friends is one of the best relgious spot Ive been to. Eevry year millions of people come by to visit this holy place. Going back into history a little bit, this Dargah is a sufi shrine of the sufi,  Moinuddin Chishti. A must visit place if you are planning to go to Ajmer only once. The best part of the year to visit is the winters in India which start from november and extend till january end.

title: Heaven on Earth
review: Just go there, sit and pray. It is heaven on earth. Go via Gate #4 near Mohammadi Guest House. It will save you painful walking through the dargah market on Agra gate side. Autos can drop you there though it takes a lot of skill to navigate this route.

title: Beautiful!
review: The view of the Dargah Shariff was very beautiful. You have to walk a few hundred metres to reach the Dargah through a crowded street. Pay a visit during the evening.

title: Dargah sharif.
review: A very crowded place but worth to go alway.

title: Nice Shrine..Worth to Visit
review: If you want to a nice Muslim Shrine in India, you should not miss this chance! Go to Ajmet and visit Ajmer Sharif Dargah. You gotta walk barefoot again like any other religious temple in India.

title: worth visiting once.
review: have been waiting for a long time to visit this place and finally was able to make a quick trip. Only reason I'm putting it down as average is because like many other religious places in India, this one is also controlled by some people who just would love to make you spend money in one name or other.

title: Divine Experience
review: Just cannot stay away from Khwaja Garib Nawaz. I love to visit the Dargah whenever he calls me. I would never get enough of this place. Would love to come here again and again.

title: KGN Dargah Shareef
review: We drove from Jaipur to Ajmer it took around 2 and a half hours to reach Ajmer. Kept our car in the car parking area and left with a rickshaw for reaching the dargah sharif. There were many sweet shops along the road of the Dargah sharif. It was really amazing to visit the Dargah after so many years. Still the dargah was still the same and the crowd was as usual. Everyone flock to see the Dargah Sharif.

title: Worth Visiting Once
review: The only putdown are people constantly asking for money everywhere. From removing your slippers to getting extra God's Grace. The irony of the place was that, the place where they were accepting Donation, the receipt had the name of the person who got me there. Obviously for his commission later on. You don't need to pay a single money anywhere. God will bless you the same even if you don't offer flowers or the Chaddar.

title: Holy place for all...
review: This shrine has got a lot of following and rightly so, they say if you ask anything with your heart, it will not disappoint you. Loads of actors and famous people visit it regularly.

title: Marvellous Place of worship
review: The Dargah Shariff is just great. Everyone should visit at least once in his or her life time. People of all religions come there with great hope and faith. It is really wonderful to see that all sort of people leave behind there cast, creed, religion, race, social status behind. Every one is equal. Superb feeling.

title: Holy
review: A great place a. Peaceful and full of spirituality. Been there twice with my family and my friends. I recommend everyone to go there once

title: Peace
review: You get a sense of peace at this place. The sufi songs that people here sing are melodious and make you feel closer to the almighty.

title: Holy Place to visit.
review: Its very holy place to visit and prey there. Its very spiritual place and you will get peace of mind there and forget everything.

title: feeling of holiness everywhere
review: it was my first visit to ajmer n will be a destination to travel every year just because of Dargah shariff.i loved the place its purity cant be explained go visit there nu will fell my words.secondly dont listen to anybody who accompanies u zabarddasti u just politely tell them u want to worship on your own that's final.be there atleast once n enjoy the divine experience.

title: O mere Khwaja ji, bless me.
review: Well this was my 5th visit to the sacred shrine, and somehow you feel elated and blessed as soon as you enter the complex. The whole place though crowded, faith and hope of all present makes you part of a big huge family. Be it your touristy visit or for religious reasons, just sit for some time and slowly you mind, heart shall ignore the people, noises around and leave you in utter peace and calm. If you know any khadim inside do take his help for a better experience when inside the Garib Nawaz's mazar complex, it does help. Else have faith and just stand in one corner, you shall be blessed. Do use your discretion and politely avoid people expecting money and trying to exploit your sentiments.

title: Ajmer Sharif
review: A place of peaceful, pleasant spreads a message of humanity and spirituality. A sacred place where our wishes comes true in my opinion. Crowd is huge during night a must visit place in Ajmer nearby food courts offers you wide range of food items delicious and not expensive too. It is old saying that people who visit Ajmer Sharif and pray with pure faith and loyalty at his Dargah will  free their soul.

title: Satisfying visit to Shrine
review: The peace despite the crowd, no money-laundering and didn't at all feel that it was a worship place for muslims.

title: Religious  Trip
review: HAZRAT KHAWAJA GHARjourney AURAT a sufi Saint with mystic powers , people from all walks of life irrespective of religion flock to his shrine situated in Ajmer.

title: You feel cheated ............
review: We had gone to pay for our blessings, but the moment you enter into the lane for Dargah people will start follow you. You go to the shops for picking up offerings, they will also try to make money out of you.

title: Ya khwaja Garib Nawaj
review: Excellent holy place.. For all the religion but specially for Muslim.

title: You simply cannot describe it but just feel it
review: I have been to the Dargah Shareef twice and somehow in the middle of all the chaos of people sitting, worshiping, crying and sleeping; there is a certain calmness in that place that can be only felt but not described.

title: The Holy Place
review: The Holy dargah of Khwaja Garib Nawaz is a pleasant and peace for those who love humanity and spirituality.

title: Just an overhyped point.
review: I was expecting too much given the publicity of Ajmer dargah Sharif but was too confused when I reached there. Narrow streets lead to the dargah and you need to walk in these streets since even auto rickshaws can't reach there.

title: khwaja gareeb nawaz
review: i would suggest it worth visit in lifetime if you are in ajmer, the very first thing to do.

title: Not for the faint hearted
review: Though I loved every second of my visit here and feel blessed to have visited Dargah Shariff, let me tell you its mad busy and tends to get claustrophobic inside the dargah. Better to find someone who can help you. Dont easily trust people there, they can take you for a ride. An autorickshaw from the parking area to the Dargah (including 2 hours waiting) is INR 200. Rest is upto you how much you want to spend. Call- 09828595786 Sultan Khadim to ensure you get a good darshan. We used his services and he was a genuine guy- it helped he was part of the dargah committee when it came to the darshan

title: A place which is revered...
review: We had a very nice visit thanks to our Khadim. Early morning visit is alway advisable. However, there are thousands who go on their own and I felt the dargah committee can facilitate their visit better. The crowd around the shrine is not controlled well and hence there is always a jostling for space at the main place and that certainly should be improved. The early morning qawwali outside the main shrine was very pleasing to ears.

title: Spirituality
review: Ever crowded the dargah of holy saint is classic example of religious equality. The degh at the dargah is astonishing in size, beware of touts and pick pocketers.

title: very peaceful
review: Ajmer and dargah go hand in hand.

title: Excellent Holy place with a piece of mind
review: everybody know this place very well no explanation needed in terms of words. In this place you will find the piece of mind but this place is extra crowded.

title: truly magical
review: Visited dargah for the first time, bt it feels like d holy place is calling u again and again.Once u reach there U just forget evrythng. besides all these things i wud say dat d place is really crowded. My advice espcly to female travels is dat try to be in ur own group, or u and ur family members will get scattered leading to an uncomfortable situation if u r left alone in d crowd.jst to enjoy the spirtual experience without any distractions be in ur group.dont listen to anybody there who try to influence u. Evry corner of dargah is divine even if u jst get half a minute to stand inside d dargah.jst being there in such a holy place is a blessing in itself.

title: Holy Shrine
review: Divine place but the en route to this holy shrine is too crowded with many unwonted beggars all over with narrow and dirty roads.

title: Peaceful and must visit place
review: If you are a person who wants to know about religion and history this would be a great place for you. Ajmer Sharif dargah is regarded as a very important religious place and is truly a great one. Very peaceful place. It has got many historic ties as many constructions of this famous dargah is done by the greats of our country like Shahjahan, Akbar, Nizam of Hyderabad, Queen Elizibeth. Heart of Ajmer.

title: Peace of Mind
review: This is around  1.5 km from railway station.Auto and rickshaw was available.40 rs in ricksaw or in auto.

title: Ajmer Dargah
review: The ambiance was good. Most of the guys in and around the dargah were friendly. The only problem is with beggers.

title: Best Religious place in Ajmer
review: If you are going to visit Ajmer or Rajasthan, then you must go to the place. The place is filled with rich Islamic culture and "Dargah Sharif" is fully religious place. Also the architecture of the place is Amazing.

title: Pious Trip
review: Had a wonderful Darshan, gave chaddar, saw the muslims offering Namaaz, and finally hear Qwali in the evening.

title: Most Miraculous Darga....If visited with Strong Belief
review: I have been visiting this Holy Darga since 2007 regularly. This is one of the place on earth i would prefer to visit every time without any second thoughts. Though the location is extremely interiors and very crowded all the times, but once stepped inside you get the satisfaction. Many important and holy places are located in this main darga and must be visited.

title: No peace!
review: Well, everyone there is out to take your money. They ask money for everything. It is such a nice and quiet place to worship, but they won't let you because all they care is that you keep dropping a tenner with every step you take.

title: Full with people asking for money
review: Full of people asking for money including maulvee.it you though you are going to get some peace there forget.

title: A Sacred Place
review: The shrine of the sufi saint Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti, is a place where one can go in search of peace. One can offer chaddar to Khwaja Ajmeri. People say that your wishes come true if you wish something with pure heart. There are 2 Deghs (couldron), badi degh and choti degh. One can put money, food grains or anything that they can. All this is used to cook Niaz (purely vegetarian food; cooked with rice, ghee, nuts, safron & sugar). This is then distributed amongst people. There are 2 mosques in the complex.

title: All I can say is thank you...
review: Cannot comment on the place as we cannot review our creator .... However word of advise is all things are available inside the dargha ... Buy from there.... The lane leading to the place is full of thugs .. please watch out ... Parking is there as people have broken their houses to make it to parking place.(100-150 is the rate)..Police not too concerned here...

title: Ajmer Dargah
review: We went to the Dargah Shariff in Ajmer and we were escorted inside as VIP for going inside the dargah for worshipping. and one of the best dargah in the world.

title: excellent
review: this dargah is a very popular in india.many celebs often visiting this holy place.i visited this place in feb10 ,2015.i like this place very much.photography strictly not allowed inside dargah.

title: dargah visit
review: Please go once but its closed from 3-4 pm. Parking available 1km before dargah near Delhi gate for Rs 70-100/- Best to visit without any help/guides who will of course pester you for sometime. Try not to carry too much money and keep your purses close

title: A unique shrine
review: A unique shrine famous worldwide.  Closed from 3 – 4 pm.  Car parking is available 1km away near Delhi gate for Rs 100.  Easy walk from the car park to the shrine but the street is small, crowded and dirty.  Shoes need to be removed and you have to climb a few stairs to enter the premises.  Guides and touts abound and so do pickpockets.  The shrine is always very crowded and the queues to enter the shrine are not orderly so people nudge and push often.  There are continuous requests for donations for various pretexts by many young men.  Genuine donations are put it in an open vessel on the right hand side of the dargah.  Photography is strictly not allowed inside the dargah but one can take some pictures of the premises and gates which are beautiful.

title: No title..
review: I had heard so much about this place. Hence decided to visit when I had gone to Jaipur. I specially traveled to Ajmer by train only to visit this Dargah.. It was so difficult to get a ride in auto to go to Dargah. You reach to Dargah and that 2-3 mins walk is unbearable as you would see people rolling on the floor begging for money. Very crowded and no pity.. People are being pushed around. There is a well there where you can put a coin. People say that all your wishes can be fulfilled by doing so.Overall my experience was not so great and I didnt spend more than 10-15 mins but its very popular. You will find people following all religion coming and asking for their wishes to get fulfilled. Visited in September 2013.

title: Very popular and crowded
review: The visit to Dargah if you are travelling to Ajmer is a must-do.

title: Many Priests
review: I thought only in Hindu temples there is a menace of pandas (priests) but I see this place has also become very commercialized and spirituality takes a back seat when a whole pack of people are trying to lighten your pocket and not your soul.

title: Not go
review: I was going to but vary crowded feel this place not good vary dust and not clean and poor people some body hell every minute flows for Moony purpose not good place

title: holy place
review: once we enter the premises the place was so peaceful that the person himself wants to come again. i visited dargah with the help of fellow some khadim provided from the hotel payal ajmer. the person helped us to visit dargah and explained about the dargah. thanks to the hotel people and staff who provided such guide.

title: Nice
review: This place has got a historical significance and hence is so popular ...that it's like a crime to travel to Ajmer and not go here.

title: Ajmer Dargah
review: Travelled in May 2014. Initially I was very excited to part of this divine Journey . 1) As a Precautionary measure it is advised that people should not carry any valuables inside for sure especially wallets and mobile phones because once you are carrying flowers on her head (Chaddar) you will be giving free access to thieves to your pockets  and that is how I lost my expensive mobile phone.

title: place to see
review: is quiet pleasant atmosphere ,you would like to stay there as much as u want .

title: In the name of the sufi saint...
review: The journey to the dargah was an ordeal-dangerously narrow lanes lead to the dargah and you only have the auto rickshaws as the mode of transport.They charge a flat rate for the to and fro journey.The place is very crowded and it is strongly advised that the devotees/visitors shouldn't carry any valuables inside.And you hardly get enough time to pay your respects!!Nevertheless,just being there in the vicinity of Sufi Saint Moinuddin Chisti's dargah brings you peace of mind and has a calming effect on you.

title: Best place of harmony in India
review: I have been visiting this dargah from 20 years and the kind of harmony and expectation people carry is unthinkable.

title: Not a big fan
