review: To crowded, too...religious! The Ajmer expressway however is the best road I have driven in India with long wide stretches which feel as if covered in butter.

title: Wali E Hind
review: Feel at peace. Please have a known Khadim to help you take inside the Dargah and the inner sanctum. Otherwise the other Khadims or people harass & trouble first timers and ask for money.

title: A location with positive vibes and energy!
review: Ajmer is known for the Dargah Sharif and it has an aura of positive energy in it. I visited in the early morning to avoid rush and managed to complete the visit in good time. The place is crowded and plenty people approach you as salesman. You have to be wise and not fall in for their persuasion.

title: A place where u get what u want
review: I remember a phrase " till the time u do not have a call you cannot reach the Dargah". but this time I had been called very nice experience. Love to go again and again

title: a holy place
review: a place is must visit place.

title: A spiritual experience
review: I truly enjoyed every moment here just sitting in the coomon area where we can sit on the floor and spend time in peace or prayer.  I was by myself and spoke with a khadim who approached me. I allowed him to help me and he sure helped without asking for much. I  left a small donation and tip but very appreciated the non pushy nature. I got flowers just outside the dargah. went in fairly quick and the most enjoyable part was just sitting right outside the altar but in the dargah grounds. Clean and so well taken care of.

title: The organised begging ruined the experience.
review: the place is nice but the organised begging ruins the experience. Wherever you go, everyone is asking you to pay some money for various TRICKS. Felt like running away from the holy place. Management must amend the ways it functions.

title: Best visited early morning
review: It gets really crowded later in the day, but mornings here are quiet, peaceful and reflective. Extended qawwali performances make it all the better.

title: Place of Worship with devout piligrims
review: Highly regarded place. Considered to be the highest regarded Dargah in Indian Sub continent.. Good place..

title: Over crowded
review: Such a famous place of worship lacks any kind of management. Its a very famous place and people have great respect for this place of worship, hence something really needs to be done.

title: This is where it all started.....
review: Khwaja Ghalib Nawaz as he's fondly called for his love for the poor... Ajmer Darga was the first Sufi darga in India... This is the start of Chishti silsilla. Tomb of revered Saint Khwaja hazarat Moinuddin chishty known for miracles before n after his death.. Celeberate by people from all religions, all walks of life. I have personal belief on this darga based purely on self experiences and results that I have seen. Go here for spiritual cleansing as well as to have ur pure wishes fulfilled but please remember it's all about faith....

title: Nice Dargah
review: One of the holiest place and crowded....It's inside the middle of the area. One has to hire an auto to get to this dargah and the streets are to small so we cudnt go in car. We reached in evening and had good darshan of the dargah.

title: Divine place
review: I visit almost once a year and this is an amazing shrine where you could feel the divine moments.

title: go for your personal reasons..money making business..
review: probably the last time I'l be visiting this place.. as soon as you are 100m metres from the Dargah, the whole jing bang starts..we parked are car at some place and paid an autowallah Rs.200 to take us till the Dargah..he warned us of pick-pockets inside & outside the dargah - shoes/wallets/phones etc being stolen..also told us to not to be fooled by people inside..they will try and extract money.. we left our shoes in the auto and headed for the Dargah..

title: The most aweful tourise place
review: The most awful and dirty tourist place I have seen.  While all tourist and religious places are very commercial, the issue is more about cleanliness and attitude of the people. Vehicles are not allowed near the Dargah, one has to park almost a kilometer away and walk tot eh Dargah. the street is over crowded and has stall of all types throughout. Don't get conned by the many touts who are waiting to fleeze the tourists, in more than one way. At the actual Dargah, one can just walk past it since you are constantly being pushed from all over. AND WOMEN, BETTER BE VERY CAREFUL, THERE ARE MANY OF THOSE NASTY CHEEP GUYS WHO WILL PINCH YOU ALL OVER. YOU CAN JUST DO NOTHING ABOUT IT, EVEN IF THIS STUPID GUY STAND THERE AND GRINS AT YOU.  So ladies, be extra careful when you go in.  Also, hold on to your things, else they will quickly disappear and you will not even realize it.

title: Ajmersharif
review: Dargah has Big compound , Good architectural work . To go inside main Dargah for Darshan you need to cover your haed at least by hanky , you are not allowed inside with bare head. Atmosphere is pleasant and soothing.

title: Just for Visit
review: Very Crowded and Dirty place. People are just asking for money. From Parking Bay to Auto Wallah, then the guide.. everyone seems to be making money. even what you offer to dargah, the guide immediately take his share from the shrine. Personally not liked this, but just to see the place i visited.

title: An experience to be had!
review: As a westerner this was my first real local experience of India and it truly was something different. While the actual Dargah itself is more of a business place and pickpockets are abound generally if you can organize a LEGITIMATE Khadim (Dargah Caretaker) before hand your experience should be hassle-free and relatively simple. As a muslim i found some of the practices here questionable however i went here purely as a cultural visit and enjoyed the sights, sounds and smells that truly encapsulate the indian muslim culture. I can recommend going there during the night since the beauty of the structures is even more evident.

title: Accompanying friends
review: I usually go with my friends who come to Ajmer for this attraction.

title: Pay as you wish
review: An interesting religious site to visit. A few too many people asking for donations. You need to check your bag at the coat check, your shoes at the door, and wear something on your head when you enter.

title: No one is "SHARIFF" at Dargah Shariff
review: Too many will ask you for donation at this place and that's outside the dargah. I donated 100 Rs and this guy whom I donated to asked for 500 Rs. When I asked for receipt he said that receipt is only given for donations above 250 Rs...

title: Mashaalah! What else can you say about an experience like this!
review: It was a fantastic experience..

title: Nice Place
review: Do visit this 920 year old Dargah, one feels really good once you reach the premises. Crowded but yet peaceful.

title: Disappointment
review: I was sad to see people stooping so low. On every second step I found some one demanding money. Sometime using one pretext and sometime using another. These people will shower loads of blessing in one second and then ask money and if you refuse or ignore, God save you, they turn insulting and rude. It is too crowded and these people use this opportunity to emotionally blackmail you. I was not able to concentrate on the beauty of the mazaar (dargha) or enjoy the spiritual experience till I turned deaf ears to these people who rob in name of faith and religion. Once I blocked them, it was a good place.

title: Overcommercialisation
review: It’s sad such a religious place is so dirty. Wife wanted to visit so it came into our radar. Been their ages back and unfortunately this time the whole place seems to have turned into business centre wherein everyone seems interested in your wallet be it outside or inside the Durgah. Durgah itself seems so powerful, I wish you could spend more time and not pushed all around.

title: Dargah Shariff
review: Please avoid any agent, when you enters main dome many people ask for but plz avoid do the darshan by own... if you want to make any donation so do on counter or in box place by shariff board,

title: Touts galore
review: It's a place where people go for solace and peace and to pray to God but it's being made into a business place by the touts or money mongers. Even if u buy a chaddar for the dargah, it's already back in the same shop even before u finish ur visit. Touts will tell u to keep money here, there and also to make a donation, the donation slip mentions the touts name so prob he gets a cut. Spiritual place being robbed of all spirituality. Approach to dargah is not only terrible but difficult too.

title: Meaningful visit. Beware of "priests"
review: The Ajmer dargah sharif is beautiful, expansive and calm. It was surprising that they let women in till the tomb of Khwajja Gharib Nawaz, unlike other dargahs like Nizammudin in Delhi. However, there were "priests" ready to give us blessings, chant prayers, etc and ask for donation. It took a firm "no" and steady focus on praying and getting out to avoid being looted.

title: Simple little shrine of pilgrim!
review: Crowded, don't expect quiet atmosphere, beware of pick pocketers, don't fall prey to pay too much, keep quiet and complete your prayer and get out. God will know, what you need, not what you show.

title: Beggars and fake priests ruined an excellent place
review: Before you even reach the Darga you'll find yourself surrounded by beggars and shopkeepers who are trying to sell you a handful of flowers, a thread, a sheet, bandana etc. Its shocking to see how the people there just see you as a cow that can be milked for money, right from the auto-walas to the fake priests or the so called fakir kids or begging women everyone just wants money out of you. The moment you enter kids rush to usher you to a fake priest who'll say a small prayer and ask you for money to donate in the Lords name.

title: Over--Commercialisation of once a pious shrine
review: It was a seer disappointment.Visit this place at your own risk.Ever second person asks you bluntly for money starting right from the road that takes you to the shrine.Beware of pick-pocketers as the place is over-crowded.Even inside the pious dargah,you would'nt be allowed to peacefully pay your offerings n tribute.There are huge khadim's surrounding the dargah,who again ask you for money for paying your tribute.

title: Nice Experience
review: Visiting the dargah of Garib Nawaz was an awesome experience. We laid chadar at the dargah...got a great feeling. Stories of badi deg and chhoti deg were interesting...I feel the dargah committee should work towards streamlining the crowds that entre the dargah as the place where the dargah is a small room. Otherwise fantastic experience.

title: Khwaja Mere Khwaja.........
review: Although outside area was congested..the iner portion was highly admirable. People from all religions were flocking in. It has a charismatic atmosphere. People chanting ....some singing Kawallis....some just sitting..still there is no unpleasant noise. One evening I tried to have close darshan..but I failed. Next day my hotel arranged for a VIP Darshan..and it was fruitful as one person (having seat within the premises) arranged for "Chadar" "Flowers" and "Donations" smoothly ..I could touch the feet of the saint..all in just ten minutes.

title: Religious place
review: this is very religious place and crowed most of the time , if you stay in Ajmer early morning visit is good. people make it commercial but if you don't want just enter and come no need to give money to any one. you can have good prayer .

title: Too much commercialization!
review: Unlike the other two major religious places (Hajrat Nizamuddin- Delhi; Haji Ali- Mumbai), this place is, unfortunately, too much affected by business. The heavy commercialization dilutes the divine feeling one would otherwise expect. You will be asked for money at each and every step, (in a rude manner, possibly) don’t contribute to the business part. Even the – feed the poor thing is fixed. In front of the mazaar, the energetic Qawwali is one of the very few things which will make you feel good at the place. Music lovers will find this part very smoothening.

title: muslim religious place
review: go for a visit, the place is very commercialized surrounded by shops, flowers vendor. inside you will be asked to donate even you don't want to they will ask you to donate

title: Blessed
review: Felt blessed at the Dargah Shariff, I visited after 19 years. The path leading to Dargah is full of beggars and middleman, but don't pay attention to any of them. You can go for the Darshan on your own. It's a very holy place, I felt divine.

title: place of peace
review: As one of the most favorite and important places in India for the followers of Islam, Dargah Shariff enjoys huge popularity among Hindus as well as other visitors from all over the world. Please leave your cameras outside to get a good glimpse of the actual variety of smaller structures placed throughout the campus of the Dargah. One can feel the calm and peace in the vicinity compared to hustle and bustle just outside in the market. Situated in the heart of the city and its citizens you will have no trouble finding it. Enjoy your visit and make sure to get one of the thousand little souvenirs from the vendors.

title: Too commercialized
review: Nice religious place, but is too commercialized. Go if you have faith, but beware of the people who try to sell you things.

title: Holly place turned commercial
review: Visited during recent visit to Ajmer and it's really odd to see so much commercialisation of such a holly place. This is the only drawback that you been asked and even forced to pay which is way odd when being at such a respectable place. Visit with faith in kind and not because you can pay and get things done.

title: Its Heaven on Earth
review: Khwaja ji dargha, is what I was planning for years but never got a chance to visit, but finally I made it through and feeling blessed. Its very crowded as lacs of devotees visit every day, so you have to devote some time to visit khwaja ji. But its worth of everything. Don't forget to tie dhaga at the dargha for your wishes.

title: Spiritual Place captured by professionals
review: Dear All,

title: Holi Place but not so maintained
review: This is world famous Dargah also known as Hazrat Khwaja Moinuddin Chishty Dargah of Sufi saint. It is equally popular among all religions. on entry Khadims try to pressurize you to take them along with you and not so maintained.

title: Visit with precautions
review: If you take a car, you need to park it a km away from the Dargah. Then you have to take an auto which will cost Rs.150 for to and fro ride to te dargah. This is one of the place where you get cheated.

title: Truly Devotional
review: Popular among all the religions ,  the famous Dargah  is situated in the streets of ajmer.

title: world famous dargah
review: this is a very beautiful dargah and is famous and sacred for all relegions. people visit this place for fulfilment of their wishes.there is one big kadahi in which people put all kind of donations from money and other eatables and it is said that these things are used for making the parshads there.

title: Bad behavior !!!
review: Today I went to visit Dargah Sharif in Azmer, India. I had a guide and driver who help me to prevent some unexpected problem inside there. Some of Khadem (So called sicurity themselves) became angry with my driver and me because Who wanted to make money from me. They"ll pray for me to Allah or God. Many people donate money or chador or flower by there pressure. If you don"t do that then they will angry and kind of aggressive behavior. Somehow I managed them but be careful those places. I don't recommend.

title: Sorry but I did not relish
review: This place has religious beliefs attached to it but I did not relish the visit to this place. May be because I visited here on Friday at about 5 PM, this was the peak rush time there as there are number of visitors on Friday. t the time of Fie the Dargah was closed for about 30 minutes for Roshni (The evening Prayer) and my kids got irritated because of the waiting and the rush there. Spiritually this place is good but the three wheeler driver took me there from some side street stating that there is no rush thru that way and the path was very bumpy.

title: Holy Commercial Place
review: It is nice to visit in the evening during the namaaz time and just watch everyone if you are non-muslim. The place is very commercial in the sense that people push you to pay for everything and make donations. Don't budge if you don't want to. There is also no control of the crowd or organised queues so everyone is pushing and pulling. Could be done more peacefully if managed properly.

title: DON'T GO...
review: It was a nightmare and refuses to go away. On our 10day tour, I can very confidently say that Ajmer dargah hit the nadir. You will not miss anything if you don't visit this place. It is very scary and intimidating place. We actually did not enter the dargah because of the intimidatory people and surroundings. In fact we were so disappointed that we travelled a long distance just to see the dargah and yet did not enter. For people who are not so religiously inclined towards Sufism, I would advise you to give it a miss.

title: Truly religious and includes the whole religion!
review: Here is the tomb of the Indian Sulthan Kwaja Mueenudheen Chisty! Great place for people to fulfill their desires of both the worlds! There are alot people from the poorest to the richest visiting the Dargah Sharief! It was a special feeling to be in the dargah! Daily there will be khawalis (with songs praising the sulthan)after 9 pm!

title: Not a good experience.
review: Young chaps in Green Kurti....in the Dargah fools you around. They took you to dargah by shortcut avoiding mob and at the end manages to grab good money from you. For car parking at private place cost you RS 150/- for 2 hours.     Overall a bad experience due to people around.

title: Holy place
review: A holy place of worship for muslims. The place is too crowded but supposed to a holy place where one's wishes would come true. Advisable not to use costly mobile phones or have lot of cash in wallets as theft is quite prominent. Slippers will get lost if just kept outside the dargah. So better to give it to a person who takes care of it. Inside the darghah, it is good and calm. Lot of places nearby to have roadside food.

title: “Ajmer Sharif Dargah"
review: This is true that People not only from India comes from the world . But unfortunately some people in and around are not good . My personal experience that there is not good place to keep shoes and I lost when I came back from inside and instead of helping , The shopkeeper those were selling Flowers Laugh on me and comments " SAB AGAR HUM SAY PHOOL LAY LAITY TO AISA NAHI HOTA" - ie if you would have purchased flowers from  us than you will not lost your Shoes.....

title: Holy place but very Commercial
review: A must visit place, highly respected but may be people operating it have made it very commercial. We got VIP treatment as we got a Khadim "Complimentary" from our hotel.

title: Beware of touts and beggars
review: Firstly there is no proper parking provided and the hotels charge around Rs.150 for parking your car. You will then be approached by some auto drivers who offer you to drop right at mosque again for Rs. 150 which includes to and fro charges. Then there are people all around the mosque area chasing you to donate money. Am giving 3 stars only because of these issues. Carry a hanky to cover your head which is mandatory for entering the premises

title: be ready for everything and anything
review: this is a holy place but is commercialized, the khadim take you around but eventually you need to pay them for the job . Really a struggle to get inside if you are not with a khadim, also keep an eye on your belongings .

title: Holy Ajmer Dargah - Krishna Duvvuri
review: Keep your travel plan a day more when you plan to visit Jaipur not to miss this Holy Place for Muslims.  It is heard that those who visit this Dargah and wish it happens.  It is 150 km from Jaipur and we took a cab from Jaipur to reach this place.  You are advised to keep your footwear with any flower vendor where you buy flowers before entering into this Dargah.  Also, there are certain rituals to be followed to enter into this Dargah which will be guided by the people over there.  Do not expect more guidance unless you are accompanied by a travel agent along with you.  We observed the place is very small but the significance of this place is wide spread. Keep all your belongings in your car and do not carry mobiles and camera for easy access and quick return.  Krishna Duvvuri

title: great place
review: once to enter the small gate on to the street leading to the dargah...the road walk is wonderful...you have al kinds of shopes selling food to religious offerings...it is filled with people and lively even in the late nites..

title: One of Holiest Place for All Humans
review: Dear All,

title: Like it the way it is
review: You go to Ajmer to visit this famous Dargah. Had it not been for this reverend place, tourists would hardly flock there. So, there is hardly anything left to be told. People come there for its spiritual value and to seek blessings. They get that! As with other religious places in India, this place too is full of agents and brokers, who make you surrender money at several points. You must be aware of them. To safe guard your pocket too is your very own responsibility. That said, you are sure to find solace at this place. Visit this place in the evening with some time to spend. Then you can also hear some profound soul qawwali or the devotional Urdu songs sung at the holy Muslim shrines.

title: Go by yourself to the dargah. Dont employ the services of middlemen
review: Visited the dargah with family on 30.10.2014. Got tricked into  by our car driver for taking the services of a influential khadim/middleman who would take us inside the dargah without a line. The cheating started by paying Rs. 300 to the rickshaw for a ride of 1 km. The khadim made us buy a costly chaddar Rs. 1200 & then took us to a guy who was taking donations as per his wish & was rude when you stated your amount of donation. donate money yourselves to the needy.The person who takes your offerings inside the dargah asks for a minimum of Rs. 500 for offering your chaddar to the  khwaja & wishes bad if you dont payup. The dargah is very crowded & frequented with pickpockets. I lost my wallet. There were many more who had lost their wallets in the dargah. If you happen to visit the dargah do it yourselves. dont employ the servies of any middlemen. take flowers or anyother offering of your choice & dont get tricked in by any shopkeeper. dont carry wallets & mobiles, you will surely loose them. just carry minimum cash in your front pockets. be careful of your children, it is almost a stemped like situation inside the shrine. be careful & dont allow anyone to play up on your faith, beliefs & emotions.

title: Tere dar per aaya hu
review: What a Dargah ?while visiting the place keep some time and don't carry cameras as they don't allow anything inside. Must see the food preparation at the Dargah.

title: Dargah Shariff
review: Good Part :- Hotels are not expensive,Cab booking are also not too high, Less traffic in city, Lots of Art all around.

title: Faith doesnt need rating
review: This place is a visit for believers, if you are here for monument or just a watch keep away.  The rush and narrow lanes will trouble a tourist but not a believer.

title: Blessed
review: Had been to Ajmer via Jaipur

title: Excellent Property & Hospitality, Great Value for Money
review: We had a very good & pleasant trip to ajmer, & appreciate our decision of Chosing The Royal Melange Hotel. Thanks to entire team of TRMH.

title: Good place
review: When you are in Ajmer must visit Dargah Shariff. It is one of the most historical Dargah. While visiting the place take care of valuables.

title: Miracle
review: It is one of the holiest place OF worship in INDIA not only for the muslims BUT also for other caste

title: Open cheating in the name of faith.
review: I had a bad experience the moment I reached Ajmer. I was looted & cheated, so don't want any more people travelling there to suffer.

title: Good experience !
review: Dargah is just amazing and filled with positive vibes .... The only warning I want to suggest is that the place surrounding the Dargah can be one hell of an irritating experience for new people ! The place has tonnes of people (even children) who will push you to buy their products. They are very dominating.... I would suggest to keep your money and wallets inside your bag as it can be snatched or stolen. You will find some small kids hovering around the place who may surround you and frustrate you a lot  to fetch some money. (Don't give them any money rather if you really feel to give something then buy food for them !).......

title: The ultimate place of divinity.
review: The ultimate place of divinity. The Dargah sharif of Moinuddin Chishti in Ajmer is a revered place of worship.

title: A fantastic cultural experience
review: If you are Non-Indian and Non-Muslim don't be put off from visiting - you will be made welcome.

title: mannat
review: Very nice experience...u generally get wat u wish for....

title: An experience ...
review: We went to Dargah Sharif last week. Fortunately, we went through a contact who was part of their core committee due to which the whole experience was hassle free. Was surprised & disappointed to know that wallets & mobiles are being stolen regularly and one needs to be really careful. Its a beautiful monument ...

title: Ajmer Sharif Dargah has its own Charm
review: This was my second time after mira dattar dargah at reay road in mumbai. This is built in a huge place. lot bigger than the one i seen earlier. Lots of tourists were at the dargah. it was almost quater to 3 in the afternoon when we reached as we had heard that the dargah closes for an hour upto 4pm IST. so we had this visit in a hurry.

title: A must-visit place
review: This is among the world's most famous dargah and people from all over and from all religions come her...mainly to get their wishes fulfilled.Access is very dirty and tough but once you have made it and if you can find the right guide, the tour is very satisfying.vist th

title: Good place
review: A place with huge rush....so many touts running behind you....You get a cloak room from the Dargah with a fees of Rs. 10, but I don't think its safe there The staff in cloak room is not worthy. At Dargah, due to heavy belief you will find all kind of people. Many fakeers would also be there who would like to attract you but you can simply go in a queue and offer your prayers. Good place to be at

title: serene
review: The moment you approach the dargah the fragrance of roses embrace you. Its roses and roses all around.... stalls full of offerings of fresh rose petals and more of these as you enter the complex.

title: Keep your wallets n mobiles safe
review: Rs 200 , auto rickshaw wil take to take you and bring back to hotel Shobraaj (prominent hotel)...

title: har cheez mile Dargah Sharif
review: Dargah Sharif is alike a Gods paradise,muslims place no anyone is welcome as in gurdwaras,churches,temples so fear not and visit,Yes  beware of pickpockets and car looters,do not leave anything in your car,u may not find it when you return.

title: Holy Place
review: Though a bit commercialised but very serene. Gives eternal peace and calmness as you step inside the main tomb. Do see the utensil (kadai) gifted by Akbar & Aurangzeb. Wonderful aura. God bless all :)

title: Lucky are those who pay obeisance here
review: I would have gone back from jaipur and had no plans of visiting Ajmer with my family. But an auto wala just casually said that only the fortunate ones go to this revered place! And i cancelled my return tickets to visit this famous Dargah. What a blessed decision it was!

title: holy place but full of pickpockets frauds theives beware for wallet,valuables in car
review: first the good ones , truly holy place with history ,real value of your worship --- chadar pls carry yours from your home , all chadar u present is resold and resold and resold ,but anyway better buy from your hometown , no good place to eat hygenic food nearby , for  staying in  hotel better move to pushkar just 15 mins away ,dont stay in ajmer at all , MINUS POINTS -- very messy management , khadims rule the place, everyone has eye on your money in every way even your valuables in car are not safe ,pay high parking fee , leave all the gold u wear or  money u carry in secret place hidden in car in proper paid parking -- let them rip u for parking atleast your valuables will be safe , for food just go 2 kms from  market and still some place is average food , near dargah food is rubbish , unhygenic , full of flies , so pls avoid avoid , better go pushkar !

title: Kind of India Hazrat Khwaja Gharib Nawaz
review: it is an Ideal holy place. I love it. Plz come to pray there in the gate of King of India Khwaja Gharib Nawaz Moinuddin Hasan Chishti Sanjari Ajmeri rehmatlla aleh.

title: Foutunate to Visit
review: Its very holy place, must visit, Look for comfortable days for visit, There was huge rush due to diwali holidays, could not enjoyed fully, beware of pick pockets. D'not carry your purse, only some loose money is required.

title: Always worth the travel
review: I make it a point to visit the ajmer sharif dargah atleast once a year. Since i have been going there for quite a few years now, everything is planned well in advance. If you are a first time visitor, you will be overpowered by all the people selling their stuff and asking you to donate, but dont be misled by them. What i do is take with me one of the khadims (the official people authorised by the management) and ask him to take me for a round. Mind you, even with the khadim around there will be a lot of pushing and shoving so you have to be careful about that also.

title: Scary disappointing experience!
review: Dargah Shariff is a famous religious site, but currently it is a heritage site which is in need of desperate help for revival & maintenance!

title: Peaceful
review: Go there early in the morning ... don't get stuck with any of teh middlemen ... just stand in queue along with the others. Then you can just sit around in the compound and absorb the beautiful energy of this place.

title: Ajmer Wale Baba
review: A Famous Religious Site, Its located in City Center or rather City has been cetered around it. You have to walk about 1Km from either of enterances to reach main worship complex, but you will love this walk as all along their are shopping places, street food and restaurants. Make sure you have worn something full length( shorts, skirts,etc are not allowed in complex), but if you have arrived there in shorts no worries they provide Lungi's ( A wrap around for your bottom ) for free if available, else you could buy for around 100 Rs from nearby shops.

title: History humiliated...
review: It would be unfair to history if I rate it  any lower but that's the only reason I am not doing it. It's a nice place but the aura is just so negative that you are praying all the time but don't feel anywhere near the GOD. Misbehaving attendants/maulvis, uninterested shopkeepers, steeply priced parking lots and bad food...all no no.

title: Dont fear, When God is here
review: Also known as the Gharib navaz, Is a holy site for the Muslims. We feared visiting the place initially when we were informed that there are many pick pocketer's and thieves in this place.To our good luck, we didn't have any unforseen incident. we reached the site at 1100 hrs on a Tuesday and had a very charming, responsible and trust worthy, God gifted personnel who guided us through the place. We had not called upon him and he himself saw us as strangers and first timers and helped us out. Please dont get carried away about the money with which the CHADDAR and FLOWERS have to be bought. You can buy the CHADDAR and FLOWERS for Rs.100 and Rs.200 also... Whatever is possible by you. There is no other need to pay anyone or contribute any sort of money within. However, the Fear of somebody looting you remains... IF YOU ARE NOT CAREFUL !!!!

title: Dargah Shariff is a best place to be , just if you can calculate the day of travel
review: Dargah Shariff is one of the places where no body goes back empty handed.

title: For Religious Travellors
review: We went with a hotel sponsored guide so faced no difficulty in visiting the place. Nobody bothered us. However if going solo watch out for beggars who just wont leave you alone!! Place outside is crowded & gets more crowded during the evenings. However a place to visit & seek blessings!!

title: Different experience
review: Loved the atmosphere there. Different feel to what we get in Hindu temples or churches. So many Muslim devotees visiting this place. Maintenance is great and helpful. There is a cloak room to keep our things nearby cloak room. The fragrance inside the Dargah is unforgettable

title: Wish is fulfilled by Khawaja Garib Nawaj
review: I am fortunate to be born in the religious city of world renowned city AJMER which is one of the most historical city of India, it was the call of Kwajalein Sahab that we all three brothers drove down to Ajmer and were at the Dargah along with my child hood and classmate Shakeel Ahmed, who accompanied us, we were escorted by the khadim that was known to our friend and were inside with in few minutes, purchased rose flowers and petals and also Chadar that my younger brother wanted to put on the Mazar, it was very emotional moment for us when the cloth of the Chadar from the Mazar of Khawaja Sahab was touched and put on our head and the Khadim did the request pray to Khawaja Sahab for us, after the prayer the red thread of the wish full meant was tied on our right hand side by the Khadim.

title: very crowded place
review: it is said about this place that all your wishes here are fulfilled.

title: Ajmer Sharif Dargah
review: I was returning home fm.my month long vacay to Leh. As soon as we were in Rajasthan we decided that there was no way we were going home without visiting Ajmer Sharif and so by around 1pm we managed to reach Ajmer and we were told to hurry up because fm.2.30 onwards to 3.30 they shut it and visitors are not allowed.

title: Faith and faith
review: Super natural feeling but very unpleasant atmosphere due to pickpocketers.centre of faith and belief of all religions,a perfect example of Hindu-Muslim harmony.really wonderful.

title: sufi shrine -Super natural aura but not very pleasant experience.
review: Ajmer Sharif is a sufi shrine of sufi saint, Moinuddin Chishti. it's a holy destination but can be uncomfortable due to heavy crowd and followers of Ajmer sharif.

title: Only Ziyarat please
review: Liked the Dargah visit by ourselves without anyone taking us there. But disliked the Khadims there who say they will do free of cost but they slaughter at a right time and end up asking money from your pockets at their max, beware of theft and stay safe

title: Little scary
review: We parked our car and took an auto till Dargah , the auto ride was seriously very adventurous and dangerous( pregnant women better avoid) because of narrow and crowded streets. As we reached the beggars were after our life for money which was very scary. The place is mostly crowded and there will be people at the entrance who will ask you to come along with them as they would get you inside the shrine from a short cut that that free of cost(they only ask tourist who they feel will donate a large amount). With all the pushing and hitting each other we entered inside and donated(infront of us only that guy got his share from the donation we made).

title: No question about the Holy Saint, but very commercial experience
review: The shrine exhibits the tranquility and aura for which people have great respect and faith. We were fortunate to pay our respects and also spend some time in the shrine. However, beware of various touts and other khadims, etc. who are only looking to cash in on this faith. We were being tracked by these guys from the time we were in the vicinity of the dargah. They try to exhort you to buy expensive chadars and flowers and then also ask you to make hefty donations to the trust. We went prepared thanks to some TripAdvisor reviews and dint carry our wallet. Carry minimum cash and loose change. That's the best way to politely decline the touts. Take care of your pockets too.

title: A monument and religious place with too much crowd and money mongers
review: We went to see the shrine with neutral belief and lot of curiosity. its worth a visiti no doubts but the bad approach and lot of money mongers and threats of thief makes it very tiring for visitors.

title: pure bliss
review: If you believe in almighty, then this place is one of the closest you can be with him. Its a must visit.

title: must visit once
review: Fortunately it was not crowded when we visited. Approach road is narrow and its difficult to take own vehicle there. Autos do go there.Camera not allowed, phones are allowed. Beware of caretakers/local people you meet at the entrance itself as they will try to squeeze money out of you by helping you to reach inside the dargaah comfortably and quickly. Put the money in donation box. Do not miss listening to the qawwalis being performed there.

title: Commercialised & Crowded
review: a beautiful monument spoiled by the commercialized people and money mongers, a must visit just for the experience .

title: good experience
review: Must visit in Ajmer. Felt a bit of calm even in the very crowded dargah, the quawalli was making the atmosphere good. Only the way from hotel to dargah was very very pathetic with filth everywhere. there was garbage everywhere and you had to literally walk on it. hope the authorities and the locals keep it clean.

title: Visit to dargah
review: The place is nice one must go there once. People will be there behind you to facilitate the visit but it's not required you can go on you own and follow the Q.

title: Well revered place.
review: For fulfilling wishes, and on successful occasions one should seek blessings of Khwaja Garib Nawaz at Ajmer.  Widely acknowledged as holy shrine by all faiths.

title: Must visit once
review: Dargah is a must visit place, crowded but still you don't feel about that , people keep moving.

title: Peace of Mind
review: Was in stress and there were things running in mind... But as soon as I entered this Holy Shrine... I was at ease, with mind very peaceful and was calm. Hotel where I was staying helped me introducing to a person and he assisted my family (two adults + one infant) to get into the shrine negating the traffic and taking an alternate inside route to reach to the shrine. He also assisted us getting to the main worship area and we had a very good Darshan.

title: Visit to dargah
review: paying a visit to khwajaji was a fortunate thing, but the huge rush was a problem. specially with children its difficult.

title: Khawaja Gharibnawaz Dargah Ajmer
review: Khawaja Gharibnawaz Dargah Ajmer is the Maqbara (Grave) of Khawaja Moinuddin Chishti. Many people even I also believe that, If you wish something at dargah sharif with a holy heart it come true. Many times I visit dargah the qawali session is begin and environment is really very awesome. It take highest priority after the Makka Madina. If you visit first time then don’t forget to taking your hanky for covering your head, because in dargah sharif you should cover your head. Overall the place environment is very peace for heart and mind.

title: KGN
review: It also known as Dargah Sharif or Ajmer Sharif no need to tell more about them...

title: More for believers
review: This place is more for believers.. not for tourists I suppose. Of course, the place is holy and has its religious significance, but the place is overcrowded and the getting in and out of the dargah during the rush hours is not an easy task.

title: Faith & Bless !
review: Consider it an honor & achievement in life if you are here…. it is only because of Khwaja Gareen Nawaz's divine blessings that you reach here !! I can feel spirituality & the presence of Almighty here …. it is mystical yet very true. The Khaadims help you with taking you around and with any information that you seek.

title: Return with positive feelings
review: I have been to the Ajmer Dargah on three occasions and each time I have come away believing that visiting and giving my prayers there have made a positive contribution to my life. The last time I went there was in August 2008 with a friend. We didn't have a vehicle on us and they were quite particular about not allowing luggage into the Dargah (understandably) so as a result we had to go individually. It is still a fantastic place but of course it would have been great if we could have gone as a group and experienced the magic of the Dargah. I went around the Dargah, saw the place, your mere presence there makes you feel enchanted. After about 5 minutes of walking I went and offered my prayers. Although it was a Monday Afternoon, it was reasonably crowded, manageable without being crazy. I loved my experience here.

title: A place to visit & offer Fateha
review: I have been there couple of times at Khwaja Moinuddin chishti or Khwaja Ghareeb nawaz shrine.

title: Hazrat Mu'in ud-Din Chisti
review: Visited the dargah on our way to Puskhar

title: Truly Divine
review: Have been to this sacred Dargah Shariff just once an and its a great experience to be there. I loved the place and its Aura. As like every holy place this again has a Calm and peace atmosphere. So many beautiful flowers which we offer to our loving god but there's a drawback at the same time...we would see lot of caretakers roaming for here and there inside and they will help us all the time there but all they keep expecting is lot of money on each n every step.

title: Religiously Significant but too crowded for comfort
review: I understand it is religiously significant, and believers should go there. But don't think it is for regular traveler like me, Don't go out of the way (certainly not from Jaipur), but can visit if you are @ nearby place. The place is so crowded and approach is not good. We were suggested to keep our important belonging in the car itself.

title: Religious place or a Business Hub?
review: I find nothing religious or spiritual here...even locals are always rude and arrogant and talk about business..

title: Amazing Experience every time m there.
review: I m frequent traveller to this place.

title: TOO COMMERCIAL FOR MY LIKING
review: A must in every tourist's itinerary to Ajmer, but don't be too surprised if the visit turns out to be disappointing. Starting from the outside you would be hounded by beggars, thereafter the Khadims try to convince you to make a voluntary (sic!) contribution, not to forget the rose petals and chaddars (you pay for seconds -I am sure). Oh dont forget the pickpockets (the women are the worst). I could not find the Piety or Peace which the name of the place invokes. A visit to be forgotten.

title: Holy place with loat of chaos..
review: I went to this place with lot of faith & belief..But everyone is there to empty your pockets,starting from Rs.100 parking for 2 hours.Rs100 for Chadarr & same for flowers & other items  including scent,agarbattis which are mandatory to buy with flowers & once you are near stairsto enter the pilgrim peple will follow you till you are not out of this place,for getting money.

title: must visited place in ajmer
review: as an devotee of god.........we friends went there .......it was a nice experience ..place was very crowded..in in too many people were there for shoppin purpose also...overall a great place..............

title: Important thing
review: Be careful about your wallet and mobile while inside the dargah. Keep the wallet and mobile in front pocket of trousers.

title: nice experience
review: very good historical place where all people of different communities come to get there mannats  fulfilled

title: Too crowded
review: Well, if you are coming for a religious visit, then it is fine. But surely not recommended for a tourist visit. It is very crowded. Also, the condition of the dargah area is pretty bad.

title: Ya Garib  Nawaz
review: Asalaam Walekum

title: spiritual and harmony
review: great place. every individual of whichever religion or caste should come and pay respect to this holy shrine . really lovely place, gives great feeling of satisfaction and spirituality. feels lucky to visit this shrine of our Muslim brothers  .

title: Spiritual  enhance
review: the people say khadims are money digger !!!BUT the real spritualism with out them is impossible ,,,they take the people inside as if a child to his father as it is their duty to be doing it ,,as for asking about money is concerned  ,,it is not the problem of khadims it the problem of people who give money as from so long ,,,they started   giving money , so they started taking ..it is the problem we creat ourself then blame others .People have to be doing something if they were to be having the same income source.Will you give them if they dont ask !!!it is rude to be scarcastic on particular peoples .loved the way the kahdims make  pray for me in that glorious enviourment

title: Religion history
review: Hazrat Khwaja Moinuddin Chishty Dargah of  Sufi saint at Ajmer, Rajasthan, India. It is old saying that people who visit Ajmer Sharif and pray with pure faith and loyalty at his Dargah will  free their soul. Hazrat Khawaja Moinuddin Hasan Chishti is also known by different names as, Khawaja Gharib Nawaz, “Sultan-Ul-Hind”, Khwaja Baba, Khwaja Gharib Nawaz Ajmeri, Khwaja Sahib, Khwaja Saheb, Khwaja Ajmeri Saint Moinuddin Chishty. The Dargah Khawaja Gharibnawaz ( R.A) has several tombs, buildings, Daalaans and courtyards are of  Mughal architecture.

title: Dargah Shariff
review: This is a must vsit for anyone coming to Rajasthan or India for that matter, It is quite close to the station, one can walk or take a auto, from the bus stand one will get share autos. People have a lot of faith here. Avoid rush hours.

title: Serene... just go and experience
review: It's a kind of place where you just tend to forget yourself. This place seems to cross caste,creed,nationality and attracts people from all walks of life...Just go and experience this place.period.

title: Place of Peace and Tranquility
review: Dargah Sharif or Ajmer Sharif is a Sufi shrine of sufi saint, Moinuddin Chishti, located at Ajmer in Rajasthan. This is one of the holiest places of worship in India, not only for the Muslims, but also for the people of all faith, caste, and creed.  It was in the city of Ajmer that Hazrat Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti, one of the greatest spiritual redeemers of humankind, laid the cornerstone of Islam in India in the year 1192 A.D. Also known as, 'Sultan-Ul-Hind', this sanctum sanctorum houses the mausoleum of the revered saint, which is the biggest attraction of the Dargah.

title: Spiritual ambience
review: The ambienece inside the shrine brings a sense of solace. took an auto from the parking to the shrine, otherwise walk. Avoid the guide cum priest as far as possible. I hired one who sold the holy cloth showered in the shrine on his way back. The feeling of accomplishment ended in disappointment.

title: Honoured
review: I am grateful to have been able to visit this beautiful Holy place in my lifetime. Also there is a market worth visiting before the entry.

title: be aware from bunch of crooks..
review: # this holy shrine is now become a source of earning money from the tourist, so be aware don't try to take the help from local people even not from that from where you purchase, they will definitely help you but after they will ask for money.. :p

title: Only if you must
review: If you're in Rajasthan, you will drop into Ajmer just out of curiosity but at the end of the day, you will leave a bit perplexed. On one hand you'd feel guilty at not feeling quite spiritual in the manner the movies make Ajmer out to be and on the second hand you will feel quite annoyed at having been chased by beggars, hustled at every step by touts and then dragged into the 'VIP' entrance and extorted out of money for the tacky recycled flowers and chadars. Its at the end of the day a massive sham in the name of god. Visit it to tick off your itinerary and expect nothing more. Pushkar is far more peaceful and worth the trouble.

title: Faith & Bliss !
review: Consider it an honour & achievement in life if you are here…. it is only because of Khwaja Gareen Nawaz's divine blessings that you reach here !! I can feel spirituality & the presence of AlMighty here …. it is mystical yet very true. The Khaadims help you with taking you around and with any information that you seek.

title: Soulful peace
review: I have been Dargah Shariff Yesterday, I believe it was the great time, I was at most holy place in Rajasthan.

title: Just a formailty to be done..
review: Was vry excited in the beginning but all that will go down after going there..but if in ajmer .pay a visit..

title: Peaceful, calm and must visit place
review: We visit once a year and love everything about it...the feeling of being close to saint! Beware of people who will force you to offer money, chaadar or flowers. Just say no politely and you are goid to go. Avoid rush hours sp weekends or nights.

title: a place with amazing grace
review: if you go there with faith , you will be rewarded... as is the case in many of india's holiest places... what is really wonderful about this shrine is that it attracts people of all faiths and each one is welcome (of course you have to be respectful and maintain the required decorum)

title: Feeling blessed
review: Beware of the pickpockets is what everyone from the hotel people to the auto wallah to the shopkeepers, told us

title: just to check in place
review: I was on a day trip to ajmer and "not to leave main attraction" thought pushed me to visit dargah. Four wheeler are not allowed till dargah so you have to walk about a kilometer to reach dargah. The thing i liked the most about this place is the faith of the people in it. It was first time that i was visiting a mosque so a new experience to me otherwise it is a so so place to go.

title: Always a joy
review: Spiritually, very uplifting- hence there isn't any need to express this very personal area.

title: Rush due to Ursh
review: Little rush due to ursh but was ok.

title: Too much of beggery. State admin to do something
review: Once inside the holy shrine one feels very peaceful, though fellow pilgrims keep on pushing & jostling you

title: Fantastic place amongst the rush and commotion
review: This is a fantastic shrine to visit of the sufi saint Hazrat Moinuddin Chisti.  It best to take a guide (Kaadim) into the shrine and they accept whatever donation you give them.  If we didn't have guide then we wouldn't have know where to go.  Once in the complex itself we managed to get through the queues into the dargah itself.  Inside there isn't as much of a rush as there is outside of the complex and this is the only negative aspect of going there.  Be careful with bags if you do take them with you.  Its best to take no valuables as there are plenty of beggars surrounding the complex itself.  Cameras are not allowed inside the complex although they do turn a blind eye to photography using phones.  Do not under any circumstances try to photograph the dargah itself as its disrespectful

title: Must see in Ajmer
review: Its my native place, once in a year for sure I make trip to Ajmer and definately I visit to Dargah. be carefull of pickpocketers and thugs.

title: Dargh Shariff
review: Incomprehesively emotionally moving, beyond words to describe the experince. Relax  and don't be overwhelmed by the crowds.

title: oh my god, i m in the ajmer sharif shrine...
review: i was just speechless and mesmerised.. first of all i had doubts regardinging the rituals at shrine but mr. syed adil met me there and helped me throughout.. could feel the peace inside me... i m blessed now.                                                                       dr. abhishek gupta, jhansi

title: Khwaja mere khwaja
review: Should visit normally after 7 Pm to face less crowd. it was very peacefull when we were there and due to less crowd were able to spend more time and pray in silence.

title: Day trip Ajmer !!!
review: i spent one day in ajmer in feb 2014 with family.we came to ajmer through train from delhi.reached ajmer at night.took rest overnight in pre booked hotel.we started the trip early morning in pre booked cab.the rush was okk.the cab dropped us at some 5oo mts from dargah,vehicles are not allowed beyond this point.the dargah is a nice peaceful place.once inside the dargah ask the way to the holy place from a devotee,dont go here n there,you will be unnecessarily spending a lot of money !!! cameras are not allowed inside dargah premises,but everyone was using the mobile phones to take pictures ,so did we !!! near the dargah only dhai din ka jhonpra is there,walkable distance.

title: feel good place
review: Amazing place to feel good and peace in abundance. A great Sufi saint and known for his miraculous acts. It is known that KIng Akbar walked all the way from Delhi to Ajmer to this dargah for the sake of a son and his prayers there was heard by Allah and he was gifted with a son named Jahangir.

title: Khwaja mere Khwaja
review: Went to Ajmer e Sharif on 16th Feb 2014 just to fulfill my wish and All I would say I will keep on going again and again

title: HOLINESS
review: Faith has no boundaries. I saw it in Ajmer. People from all walks of life come to Dargah Shariff irrespective of caste , creed or religion. They all come with just one thing in their eyes - HOPE.

title: Try to visit late in the evening
review: Good place for peace and do see place in dargah like badi deegh etc.and do check out kachori of onion .and foremost thing pls ask before the charges of parking and don't give money outside the dargah , because then you would be chased by a mob of beggars .

title: It's just a business outlet
review: Sorry to hurt any religious feelings unintentionally, but as I felt there, everyone just wants money out of you, and they don't "request" for it, but demand it. Also, no cameras or bags are allowed inside, but no official arrangement outside the Dargah to keep our belongings safely. You're asked to keep your belongings with the local shopkeepers selling flowers. Seems too risky to me, for tourists carrying expensive camera equipments, etc.

title: Dissapointed!
review: I planned my visit to the place with a lot of faith and by the time I could even reach the Dargah, all faith flew out of the window!

title: Very good
review: Visited Dargah Shariff this year along with my wife. Place is very good. Atmosphere is very good. Loved being in this place, and would like to visit once again

title: Khwaja e Hind Woh Darbaar Hai Aala Tera
review: Alhamdulillah once again I had the opportunity of being in the Blessed feet of my beloved Khwaja. Wish to visit again n again. "Mere Taajush Shariah ke sadqe, baar baar bulaao mere Khwaja!"

title: Good spiritual Place... But Bad People
review: We visited Dargah Shariff in January, we liked as a spiritual place but the management(people working  with dargah shariff) are very aggressive, they force you to buy things and also force you to give money.

title: Arrgh!!! No
review: Unless you are Muslim or have faith in this place, this place can be skipped.

title: A good faith visit turned sour
review: After visiting thos place i thought to write this review for people who visit this place just for faith. Pls don't take ur children as approach to dargah is filled with beggers which horrifies ur children and worst part is that management does not even care to do anything about it. Even one % of donated money can rehablitate all such people. But i think even at the doorsteps of  god noone listens to the plight of such poor people. Inside dargah ur forced to pay money. We were given a slip after donating money in the entrence with the confidence that u need not to pay money anywhere else. But i was totally different. At every place they just ask for money and  people are so professional that they will extract it from u. And believe me, they are very good at it. No one is bothered about ur faith and leave u helpless at the mercy of such people. No one controls crowd inside the dargah. It is free for all. We eere just pushed outside saving our child from being crushed inside. So finally, we couldn't even see the dargah for ehich we have travelled such a long distance. I really pray that management do something seriously about it. Till duch thing happens i will pray from my hometown and will not visit such a place.

title: Serene
review: Although the experience with nagging beggars on the road to dargah is irrirating, Dargah Shariff is really very serene.

title: Ecellent Place to visit
review: I liked this place very much. I read lots of bad reviews and was very afraid of my visit to Dargah. But WhenI went to dargah, I met one Khadim and it seems he was sent by Khwaja, he helped me a lot and I was successfully able to pray to Khwaja without any issues.

title: Holly and very nice place
review: November 2013, I was visiting Ajmer Dargah Shariff with my friends. After visiting Dargah, I visited nearest beautiful destinations.

title: Seeking Blessings of the Khwaja
review: Built 900 years ago, this is divine. Successive Mughal emperors and queens added more facilities and structures to the Dargaah of the Saint Khwaja Chisti. The Chadar is offered to commemorate the fulfillment of blessings. A basket of Rose Flowers, Itr (scent) and Incense sticks are also offered. You will find many descendants of the Chisti family roaming around, just catch hold of one  to help place these offerings at the Dargaah and mediate in conveying your prayers to the Khwaja Chisti.

title: Blessings of "Khwaja ji"
review: It's our must visit place but some of the reason i only visit to this place my friend is miss this opportunity to see Dargah of "Khwaja Ji". A day visit is the right choice because at night you will not able to find a way to exit from the street.too much rush on the street with lot's of lighting stall's.

title: must visit
review: Go on your own slowly. Its a must visit place. Try to visit the main shrine during Prayer time when its easy to enter the main dargah peacefuly.

title: Its OK..
review: There are no places of interest in Ajmer except this, and this too is quite average.. Lots of beggar makes this place a messy one.

title: If you are a tourist, Better avoid visiting this sight...
review: As a tourist, I've attempted to visit this darga at early morning. I just walked from Ajmer railway station to the dargah kwaja gharib nawaz. It takes only 10-15 minutes to the dargah. Ask anyone, they will show you the route.

title: Dargah Sharif
review: Dargah Sharif or Ajmer Sharif is a sufi shrine of sufi saint, Moinuddin Chishti located at Ajmer, Rajasthan, India.This is a quite religious and one of the must visit locations of Ajmer

title: Holy Place but too much crowd
review: Its a place originally close to the  heart of Muslims . But  in recent days a trend has been set   by  Mumbai Film Stars . Almost every Male  and Female big star made  a beeline  to this  Dargah to pray for success of  their  upcoming releases. The holy place  has many agents hovering around who will take  you inside . The bigger the  car  you alight from , the more the reception. There are  lots of private  parking  slots  , who charge  Rs 100 per  hour . Many such small "industries"  have  cropped up including beggars, Flower-sellers that irk the  normal  tourists . If you visit this  place , you have  to be  faithful . Its a beautiful road from Jaipur , Come  early in the  morning , leave by  afternoon .

title: Nice Place.......
review: I was thrilled to visit Ajmer Shariff Dargah with my friends... as there is a saying that if you visit this place thrice, and it is equal to visit of Mecca. It a place of religious tolerance and you will find devotees from all religions visit this place, and get blessings. It hardly take 30 min to 1 hour during non festive seasons.  Tourists should be very careful about their belongings because every where you find beggars and they will harass you like anything... just avoid it.. if you love sweets, don't forget bring some delicious sweets near by...

title: Holy place worth visiting
review: The Dargah sharif in Ajmer is well worth a visit. A sufi shrine of Khwaja Moin ud din Chishti, it is visited by people of all faiths. It has a nice spiritual air about it, however it is spoit by the guides and other people who practically run a business there by extorting money out of unsuspecting tourists.

title: Good Management can make this place worth visiting
review: There is no ...management of visiting and to cater to things like purchasing "Chaddars" . Beggars are everywhere ...The Bazzar is full of things you never want to purchase ....Didnt expect this to be something like the one i experience.... Dont know how celebrities visit here ....

title: Spiritual excellence
review: Dargah is a real spiritual place to pay visit by anybody irrespective of their religious ideologies. The amenities are really well organized and while attending dargah itself feel a sense of high spiritual attainment and prayer is spontaneously offered  - which is amazing.

title: must visit if visiting ajmer
review: If you are visiting ajmer ,don't forget to visit here. It is believed that Baba fulfil all your wishes and he serves for the poor. Be aware while purchasing Chader as they charge high amount for a simple one. Beggars might disturb you so be aware of them too. Over all it is a nice place to see.

title: Crowded
review: This place is a tomb for a prophet which has its own religious importance but sad to see that its converted into a Holy place with vultures to take money out of your pocket at each step in the name of worship. The place is heavenly crowded added to the beggars that are waiting for people to reach the Dargah. I respect Khwaja ji but am saddened to see the current status.

title: Must visit
review: Nice place. We have to go through small lanes. Not compulsory, but force to offer money at different places in Dargah.

title: Too crowded
review: The inside of the Dargah is great but the approach road to this place is filled with beggars and physically challenged people sprawled all over, leaving both my kids scared and distressed. If possible leave young children behind while taking this trip.

title: Seren Pristine and Fantastic
review: It feels Spiritually content to visit Dargah Shariff,be aware of pick pocketer though,i recommend on contacting local Khadim if you are travelling on busy day

title: Sacred place!!!
review: Very sacred place in India!!! One should go in dargah before 8:30 PM to avoid the crowd.. Very peaceful if you believe... People use to come from various place of India to fulfill their wishes - as it said that if you are making wish from your heart then it will surely be fulfilled...

title: space for non-believers too
review: For a non-muslim, I was a bit apprehensive. But it turned out to be a very peaceful, uplifting experience. It is crowded but un-hurried. People don't hustle you though they may try to get you to put in a donation. The inside can get a bit claustrophobic though but adds to the authenticity of the place.

title: Too commercialized.
review: I was really excited to visit this place. I really believe that such places give time for yourself. But this place was kind of a let down. Even before the Dargah people are trying to lure you to buy stuff. Even if you don't, there are people inside the Dargah that keep asking you for donations. The room where the shrine is located get too uncomfortable when people keep pushing you and there is so much noise for the donations. We were pushed outside in 50 seconds. So we didn't really get to spend time. And you don't really get a place to sit in peace. Everywhere there is someone who is trying to sell something.

title: for blessings
review: Dargah Shariff is a must visit place in Ajmer.  I also like the narrow streets through which I reached Dargah Shariff .  It was  a thrilling # wheeler ride.  But there was too much crowd and it was very tough inside Dargah Shariff.

title: spirituality
review: spiritual place with lots of blessing!! when u go to dargah kwaja gharib nawaz u will never return back bare handed!!

title: A holy visit
review: They have improved the place a lot since my last visit in 2001. It is very clean inside and people are very friendly there. Just to inform you that no one is allowed inside with shots. However, in case you are wearing shots, you can borrow lungi from the main gate without any charges.

title: KGN
review: ts a good place to visit. They say a wish made here is always fulfilled and that keeps bringing people back. Visited Dargah on a Saturday morning... though it was not very overcrowded, but still a lot of pushing since the place is very narrow... Lucky to get genuine Khadim, who helped us a lot in puja and buying the chaddar and flowers... Otherwise had read a lot about money-extracting khadims..

title: Visit to Dargah
review: Its a good place to visit. They say a wish made here is always fulfilled and that keeps bringing people back. But if you do the VIP darshan, then be ready to shell out money in form of donations. The rickshaw ride to the dargah is a little daunting, but still an experience to be had.

title: Khwaja Gharib Navaz
review: I went to Dargah in first week of December.We reached Amer by Shatabdi and went straight to Dargah which is just 10mins walk.There were shops galore on the way selling every possible item.We reached the entry gate and were received by a khadim that my cousin had fixed for a tour.I must say that I was apprehensive after reading some reviews but found the place to be exact opposite.No badgering,pushing,chaos,I must thank my stars.Our guide took us inside and explained its signifance,also did prayers for us.We were also let to pay our respect in the most organised manner so much so that we felt blessed and relaxed at the same time.We were told not to give donations anywhere except the 'Deg'.After spending half hour at Dargah we came out and thanked our Khadim for his efforts.We will go back again because every wish is fulfilled here.

title: Pure Solace
review: never thought that i would be ever visiting the Dargah, it is absolutely true, only they get a chance who are called by Him.

title: very nice good Darga shariff
review: this very and nice place. every body whant go there with family enjoy and dua for  every one , very peace full place

title: Awesome Experience
review: Felt great after reaching there and offering prayer. Were lucky to met a Genuine "Khadim Ji" who made our prayer time very calm and easy going. People need to be aware of Beggers and some people who can  force you to pay more donation otherwise everything is great.

title: Disgusting
review: It is shame to see a tomb of a dead person used as an object of veneration. Islam condemns all forms of idol or grave worship. The prophet struggled for a good part in his ministry against idol worship and condemned mosques where graves were built upon it.

title: spiritual experience
review: I went with my wife and cant put words to my experience.. went with a khadim (Dr Irfan - great guy with his shop just next to dargah nizamuddin gate).. he took us around the whole dargah with so much comfort and we had an extremely touching experience inside the dargah.. thanks dr irfan for all the help hope to go again to the dargah!!

title: Heavily crowded yet peaceful
review: This place radiates an aura of spirituality that encompasses people of all religions and of all age groups. People tie mannat ka dhaaga believing that their wishes will come true. There is also a wishing well inside the shrine. According to another belief, washing hands and feet in the clear waters of a pond there, washes away all the sins committed.

title: "FOR THE BLESSINGS FROM GOD"
review: dargah shariff is place to visit not only for muslims but also for all religions from india and its just 100km away from capital jaypur,structure of dargah is of old style but exp worth it,outside dargah there are plenty of shops from u can buy typical round and flavoured sweets.

title: Place of worship cannot be given a star rating !!
review: How does one rate a religious place. You go there for either religious or spiritual purposes, and have to brave out what is on offer.

title: Ummm almost fine
review: I will give my honest opinion. The dargah was amazing and the experience was quite good but  what I disliked about the place was that we had to keep our shoes in the road side shops. The shoes could have gotten lost and what not. After the amazing experience inside when we stepped outside there was a huge crowd and I got lost. As I was finding my way back to the car parking I noticed that my mobile was  stolen. I saw an old lady and gave her money and all the beggers started running behind my back knowing well that I was a tourist. After I handed each one of them money and became poor myself I saw the beggers handing over their money to an old man. There is a huge fraud business going on over there, though the Dargah is a beautiful place and my mannat(wish) was fulfilled. I advice you all to keep your purse, mobile and important ornaments in the car.

title: A very nice visit.
review: I was very lucky to make a visit to the Ajmer Shariff. This is a very famous place of worship for muslims. I went on a Fri and luckily at a time in the evening when not too many devotees had gathered for namaz. Overall it was a very nice visit. I hope am blessed with my life post visit.

title: Spiritual
review: Visited Dargah on a Saturday morning... though it was not very overcrowded, but still a lot of pushing since the place is very narrow...

title: Belief if life
review: Many believe that the mannat (wish) at Dargah Sharriff is always fulfilled. The Dargah is beautiful and offers a wonderful spiritual experience for even the non-muslims. A must visit place in Ajmer, in fact this is what characterizes Ajmer.

title: ajmer dargah
review: We went to offers prayers at dargah. We bought a Chader and flowers as offerings to dargah. On entering one local boy came for our help and guiding to dargah. They was very rush at that time. HE guided us very well and with his help we were able to offer our prayers. I lost my mobile inside which he had helped me to trace. When we tried to give something to him he denied to take and said whatever he is doing is for the almighty.

title: Divine
review: Overcrowded and full of pick pocketers. Please avoid visiting on  Thursdays and Fridays. Also be aware of people looting money in name of God.

title: Please get rid of the touts
review: The state and the Dargah authorities are requested to somehow get rid of the touts or if that seems impossible, get your own certified and badged 'guides' installed. The whole experience, for a middle aged couple, was disappointing and almost completely non-religious from the time of parking to the time of leaving the Dargah.

title: Colours of Rajashthan
review: Known for its famous Dargah of Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti a highly revered personality amongst Mohammedans.People from all religious faith visit the Dargah.I was touched by the helpful nature of the young.

title: Holy Place but too messy.
review: I went to this place with my family but the moment you will get down from your car, in no time you will be crowded all the auto walas and beggars, in the first go you don't get a good feeling about the place and then if you hire a Auto first they will over charge you and then whey they drive in those small alleys its too dangerous for the people walking in that area. Then you would have to walk a long distance to reach Dargah and again you will be surrounded by the shop keepers they will make sure that you buy chaddar and every thing else from there and if you deny on buying it then pass poor comments on you that 'If you are not buying the chaddar, then why are you here'. I mean that is so cheap. I mean its a tourist place come here to visit the dargah not to give you business. Even if you buy the chaddar then will take you inside where they give chaddar as a gift to the god, you won't even get a chance to see what you came for. Is it just for celebrities. I don't know but this place will never be on my list again. Sorry God but it should'nt be like this.

title: Breathtaking and full of awe
review: A place where you feel you can and should do good things Stayed nearby when it was Prophets Birthday and saw many processions and devotees An ab amazing experience I find it a moving experience to vist Chisti Dargah and woud recommend All Indians visit not just muslims

title: Too messed up
review: Its difficult to get to that place - for lack of driving directions (Use google navigation on android). Once there - exorbitant parking fees (Rs 100 for 1 hour). Better park at railway station and take a rickshaw. I went via Delhi gate.

title: DARGAH SHARIFF
review: An amazing experience. The bustlingbstreet vendors, the locals all add to the ambience of this majestic experience. My family and i spent 4 night's in ajmer and visited the dargah daily. You wIll never want to leave. When the time to leave draws upon you want, you pray to return...one day.

title: A Fantastic Experience
review: This shrine is the largest Muslim shrine in India and attracts thousands of pilgrims daily.

title: Pilgrimage
review: the greatness of Dargah sharif cannot be described in words it can be felt once you go there that is the reason people travel from many parts of the country to Ajmer. The peace you get in Dargah Sharif canot be described in words all one feel is just sitting in dargah all the time

title: Only place to find peace!
review: Been here several times...a must visit place to find solace!

title: Complaint !!!!!!
review: This is my first N last visit...Ajmer Dargah Shariff is very beautiful place but the members are so bad. all are looking money...in dargah one Molvi is sitting in near wall. when i give 50 rs....i shocked. he saying that give me 500rs.

title: You won't find a more revered place.
review: This was my first visit to a dargah and I am glad it was Ajmer Shariff dargah. The place is respected by all the religions in India and you can actually see people from all religions paying their respect here whether it be hindus, sikhs or muslims. Just loved the place, very holy and peaceful!!!

title: Devine Experience
review: My first visit to Khuaja Dargah of Ajmer. I was lucky to have local guide provided by friend. People chase you on there motorcycle for telling you to park at there place. As i was lucky to have local who showed them away. He spoke to one Molvi, who was of great help arranged chadar and flowers for offering. Did our pooja and we paid nominal Rs 100 to molvi, no bargaining and no cheating. He was straight forward and told us not to pay to any one just as per your wish donate for food to bakht board, where you get slip of donation also. Place is crowded so i suggest take the local transport to reach dargah. Avoid taking your own car out there. Also the trust or government should take over the place for better administration, as lot of complaints of cheating and mismanagement is out there. Finally be careful of your wallet.

title: It was a call from the Almighty!
review: Though it was Eid (and a Friday) and more crowded than before, we got good darshan, thanks to the helpful people at the Dargah and a person who took over the role of our guide. At the time we reached, the Namaaz was being offered and the Dargah was closed. We got to stay in the sacred precincts longer than usual, which one of the priests said was a sign of blessing from Khwaja Garib Nawaaz.

title: Total mess, mismanagement
review: Don't seems like religious place. Total mess and no management. Very crowded and dirty road. We reached there by car on 15 august. Very much dissatisfied with the local administration.

title: GUYS ITS NOT A TOURIST PLACE
review: I read some reviews about the Dargarh Shareef and they disliked because it was overcrowded.. First of all its not a tourist place, people come here because they are displeased because someone or something has failed to fulfill one's hopes or expectations, they come here to get their wishes fulfilled. It's not a picnic spot or a bar or an amusement park. Its a religious place... yes IT IS OVERCROWDED because people all over the India come here as it a prominent Dargaah (of Hazrat Khwaja Muinuddin)

title: The demonstration of faith
review: we went to dargah sharif while over stop over at Ajmer during our road trip from himalayas to ahmedabad.

title: Devine Positive Energy
review: Visited after long years, nearly 22 years, no major changes or developments, devotees were more, management has improved. The darshan was good being our friend has arranged, in evening we marked our presence at khwajai... next morning offered. Traditional chadder with all the devine experience... the power of positive energy was at its best..... must visit

title: Good, could be better
review: I had visited Dargah Sharif as a child with my parents and had lovely memories of it as a very peaceful place, after odd 16 years when I revisited the place with my husband..I could not find the same peace as I remembered. Security Threats have made it highly uncomfortable and irritating for a visitor to enter the dargah, one has to put everything in locker including mobile, camera, metal items, watch etc etc..and the place has become so commercialized and crowded that one cannot even breathe without someone asking for a quick darshan at a cost or donations of some amount for wish fulfillment..even before you can say your prayers inside the dargah, you are asked for money and once that given your time for the visit is over as people behind you will be pushing hard you hard to make their way..an orderly system in place and a crowd management system will certainly give visitors a better experience.

title: Holy place
review: Ajmer is fortunate to be blessed with such a pilgrimage place but admin of Ajmer seems disinterested. Near dargaha one can feel aroma of red roses in market which are offered at Dargaha. A spirituality seems blended in aura around it. In inside premises one can enjoy kawaali. But beware of pickpockets.  Feel the divine experience...

title: Holy Shrine
review: Went to Dargah Sharif to offer chadder with family, the place is almost always crowded, but the aura of spirituality and divinity is very strong. Beware of pickpockets and those who claim to be guides...Our darshan was easy since we had a relative who contacted a khadim to make required arrangements...A must visit place when in Ajmer...

title: Positivity Unlimited . . .
