review: It was a dream come true the moment I set foot on the steps of the Dargah. Right from selecting the Chadar as our offering to Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti's Dargah to walking into the premises soaking in all the positivity around was ethereal indeed. The experience of touching the Mazaar with my forehead shall remain with me for this lifetime.

title: Jo Mango wo milega !!
review: Khwajaji se jo mango wo milega...it is said that u can go to meet Khwajaji only when he will call you ...no matter how much u try if he doesnt call you...u will not be able to go the the Dargah Sharif....

title: God is one
review: A Cherished dream came true upon visiting The Dargah.It was a spiritual experience with the air filled with aroma of flowers.we offered our players by presenting a chader to Khwaja ji. The holy shrine is a crowded place but God wiling you can pay homage easily.Though we are not Muslims the serenity of the shrine filled my heart with peace & gratitude.Remember to offer your donations only at the Dargah shariff's official board who issue the receipt .A great place to visit indeed.

title: Spiritual experience
review: I visited the Dargah by chance, I had time on waiting my train to Udaipur. It was quite an spiritual experience even with the crowd around. I will never forget the incense and flowers smell all around the place. The songs were beautiful too. Take off your shoes, left them with your bag in one of the flower shops, cover your head, dive in this amazing experience, accept the peace you are having.

title: visit to dargah and pushkar camel safari
review: visit to mosque it was heart touching expericence  to see lots of reliougs people  at a one place...and pushkar is quite holi place which enjoyed and pushkar camel safari..which we enjoyed most ...and sand dunes were quite impressing...i booked my camel safari by .09828178063..

title: Subhanallah
review: I am one of the luckiest person in the world to visit Dargah e Sultan ul Hind. It was an unexpressable experience. When i reached there i simply cant believe that i was standing in that place where i always wanted to come. It is a very special place as shows unity of people because many people irrespective of caste, creed, religion come to this religious place for the fulfillment of their desires. It's situated at the heart of AJMER. The area around Dargah is densely populated though very famous. The Dargah is the main attraction of Ajmer and is the most beautiful and shows real spirituality. People should be aware of some khadims present here though all are not bad. Really Khwaja Moinuddin CHishti (R.A) fulfils the need of all people according to their good requirement.  I will advice each and every person to visit this Place because BHARATWASI HOKAR AJMER SHARIF NA DEKHA TO KYA DEKHA......

title: Spirituality
review: Dargah Sharif is very popular amongst all religions.  The place attracts more than 1 lakh visitors per day.  Its crowded & probably, more cheating takes place there (pick-pockets, petty thefts etc).  However, as a pre-eminent Islam Sufi Spiritual place, it has its own attraction.

title: Hated it
review: We had been pre-warned about the pickpockets so did not carry any valuables. It was crowded and I felt on edge all the time. We were pestered for money by one Muslim official who then said it was not threatening which was exactly what I felt it was.

title: Wish fulfilling Dargah for all religion
review: The Dargah Shariff also known as Ajmer Shariff is famous for it Wish Fulfilling power. People of all religion have great faith in this Dargah and they visit there for Mannat ( Wishes). It is believed that if you ask a wish with pure heart, the same is ful filled. Many film actors, producers, top political leaders keep visiting this famous Dargah with their 'Wishes'.

title: Spiritual Experience
review: Leaving aside the narrow lane leading to the Dargah and the heaps of crowd inside, its truly spiritual and worth going. The place has its own positive vibes which makes you feel calm once you are inside.

title: super experience
review: This Dargah of Khwaja Moinudeen Chisty is a must visit for beleivers of all faiths. It is widely beleived that what ever you ask for in this Dargah with a clean heart.....will surely come true. Do take help of one of the Khadims there to show you around the place.

title: Horrible experience
review: Very commercialized. Overcrowded to the point that we feared for our safety. Constant demands for offerings of money. The environment can only be described as hostile. It wasn't plessnt, it wasn't peaceful and it was in no way spiritual. Your mileage may vary but I would never recommend anyone visit this place.

title: Spritiual visit
review: A very Blessed Shrine (Dargah), but too busy on a Friday, Its been said and happened that whatever you ask for with Pure heart and clean intentions, comes true......People come to this place just for Friday prayers all the way from Mumbai.....just because of the blessings!!!

title: Khwaja O Khwaja
review: Just soothing as always...the blessings of nawaj shareef... This is Urs time so highly populated and crowded with visitors. Have to push yourself through to get to Dargah...anyways worth it.....

title: An Journey to spirituality
review: Ajmer is about 120-130 KM from Jaipur. It is Magical spiritual place where you can get blessings from the Garib Nawaz. It is a bit crowded place and you need to park your vehicle in one of the Public (house) parkings. From there you can take an Auto inside the dargah. It is a majestic structure with 2 massive cauldrons which are used to prepare meal . One takes 75 thousand rupees  worth of food stuff and the other 1.5 Lakhs.

title: POSITIVE VIBRATIONS - YOU CAN FEEL!
review: On the way back to Mumbai from Vaishnodevi, we decided to have a holy bath in Pushkar Lake and visit the Dargah of Garib Nawaz.  We landed in Ajmer by around 01:00 p.m. and engaged a taxi to visit Pushkar.  On the way, we had our lunch.  It was a really enriching experience to have bath in Pushkar lake where we have the one and only temple to Lord Brahma.  However, one has to be careful with the punditjis who are ready to empty your pocket/purse.  Initially, the guide seems so innocent that he says don't give anything more than Rs.21/-, but ultimately, they milk you in the name of offering RAJ BHOG/MEETHA BHOG / CHAWAL BHOG.    However, the temple is completely different experience.  Lord Brahma is unique in his only abode in this earth.  From there, we visited Dargah which is at walkable distance from Ajmer station(15 minutes).  Though it is too crowded for comfort, one can feel the positive vibrations as we enter the precinct, no matter which religion you belong to.  Must visit place for all.  And finally, don't forget to taste the Malpuvah and Son Halwa...

title: overcrowded pilgrimage
review: its really very crowded especially in the evening. if you have small kids then think again.theres lots of pushing around and honestly you dont get the oppurtunity or space to pray.cameras not allowed.

title: Visit we would like to forget.........
review: this place is highly commercial............the moment you are near this place... you can feel that

title: Dargah of Khwaja Garib Nawaz, the sufi saint!
review: Few tips when visiting the dargah:

title: Dargah Shariff, needs attention and care.
review: While on a holiday to Ranthambore and Jaipur, we decided to take a day's excursion to Pushkar and Ajmer. Ajmer is a city founded by Prithviraj Chauhan. The city has narrow roads and has heavy traffic of all sort of vehicles.

title: memorable visit to the shrine
review: If you are a white European like, do NOT go to this temple without Indian friends (You would proabably not be let in anyway). It is a very memorable experience though if you do get to go. All the tips about it being overcrowded and not taking purses and leaving shoes in a safe place are very true! My Indian lady friends and the official who was guiding us around were hanging on to me for fear I would be pushed around and took very good care of me. I do not think many people like me get to carry a basket of flowers on their head into this shrine among crowds and crownds of people. We all tied our piece of cloth around a bar and made our wish. The legend has it that is the wish come true you have to go back to the temple and untie the cloth, but fortunetaly the priest (temple guardian) has an e-mail address and (I suppose for a fee) will do this for you if you ask. I am rating this visit high because it was a unique experience; not because the site itself is very special for non-sufi persons.

title: Dargah Shariff: A few tips
review: One has to take an auto or cycle - rikshaw or walk to reach Dargah.

title: Extortion by Khadims at Dargah Sharif
review: As rightly pointed out by jahanara-princess in the earlier reviews,most of the khadims of dargah sharif behave like they are the saint themselves. They have have gone to the extent of inhumanely treating the piligrims, who in fact are the gusests of Hazrath gharib Nawaz (R.A.) Money is the only language they understand and respond to. Sorry to say the Khadims are undermining the great divinity of this durbar. May Alimgihty and Hazrath Gharib Nawaz (R.A.) guide them. Hope dargah committee take notes of this.

title: amazing...believe by heart...
review: amazing journey throughout with positive vibes..A very holy place for the ones who believe in nature and humanity..peaceful, calm and courageous. build your confidence within yourself and you come back with a changed personality.

title: A visit to Ajmer is incomplete without a visit to Dargah
review: Like any other religious destination in India, hordes of people visit this Dargah everyday, and, thus, it is always crowded. The inner complex is quite clean and well kept. But, one must avoid listening to shopkeepers who suggest buying all kinds of things for laying at the Saint's place.

title: Tour for Peace
review: "Syed Azharuddin Chishty"just one of the khadims of Huzoor Khwaja Moinudddin chishty (r.a.).

title: Must Visit
review: Breathtaking place. This is a darga of Khaja Mounuddin chisti. Must visit the office of the darga Samiti and collect a copy of the Darga history. Avoid Peak hours

title: You have to be here if you visit Ajmer
review: Ajmer Wahi aate hain jinhe Kwaja bulate hain ! Avoid commercial khadim but seek blessings . Be prepared to come with loose small denomination currency notes to give in offering everywhere ....

title: Divine place on earth
review: Very soothing and calming. Prayers offered outside dargah via song and music(quawallis) is just amazing. Baba is believed to fulfil wish of everyone who goes there. This place has very high religious value. Men and women are suppose to keep their head covered inside dargah.

title: DARGAH SHARIFF AN EXCELLENT PLACE FOR WORSHIP
review: I had visited DARGAH SHARIFF in Ajmer today an excellent place for worship. The number of devotees visiting is amazing.I hope whatever I have prayed to Dargah Shariff he will make it true.Every one must visit this place.

title: Money-money money.....
review: Everyone in the Dargah wants money. No arrangements to control crowd inside Dargah..

title: Nice place
review: Good Experience in trip.. Loda inn is best place to stay in Ajmer.. Visit city by public transport ..

title: A real place for Peace & Solitude
review: Been a admirer of this place and of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishty for since long........... i pay regular visit to this place .. and i get what i ask......I got mine ... might be this place is what your re searching to get your answers.... A must visit for everybody once in your lifetime ... no matter who you are and what you do ... this place is open for all.

title: It's all about money
review: Being such a great place of faith, it is sad to see everyone around hankering for money. I was taken around by a person (arranged by our auto rickshaw driver), who took us to a particular place for buying the Chaddar, and the machinery for extracting money started from there. Their combined force tried to convince me to get the largest Chaddar. Once I managed to get out of there, I was taken to the shrine, and I was told to donate one amount - "whatever I like" - but it was sort of blackmailing. I was Los told that I would not need to pay anything else around - but every Khadim was seen asking for something.

title: Thanks to the unknown Sufi singer!
review: My first thanks would go to the sufi singer for creating such a nice ambience and making all the difference.The Roses and "Itr" in the air .and ..the sufi voice creates a heavenly atmosphere.  Dagrah Shariff would be "adhura" without them.

title: Good experience minus the people!
review: I believe a place where people go with a strong faith and belief has some positive energy. Only problem we have with religious places in this country is the commercialization! On one hand, you can come across those who will help you visit the dargah and make you see all the places of importance. On the other hand, you have those who will do the same but will not leave you until they are paid for their services.

title: beware................................
review: i went to ajmer only to visit dargah shariff

title: Kwaja Garibun Nawaaz
review: The place I most wanted to visit on my indian tour.it was most spiritual experience.

title: Experince of life time minus people
review: It was my wife who ever wanted to go to kwajja. The place as i entered gave me the feel of positive energy. Not to mention the crowd was russhing from all the direcrions. A pice of advise for all as the belives go please enter the place with CLOTH COVERING NECK TO TOE.

title: A spititual experience marred by beggary!
review: Dargah Ajmer Sharif is a place where prayers are answered. It is indeed a pious place worth experiencing. Beware of nagging herd of beggars as well as touts asking you to donate amounts at various places.

title: bliss..d management can be improved
review: bliss n peace all together..d management inside d dargah can b improved. d rush is very bad. que system should be started and maintained inside d dargah n its premises.as it is one of d biggest dargah. total haywire situation.

title: A serene place, one of it's kind!
review: I & my husband managed to visit the Dargah on last Sunday, which was a special day according to the Muslim calender. We were suggested to visit as early as possible as the Dargah is open 24*7. It is a nice place with a lot of peace & tranquility. It gives you a great sense to be inside that samll room where the Mazaar is. We connected with a Khadim (kind of pandit's for Dargah) and he helped us with the entire guided tour & visit.

title: Khwaja Garib Nawaz
review: Its a great place to visit at least once in a life time!

title: Great experience
review: Too crowded but a must visit place. Unless you are so called VVIP would have to walk a bit. Great experience to visit one of kind place

title: be aware of khadim
review: the great saint wali allah khwaja moinuddin chishty. after 17 years i visited again to the holy shrine.all things are changed. The khadim of dargah sharif behave like they are the saint themselves. Money money every where give money give money, where ever you will go you have to reply of this call. The shrine is of Garib Nawaz who prey for the needy people, but the person who are so called khadim make it impossible to do ziyarat peacefully. So be aware of them, go to ajmer and ask to the saint for your peace and happyness, God will definitely grant your wish.

title: Amazing !!!!!!1
review: you call it an Aura or Rehmat or the Divinity of Khwajha ...

title: Connect with the divine
review: Too many people in charge and the attitude is too rude.You can completely loose yourself in the ocean of devotees and find solace in giving your worries over to the beloved Khwaja Gharib Nawaz. He surely listens to those who come to him.The way to the Dargah is wide but cleanliness is an issue. Stray cattle needs to be cleared as well and some control on beggers will help.

title: Spiritual Bliss
review: Dargah Sharif, go in the evenings if you want to enjoy the mood, cover your heads with caps provided there and handkerchiefs and if you want to be free from the extortion from religious India preachers ( DON'T EVER EVER TAKE YOUR WALLET INSIDE ) . Give it to your taxi driver or if someone is accompanying you , this way inside the DARGAH at every step they would offer a special prayer and ask for money , but luckily you can say Sorry , I dont have the wallet with me, and if you really want to donate, there is a donation center outside please go and donate there. Take your time inside and feel the pulse , it would rejuvenate you and if its a festival time during ursa or some other thing the Qawwalis are priceless there. Do not miss the KACHORI and KHASTA KARHI and beware those will be the most " chilly" experience and if you are a tourist and not an Indian you have to have a steel heart to try that. SPICE and CHILLY with its unique taste :) :)

title: Khadims spoil the environment
review: The dargah compund is very enchanting place. But, that's the only good part about the dargah. The entrance to dargah is narrow with shops all around. If you are a vegetarian, then the shops aren't a good sight to watch. The khadims really spoil the mood. They altch onto you as soon as you enter the city and keep following you until you enter the dargah. And ask you to do all kind if stuff, like they will froce you buy chaddar. Really difficult to avoid them, if you say no, they will start talking rudely to you. Inside the compund, as soon as you enter the main dargah, people start pushign you around, and the khadims start abusing you, if you don't give them money. Really aweful!

title: Visit only if you wish to " WISH "
review: Heard a lot abt the sanctity of this place so visited on 1st Oct, but was very disappointed by the way the whole Dargah is managed.

title: Peace of mind
review: Ambiance is Good.

title: spiritual
review: The Dargah Sharif is a beautiful and blessed place. It could do with lesser people asking for money, but make sure you donate only to the people who can give you a receipt in return. which i could't The place has a distinctly commercialised feel to it. the guy near the shine was expecting money to offer my rose petles yo lord.

title: Spritual Trip
review: It ia absolutely a piece of mind. do visit. search for good hotels even if they are located away from Dargah..Donot fall prey to the so called priests. If you want to donate, donate according to your will and that too against authorized receipts. Keep your cameras etc at the hotel itself as cameras are not allowed inside the dargah. However, you can take photos/videos with your mobile phone.

title: A must visit
review: Obviously, this is one of the holiest shrine in all of India and though we didn't enter, we visited just to see the area. There is a spiritual aura about this place thats hard to ignore. i wish we could have spent more time

title: Soul on Earth
review: The sanctity of the mosque and devotion of people visiting the place was beyond capitalization.  Every person visiting Durgah was satisfied to have gained something in the form of blessing of heaven creature! Every one in this world must visit the secret place at least once in his/her life.

title: Sacred but not maintained
review: I recently visited the dargah. The best way to reach the dargah is to go via the new bypass road. You can park your vehicle about 600 meters from the dargah and walk towards the same through an extremely crowded bazar.The entrance from this side is less crowded as compared to the main entrance.

title: dargah for peace
review: Peace, Divine, Spiritual, l and have no words to explain.

title: Wow, get a guided tour for free
review: We arrived and were unsure if we should enter.  Then we were welcomed and given all assurances that he just wanted to give us a tour and explain all about the sufi religion.

title: Unless you are sufi and Dargah Khwaja Muin-ud-din Chishti is spiritually significant, DON'T GO
review: The Dargah is disappointing because it is overrun with shops INSIDE the mosque. I have never seem vendors and shops within a mosque before. And I found this vulgar.

title: Amazing
review: Noman Moini was an amazing khadim who made the entire experience immensely satisfying. In spite of the hordes of devotees, the cleanliness and vibrations were amazing.

title: Great Place , Heaven
review: Every thing is good but be careful from pick pockets. Leave all your money and cell phones in the hotel.

title: Pious
review: It is a pious place but very crowded & not very well kept. Get hold of a 'khadim' (those who take care of Dargah) & then you can have some time in peace there otherwise one is pushed away without even having time to say the prayers.

title: Beware of the environment around the mosque
review: The mosque is the prime and most famous place to visit in Ajmer and we went there around the evening time when the entire area was bustling with people. The long walk to the mosque is full of local shops doing brisk business. The entrance of the mosque is not very impressive, where unnecessarily shoving and jostling welcomed us. As advised by our hotel staff, we didn't carry any valuables, except our cameras, and didn't wear watches and my wife also did not wear any jewelry. We also didn't carry our mobiles and any leather goods. Once inside the mosque, couple of locals approached us offering to guide us round the mosque. A bitter scuffle happened in between them and followed by a street-fight which might have resulted into blood-shed to which we did not bear witness and made our way quickly towards the inside of the mosque where the tomb of the Muslim saint Moinuddin Chishti is housed. After spending some time there we came out after ensuring things have calmed down outside. We went round the mosque and were impressed viewing couple of h-u-g-e pots named after Akbar and Jehangir where collections of the mosque are deposited.

title: An Unhurried Visit
review: Although I had heard of long queues and mayhem while accessing the shrine, my visit was calm, unhurried and over in 15 minutes. I took an auto from Diggy Bazar, which went up the inclined approach, which was FILTHY. But once inside the shrine's premises, it was a soulful experience, with the unhurried devout, the quawwals and the general religious atmosphere.

title: Very Nice Visit
review: Had ample time in Dargah. It was organised nicely.  There was lot of crowd yet had good time in the Dargah

title: Must Visit
review: We went late evening so there was less crowd. There is a lot of faith among people for Khwajaji and it could be felt in the atmosphere of the Dargah.The way to the Dargah is colorful with brightly lit shops and has a typical holy town like ambience. The shrine has very good vibrations and I am thankful for the opportunity of a peaceful and blessed visit.

title: Get contact with one of Dargah shop families
review: and they will help you participate in and explain the Dargah history, the ceremony, etc.  I bought a rose petal arrangement, donated money to feed the poor, and in return received a detailed tour, careful walk through, storage of my belongings and perfect site to listen to the Sufi chants (Qawwadi, I believe is the term -- sorry for my spelling).  Outside the Dargah are professional beggars, which, though pushy, I was able to ignore (moreso than the numerous taxi drivers who aggressively overcharge).

title: must visit for the peace it gives
review: have visited number of times in the past also. Ajmer Shariff gives immense peace to its visitors, coming here with devotion, irrespective of there problems. the place is over crowded at all times so just be carefull with your belongings. also dont pay any attention to the loads of people trying to sell or attract you by something. it does not take more than 30 to 40 minutes in visiting the Dargah unless you sit for longer prayers. must visit if in ajmer or if crossing ajmer for some other place.

title: Good if you can get an escort service
review: having experienced the rush & crowd at the dargah this time we booked an escort before. He escorted us from Pushkar to dargah, got us in & ensured we get proper darshan...which really helped with the small kid.

title: must visit
review: the another must visit place of ajmer..very holy place..one of the famous dargah in india. not only muslim people but people from other caste also used to visit this holy dargah. whenever you visit ajmer sharif , do take blessings of moulana's who sat at mazar.

title: KHAWAJA GARIB NAWAJ'S  DARGAH WISH IS FULFILLED
review: I am very very lucky to be born in at the most historical city AJMER,

title: Very nice and blissful.
review: The place is bustling with devotees and is so lively. The diversity of the devotees gives one the confidence to be there. The staff is rather helpful, apart from the obvious cheaters whose sweettalk if one shouldnt be oblivious to!

title: Ajmer Sharif
review: We had a guide that took us to the Dargah and showed us where to buy the flowers, atar, etc.

title: Blissful experience, decadent staff
review: We visited the Dargah early in the morning, around 7:30 am. That possibly was the best choice we made, as the crowd was thin and the atomsphere perfect. We had plenty of time for worship, and did not get hushed out by the swarm of guardians doing their duty of keeping the crowds moving. The shrine is surrounded by musicians who churn out a variety of calming devotional songs. It felt great to sit amongst them and soak in the happenings within the complex.

title: Not much to see
review: The journey up to the Dargah was far more interesting than the Dargah itself which is perched on the top of a steep hill. Some people walk up the hill but I took an auto rickshaw. It really struggled to make the climb. The views of the surrounding hills and of course of Ajmer itself are worth the journey.

title: Gareeb Nawaaaz
review: Its a religious shrine, i visited there for the 3rd time since i have faith in there. Hazrat Khwaja Muinuddin Chisty blesses everyone who visits and fullfill there desires and needs. It turned out to be a blessing for me, My life got into the 2nd level.

title: visit here and feel the presence of peace.
review: the best part of the dargah is the huge handi(bowl) in which they cook the rice. its a beautiful atmosphere and a must see in ajmer

title: Friendly spirituality
review: I visited the Dargah to experience the sufi approach to Islam. All faiths are welcome. I visited the shrine, spent pleasant hours listening th the qawwali and returned at dusk for the ceremony of lighting the candle. I found the visitors to the shrine interested and friendly.

title: A milieu of all religions
review: It unites all religions under the shadow of the well-known saint Moinuddin Chisti whose dargah  was highly revered by Emperor Akbar as well. Hindus, Shikhs and Muslems throng to this pious place to pay homage and offer prayers.

title: great place
review: it is crowded place, if you still want to go find help, ask your hotel concierge to arrange it.

title: A Great Place: Symbol of Love and Harmoney
review: The place is located in a market area. People from all over the world and religion come to this place in the hope that Khwaja Sahab will fulfill their wishes. Beware of the people who will ask you for money in the name of guiding you inside the Dargah. Put off your shoes outside the Dargah. This service is available outside the Dargah. Buy Chader and flowers from wherever you want. Dont take any help from anyone. Specially shopkeepers and agents. Prayer in any form done through heart is always accepted. A place one should definitely go.

title: The Dargah Experience on Sunday , 1st Jan ,2012
review: Hi everyone,

title: A calm amidst the cacophony!
review: Luckily, on the say that I visited the Dargah, there was not much crowd present. It is a large premise, and well-run by the look of it.

title: Bliss
review: A pious place, but think 10 times before going in and visit the shrine, do not take kids in,,,as they can be squeezed because of crowd and rush. You can eat at local restaurant outside, they provide good quality food.

title: Blessed!
review: Needless to say, the Dargah Sharif is a beautiful and blessed place. It could do with lesser people asking for money, but make sure you donate only to the people who can give you a receipt in return. It is more helpful if you buy the chaddar / prasad for offering from outside the Dargah, as you could end up paying more later.

title: very busy place .. be carefull of your belongings ... !!!
review: our visit was made easy by the hotel which we stayed [the merwara palace- an heritage palace] which is very close to the place and the only five star facilty hotel in ajmer....the hotel organised a priest to come from the darghah and took us thru the VVIP channel therefore my 5 hours effort was reduced to 15 mins .. they treated us very well and made sure that we came back happy and safe ... i strongly recommend to go thru some credible hotels around ... !!!

title: Go to experience the experiencw
review: The road that leads to the shrine is crowded with eateries and hotels and shops selling lots of stuff. The soan halwa is popular but be sure of the quality before u buy as cheaper will have bad quality (mine had hair in it)   . The shrine is good to enjoy the atmosphere and it looks nice from outside in the evenings with lights but the tomb area is so crowded that my physical space was compromised and men used that to touch u if alone. It is extremely risky with no breather  . The place has a aura in itself with qwalas and the Sufi songs but the main place needs some serious management  and system . Cause if u go with lots of shrradha then u should have a minute to stand and pray to the nawab.

title: Not worth visiting Ajmer because of this
review: It is a mosque, and as such is the same as most other mosques. I frankly did not get why the guidebooks have a two page spread about this. They charge for the mandatory bag deposit, and you have to pay extra for the camera deposit as well (you cannot take a camera inside). Possibly trying to visit on a saturday early morning was a mistake, but it was incredibly crowded even for India, and full of beggars with a dizzying array of skin diseases, all too happy to grab the passing tourist.

title: Experience the Sufi culture
review: Dargah Sharif' or 'Holy Dargah' is one of the most sacred Muslim shrines in the country. Venerated by both Hindus and Muslims, it is the tomb of Khwaja Moin-ud-din Chisti. Every year Urs is held here for six days in his remembrance. The pilgrims make rich offerings called 'nazrana' at the sacred spot where the saint has been entombed that include rose and jasmine flowers, sandalwood paste, perfumes and incense that put in to the fragrance that floats in the air inside the shrine. Cash offerings are also made. Also offered by devotees are the 'chaadar', 'ghilaph' and 'neema'. Outside the holy place of the Dargah, professional singers called 'qawwals' sit in groups and sing hymns in the praises of the saint in a characteristic high-pitched voice. Be careful inside -- pickpocketing has been known to occur, particularly in the entrance to the shrine where people are packed very close together. Priests (Khadim) are available to act as guides and to perform ceremonies at the shrine. Men and women must cover their heads, and women must cover their shoulders. The beggars in the Dargah Bazaar can be quite persistent.

title: Holy place...best for wishing
review: Dargah is the best place to be in you just feel the power of the place..ist crowded..you have pilgrims evey where..its difficult to approach..but above all..its clearly the chram of the place..and once you are on the approach road you realise this is the best place to be in...

title: DIVINE
review: Beyond words, a must place to visit, but the  person sitting inside seemed to force donating money , so management needs to be taken care of .

title: Money matters at Gharib Nawaz
review: It was not crowded as i went there last tuesday. There are spotters who keep an eye on the people coming in the lane towards the shrine & pounce on them nr the gate for you to buy chaddar or flowers, they are inssistent. I had spotted my spotter & was ready for him but then he told me to keep my shoes & bag at "his" shop, took me inside & then there are a lot of guys sitting in the tomb area with an end of chaddar outside where he inssisted that i put max money i could while he prayed for me. The money i gave was promptly pocketed. Then he told me to go to another person & more money was demanded. I saw people coming in from the exit side bcoz they had made some kind of payment & more payment to go inside in the tomb area. There was no food being served. More money was told to be thrown inside a huge pot used for community cooking.

title: I have no words tell when I am here,
review: This is place of my Piro murshid Sarkar Hazrat Garib Nawaz R.A. I been to this place so many many times in my life, always my wish has full field here, again urs sharif starting here soon so I wished all there wishes will be full field again, as Salam walekum mere Piro murshid Sarkar Hazrat Garib Nawaz R.A.

title: Peace
review: You go to any holy place you will find peace. Being a hindu I visited Dargah Shariff. Had a lovely experience. It was my 1st Dargah visit. Though very crowded, I still found peace here.

title: Soulful place
review: What a sirene and divine place with a different level of peace and fulfillment. This dargah has its own charm and charisma with a lot of believers with their own miracle stories! Would love to go again and again.

title: Great visit
review: The only highlight in Ajmer was an amazing tuktuk ride to the Dargah Sharif, flying down narrow alleys around potholes, scooters, people, cows, pigs, and chickens all at breakneck speed and then walking around the Islamic shrine. Fascinating evening inside and all free but for the 10IRS paid for someone to look after our shoes.

title: Great Place
review: Incidentally I was reach Ajmer from Jaipur that is 134 km far, on 12.03.2019. I feel lucky their running 807th Urs of famous Sufi  sant Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti Dargah. Best time to visit in winters.

title: Dargah Shariff - AJMER - TRULY DIVINE
review: I had visited the Dargah Shariff on 17th February 2019.   It is really a good place. People of all Faiths go there and  submit themselves .  Eventhough  one has to pass through narrow and winding road,  on reachaing the Dargah, one will remain peaceful.

title: DIVINE
review: Beyond words, a must place to visit, but the  person sitting inside seemed to force donating money , so management needs to be taken care of .

title: Lucky and blessed to visit Dargah of Sarkar
review: What can you give to the almighty, he doesnt need anything. Khawaza ji, if you are connected to him, you understand sufiism, you are blessed. He called us and we were there right in middle of amazing crowd, you cant even put your feet but if he has called you, you are blessed. Our ziyarat was accepted and we were blessed. You must go with same mindset. Avoid peak times of afternoon namaj, Ramzan is best month to visit. His doors are open for all and always.

title: Holy place
review: Number of times we have visited Dargah Shariff . Very peaceful place and one gets peace of mind while offering prayer

title: Money matters at Gharib Nawaz
review: It was not crowded as i went there last tuesday. There are spotters who keep an eye on the people coming in the lane towards the shrine & pounce on them nr the gate for you to buy chaddar or flowers, they are inssistent. I had spotted my spotter & was ready for him but then he told me to keep my shoes & bag at "his" shop, took me inside & then there are a lot of guys sitting in the tomb area with an end of chaddar outside where he inssisted that i put max money i could while he prayed for me. The money i gave was promptly pocketed. Then he told me to go to another person & more money was demanded. I saw people coming in from the exit side bcoz they had made some kind of payment & more payment to go inside in the tomb area. There was no food being served. More money was told to be thrown inside a huge pot used for community cooking.
